original: de'i 'bras bu khyab ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu khyab ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the effect is pervaded by it.

original: lan 'ga' ma yin par kun du dpyad zin pa ni dpe nges par khyab pa rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: lan 'ga' ma yin par kun du dpyad zin pa ni dpe nges par khyab pa rtogs pa'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the pervasion of the example is the repeated analysis.

original: spyi dran pa yang dran par 'gyur /
analyzed: spyi dran pa yang dran par 'gyur /
translated: The memory of the general is the memory.üîΩIf it is ascertained that what is suitable to appear is seen, then it is suitable to call it nonexistent.

original: zhes bya ba ni snang du rung ba mthong bar nges na med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'o zhes bya ba dran pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang du rung ba mthong bar nges na med pa'i tha snyad du rung ba'o zhes bya ba dran pa ste /
translated: This is memory.

original: chos can gyi bye brag tu ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: chos can gyi bye brag tu ma byas pa'o //
translated: It is not a specific property of the subject.

original: de nyid dpe'i chos can la ni nges bas dran par byed pas so //
analyzed: de nyid dpe'i chos can la ni nges bas dran par byed pas so //
translated: It is the memory of the example-subject because of the ascertainment of that.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid kyis grub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba nyid kyis grub ces bya ba ni /
translated: It is established by seeing and not seeing.

original: dbe brjod pa ste /
analyzed: dbe brjod pa ste /
translated: This is the statement of the example.üîΩBecause of the difference in the phenomena of direct perception and non-observation, the nature of cause and effect is established by the realization of the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas chos tha dad pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin grub ba nyid yin yang rmongs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu tha snyad mi shes pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i phyir 'bras
analyzed: mngon sum dang mi dmigs pas chos tha dad pas rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa rtogs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin grub ba nyid yin yang rmongs pas rgyu dang 'bras bu tha snyad mi shes pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i phyir 'bras
translated: However, the ignorant, who do not understand the convention of cause and effect, are made to understand cause and effect through the forward and reverse pervasion.

original: bu dang rgyu dang ngo bo zhes tha snyad rtags dang rtags can tha dad pa ltar snang ba ni brtags pa tha dad kyi rang gi ngo bor ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bu dang rgyu dang ngo bo zhes tha snyad rtags dang rtags can tha dad pa ltar snang ba ni brtags pa tha dad kyi rang gi ngo bor ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: The son, the cause, and the nature appear to be different, like the sign and the signified, but they are not different in their own nature, like the sign and the signified.

original: tha snyad kyi de tsam du gzhan du 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni de tsam du zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad pa'o //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi de tsam du gzhan du 'grub ste zhes bya ba ni de tsam du zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba dang gtan tshigs kyi tha snyad pa'o //
translated: It is established as different in mere convention means that mere refers to the convention of the probandum and the logical reason.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dpe la'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni dpe la'o //
translated: The word different refers to the example.

original: yang na tha dad par ro //
analyzed: yang na tha dad par ro //
translated: Or it refers to being different.

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don dam par ro //
translated: This is in terms of the ultimate.

original: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar grub ces bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid gang gis grub ces bya'o //
analyzed: gal te mi dmigs pa de nyid ji ltar grub ces bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa nyid gang gis grub ces bya'o //
translated: If you ask, How is that non-apprehension established? it means by what is the non-apprehension of appearance established?

original: med pa de yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ni shes pa med pa yin par bsam pas so //
analyzed: med pa de yang zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa ni shes pa med pa yin par bsam pas so //
translated: And that non-existence means that non-apprehension is considered to be the non-existence of cognition.

original: gcig dmigs pa'i mthu yis zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis 'grub par ston to //
analyzed: gcig dmigs pa'i mthu yis zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa mngon sum gyis 'grub par ston to //
translated: By the power of apprehending one shows that non-apprehension is established by the direct perception of cognition.

original: rang gi yul gyi shes pa med pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs dgag pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi shes pa med pa las zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi lugs dgag pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is no cognition of it in one‚Äôs own domain‚Äù is the refutation of the opponent‚Äôs position.

original: pha rol kha cig ni de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pas med par smra'o //
analyzed: pha rol kha cig ni de la dmigs pa'i shes pa med pas med par smra'o //
translated: Some opponents say that it does not exist because there is no cognition that perceives it.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par 'dod pas dben pa'i shes pa yod pa las so //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par 'dod pas dben pa'i shes pa yod pa las so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause there is a cognition of a distinctive nature‚Äù is the position that is being argued for. It is because there is a cognition that is devoid of that.

original: thams cad mi rtogs na zhes bya ba ni pha rol 'dod pa ltar shes pa med pa tsam gyis des dben pa'i chos dmigs pa ma yin na'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtogs na zhes bya ba ni pha rol 'dod pa ltar shes pa med pa tsam gyis des dben pa'i chos dmigs pa ma yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf everything is not perceived‚Äù means that if, as the opponent claims, it is not the case that the mere absence of cognition is the perception of a phenomenon that is devoid of that.

original: gang la zhes bya ba ni chos can gang la'o //
analyzed: gang la zhes bya ba ni chos can gang la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to which‚Äù means in regard to which subject.

original: 'di dmigs la gzhan ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs dben pa 'di dmigs @257a * //
analyzed: 'di dmigs la gzhan ni mi dmigs pa'o zhes bya ba ni phyogs dben pa 'di dmigs @257a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is perceived, but the other is not‚Äù means that this absence of the object is perceived,

original: la ; dgag par 'dod pa mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: la ; dgag par 'dod pa mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: but the object that is being refuted is not perceived.

original: gal te nyams su myong ba yang gang gis grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba yang gang gis grub ce na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is experience established?‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag yang dag par myong ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i bye brag yang dag par myong ba ste /
translated: It is the experience of the particular nature of something.

original: rang rig pa las so //
analyzed: rang rig pa las so //
translated: It is from reflexive awareness.

original: de lta bas na shes pa bdag nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na shes pa bdag nyid kyi bye brag ste /
translated: Thus, the distinction of consciousness itself is

original: rang nyid phyogs dben pa rtogs pa'o zhes shes pa bdag nyid kyis grub cing de nyid kyi yul gyi don gyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: rang nyid phyogs dben pa rtogs pa'o zhes shes pa bdag nyid kyis grub cing de nyid kyi yul gyi don gyi bye brag ste /
translated: realized as isolated from other directions. Thus, consciousness is established by itself. And the distinction of the object that is its object is

original: 'di ni dmigs la 'di ni mi dmigs so zhes bye brag tu byed do //
analyzed: 'di ni dmigs la 'di ni mi dmigs so zhes bye brag tu byed do //
translated: made by the distinction, ‚ÄúThis is observed, but that is not observed.‚Äù

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa las gzhan du'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rang rig pa las gzhan du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means other than self-awareness.üîΩ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù means that just as the distinction that exists in consciousness itself is established, the distinction of the object itself is not established. The

original: don gyi yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang la yod pa'i bye brag gis grub pa ltar don gyi rang gi bye brag 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bzlog pa bsdu ba ni yang gi don to //
analyzed: don gyi yang zhes bya ba ni shes pa rang la yod pa'i bye brag gis grub pa ltar don gyi rang gi bye brag 'grub pa ni ma yin no zhes bzlog pa bsdu ba ni yang gi don to //
translated: meaning of ‚Äúalso‚Äù is to include the opposite.üîΩThe distinction that exists in consciousness, which is not mixed withüîΩother directions, is observed by itself. The distinction is established. The

original: rnam par shes pa la yod ba'i bye brag phyogs gzhan dang ma 'dres pa dmigs par rang nyid kyis grub pa'i bye brag las phyogs ni dmigs la dgag par bya ba ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la yod ba'i bye brag phyogs gzhan dang ma 'dres pa dmigs par rang nyid kyis grub pa'i bye brag las phyogs ni dmigs la dgag par bya ba ni mi dmigs so zhes bya ba grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: object of negation is not observed.

original: thams cad mi rtogs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad mi rtogs pa thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that everything would not be cognized.

original: zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por rgyas par bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni le'u dang por rgyas par bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained in detail in the first chapter.

original: khyad par can gyi myong ba la zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs dgag par bya bas dben pa'i myong ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi myong ba la zhes bya ba ni sa phyogs dgag par bya bas dben pa'i myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of the qualified is the experience of the place of negation as empty.

original: gzhan 'gog pa ni dgag par bya ba med do zhes rtogs bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'gog pa ni dgag par bya ba med do zhes rtogs bar byed pa'o //
translated: The negation of the other is the understanding that the negatee is absent.

original: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par can myong ba nyid yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par can myong ba nyid yin pa'o //
translated: The non-other is the experience of the qualified.

original: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par can dmigs pa nyid dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid kyis grub pa yin zhes bya ba ni khyad par can dmigs pa nyid dgag par bya ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is established by perception itself, because the perception of the qualified is the non-perception of the negatee.

original: de'i phyogs 'ba' zhig ni dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyogs 'ba' zhig ni dmigs par bya ba mi dmigs pa yin la /
translated: The mere place of that is the non-perception of the perceived.

original: de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni dmigs par byed pa'i mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: The cognition that perceives that is the non-perception of the perceiver.

original: de dag dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang dgag par 'dod pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ma yin pa dgag pas mi dmigs par gzhag ste /
analyzed: de dag dmigs pa'i rang bzhin yin yang dgag par 'dod pa'i chos kyi dmigs pa dag yin pa'i phyir ma yin pa dgag pas mi dmigs par gzhag ste /
translated: Although they are of the nature of perception, they are posited as non-perception by negative determination, because they are the perceptions of the phenomena that are the objects of negation.

original: grong gi phag ni bza' ba ma yin pas bzad med do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: grong gi phag ni bza' ba ma yin pas bzad med do zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of saying, ‚ÄúThe village pig is not fit to eat.‚Äù

original: de nyid de nges pa las zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa nyams su myong ba de nyid de nges pa las de nyams su myong ba ni phyogs 'ba' zhig myong ba yin gyi dgag par bya ba myong ba ni med do zhes bya ba dang /
analyzed: de nyid de nges pa las zhes bya ba ni ma 'dres pa nyams su myong ba de nyid de nges pa las de nyams su myong ba ni phyogs 'ba' zhig myong ba yin gyi dgag par bya ba myong ba ni med do zhes bya ba dang /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom the ascertainment of that itself‚Äù means that the experience of that itself, which is unmixed, generates the ascertainment that ‚Äúonly that is experienced,‚Äù that ‚Äúthe object of negation is not experienced,‚Äù

original: de'i yul ni phyogs dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres pa yin gyi dgag par bya ba med do zhes nges pa'i @257b shes pa skyed par byed pa ni de kho na yod do zhes nges bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'i yul ni phyogs dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres pa yin gyi dgag par bya ba med do zhes nges pa'i @257b shes pa skyed par byed pa ni de kho na yod do zhes nges bar byed pa ste /
translated: and that ‚Äúonly that exists, which is the cause for generating the ascertainment that ‚Äòthe object of negation and the unmixed object are the object of that,‚Äô

original: phyogs dang de nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang de nyams su myong ba kho na'o //
translated: and that ‚Äòonly the object and the experience of that exist.‚Äô

original: gzhan yod ba ni dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yod ba ni dgag par bya'o //
translated: The existence of something else is to be negated.

original: gzhan nyams su myong ba yang dgag par bya ba'i nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan nyams su myong ba yang dgag par bya ba'i nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The experience of something else is the experience of the object of negation.

original: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yang de yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig nges par dmigs pa'i yul dang shes pa de dag ma yin par dgag pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir don med pas grub zin pa'i phyir rmongs pa la med pa'i thaüîΩsnyad kyi yul nyid du sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: med pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu yang de yin no zhes bya ba ni gcig nges par dmigs pa'i yul dang shes pa de dag ma yin par dgag pas med pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir don med pas grub zin pa'i phyir rmongs pa la med pa'i tha snyad kyi yul nyid du sgrub par byed de /
translated: This is the proof of the object of the expression ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù for the confused, because the object of the ascertainment of one thing is the negation of the object of the cognition that is not that, and because the nature of non-existence is established by the absence of an object.

original: snang du rung ba'i don mi dmigs pa thams cad du de'i don med par shes par bya ba brjod par bya sta de ltar spyad par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: snang du rung ba'i don mi dmigs pa thams cad du de'i don med par shes par bya ba brjod par bya sta de ltar spyad par bya ba yin te /
translated: It should be said that all non-apprehension of an object that can appear is to be known as the non-existence of that object.üîΩIt should be practiced like this: for example, the non-apprehension of a person who can appear in a former house.

original: sngon gyi gnas khang na snang du rung ba'i mi dmigs ba lta bu'o zhes bsgrub pa ste rgyas par sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: sngon gyi gnas khang na snang du rung ba'i mi dmigs ba lta bu'o zhes bsgrub pa ste rgyas par sngar bshad zin to //
translated: This is the proof. It has been explained in detail above.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres pa'i don shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe existence of a cognition with a special nature‚Äù means a cognition of an object that is not mixed with what is to be negated.

original: gzhan du ni de 'dra ba'i shes pa med par spang ngo ;
analyzed: gzhan du ni de 'dra ba'i shes pa med par spang ngo ;
translated: Otherwise, such a cognition is to be rejected.

original: / mun par lag pas byug pa na zhes bya ba ni mun pa'i sa phyogs na bum pas stong pa myong ba med de mi mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: / mun par lag pas byug pa na zhes bya ba ni mun pa'i sa phyogs na bum pas stong pa myong ba med de mi mthong ba'i phyir ro snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: In the darkness, when one touches with one‚Äôs hand, etc. means that in a place covered with darkness, one does not experience the absence of a pot, because one does not see it.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba 'ba' zhig khyad par can myong ba ma yin gyi reg pa las kyang bum pa stong pa myong bas de nyid bye brag can myong pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni mthong ba 'ba' zhig khyad par can myong ba ma yin gyi reg pa las kyang bum pa stong pa myong bas de nyid bye brag can myong pa mi dmigs pa yin no //
translated: And there, etc. means that not only is the mere seeing of the pot not the experience of the absence of the pot, but also the touching of the pot is not the experience of the absence of the pot. Therefore, the non-apprehension of the experience of the absence of the pot is the non-apprehension of the experience of the absence of the pot.

original: 'bad pa dang bcas pa ni thogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'bad pa dang bcas pa ni thogs pa ste /
translated: With effort means with obstruction.

original: dgag par bya ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba yod pa'o //
translated: That which is to be negated exists.

original: 'dis ni yod na nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba bstan ta //
analyzed: 'dis ni yod na nges par dmigs par 'gyur ba bstan ta //
translated: This shows that if it exists, it must be apprehended.

original: 'bad pa med ba ni mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bad pa med ba ni mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: Without effort means without obstruction.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni bar snang stong pa'i reg pa dmigs pa de med na'o //
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni bar snang stong pa'i reg pa dmigs pa de med na'o //
translated: If that does not exist means if the apprehension of the absence of a pot in empty space does not exist.

original: gzhan med pa ni de las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dgag par 'dod pa med ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan med pa ni de las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa dgag par 'dod pa med ba'o //
translated: The absence of another means the absence of the negation of something else, such as a pot, which is intended.

original: yang pha rol kha cig na re dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la zhes bya ba dbang po gzugs snang ba dang bcas pa dang / shes pa phyogs ma 'dres la dmigs pa dag yod la de las gzhan pa ni phyogs las gzhan pa dgag par bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang pha rol kha cig na re dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la zhes bya ba dbang po gzugs snang ba dang bcas pa dang / shes pa phyogs ma 'dres la dmigs pa dag yod la de las gzhan pa ni phyogs las gzhan pa dgag par bya ba'o //
translated: The object that is other than that is the object of negation that is other than the object.

original: de las dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa las dgag par bya ba med par 'grub ste /
analyzed: de las dmigs pa'i shes pa med pa las dgag par bya ba med par 'grub ste /
translated: The nonexistence of the consciousness that observes that is established as the nonexistence of the object of negation.

original: 'dis ni dgag par bya ba la dmigs pa med pa tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dis ni dgag par bya ba la dmigs pa med pa tsam yin gyi /
translated: This shows that the object of negation is merely not observed.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la de las dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba nyes pa med pa khyad par can @258a * //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la de las dmigs pa med pa zhes bya ba nyes pa med pa khyad par can @258a * //
translated: The existence of another cause of the object and the nonexistence of the object from that is a special nonerroneousüîΩteaching.

original: bstan to // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni med pa khyad par can ma yin gyi /
analyzed: bstan to // de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni med pa khyad par can ma yin gyi /
translated: Otherwise, that is, if it were merely the nonexistence of consciousness and not a special nonexistence,

original: shes ba med pa tsam du gyur na'o //
analyzed: shes ba med pa tsam du gyur na'o //
translated: it would be merely the nonexistence of consciousness.

original: de lta na gnyid log ba la sogs pa ste brgyal ba dang / kha phar bltas pa la sogs pa gnas skabs na bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa gang dag ni med par yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na gnyid log ba la sogs pa ste brgyal ba dang / kha phar bltas pa la sogs pa gnas skabs na bum pa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa gang dag ni med par yang rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, it would follow that when one is asleep, or in a faint, or when one is looking away, and so on, the non-apprehension of a pot, and so on, would be the apprehension of non-existence.

original: med pa khyad par can bzung na ni gnyid la sogs pa med pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: med pa khyad par can bzung na ni gnyid la sogs pa med pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If one apprehends a special non-existence, then one does not establish the non-existence of sleep, and so on.

original: gnyid la sogs pa de la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ste snang ba dang yid la byed pa shes pa skyed par nus par ro //
analyzed: gnyid la sogs pa de la ni yon tan dang ldan pa'i dbang po la sogs pa ste snang ba dang yid la byed pa shes pa skyed par nus par ro //
translated: In that sleep, and so on, there are faculties, and so on, endowed with qualities, that is, there is light and attention that are able to produce consciousness.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gnyid log pa la sogs pa'o ;
translated: That is, sleep, and so on.

original: / shes pa med pa tsam gyi dmigs pa khyad par can med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / shes pa med pa tsam gyi dmigs pa khyad par can med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no special object of the mere absence of consciousness.

original: rgyu des de nyid yod bzhin du gang dag gi med par ma rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu des de nyid yod bzhin du gang dag gi med par ma rtogs pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: By that cause, it is not that one does not apprehend the non-existence of that which exists.

original: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa tsam du zad pas na ma rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: 'on kyang mi dmigs pa tsam du zad pas na ma rtogs pa yin /
translated: However, it is that one does not apprehend it because it is merely non-apprehended.

original: de mi dmigs pa de 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de mi dmigs pa de 'dra ba nyid med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That non-apprehension is just like that non-existence.

original: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod pa'i dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the non-apprehension of an object is due to the existence of another cause of non-apprehension.

original: de yod na ni gang dag gi med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: de yod na ni gang dag gi med par rtogs par 'gyur ro zhes zer ro //
translated: If it exists, then what is apprehended is the non-existence of those.

original: 'dir ma dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na zhes bya ba de nyid dbang po la sogs pa de dag gi yon tan 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir ma dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod na zhes bya ba de nyid dbang po la sogs pa de dag gi yon tan 'jug pa ste /
translated: Here, the existence of another cause of non-apprehension is the engagement of the qualities of those sense faculties, etc.

original: bya ba byed pa nyid brjod pa yin la yon tan de lta bu ni dmigs pa 'jug pas ston pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa nyid brjod pa yin la yon tan de lta bu ni dmigs pa 'jug pas ston pa ste /
translated: It is the very activity of the qualities that is stated, and that quality is indicated by the engagement of the object.

original: rang gi shes pa skyes pas yon tan ston pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa skyes pas yon tan ston pa yin te /
translated: The quality is indicated by the production of one‚Äôs own cognition.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'jug na'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni dmigs pa 'jug na'o //
translated: If it were like that, i.e., if the object were engaged,

original: gdong dbang po la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gdong dbang po la sogs pa yon tan dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: then the sense faculties, etc. would possess the quality,

original: rang gi 'bras bu dmigs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi 'bras bu dmigs pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their own effect, the engagement of the object, would exist.

original: de lta ma yin na yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Otherwise, they would not be cognized as possessing the quality.

original: de ltar na dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la zhes bya ba de yang dmigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dmigs pa'i rgyu gzhan yod la zhes bya ba de yang dmigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: Thus, the existence of another cause of the object is itself the object.

original: dmigs pa med na gnyid log pa la sogs pa ltar yon tan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med na gnyid log pa la sogs pa ltar yon tan gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no object, it will not be a cause of good qualities, like the sleep of a person who is dead.

original: de ltar dmigs pa yin dang kho bo cag gi smra ba nyid la brten par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar dmigs pa yin dang kho bo cag gi smra ba nyid la brten par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, if there is an object, it is our position that is correct.

original: khyod kyi dmigs pa khyad par can gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang don gang yod na snang du rung ba'i dmigs pa de nyid kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par can med pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyi dmigs pa khyad par can gyi dmigs pa zhes bya ba yang don gang yod na snang du rung ba'i dmigs pa de nyid kyi dmigs pa'i khyad par can med pa ste /
translated: And your special object, called a non-object, is just that object which is suitable to appear when a certain meaning exists, and it is not a special object when that meaning does not exist.

original: dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres par chos can gyi rnam pa gcig tu so sor nges pa'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba dang ma 'dres par chos can gyi rnam pa gcig tu so sor nges pa'o //
translated: It is a single, distinct aspect of a subject, not mixed with what is to be refuted.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa las @258b gzhan du don dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni mi dmigs pa nyid mi dmigs pa yin pa las @258b gzhan du don dmigs pa med pa mi dmigs pa yin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that if non-apprehension is not non-apprehension of non-apprehension, it is non-apprehension of the non-existence of an object.

original: don gyi med pa nyid ni dgag par bya ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don gyi med pa nyid ni dgag par bya ba med pa nyid do //
translated: The non-existence of an object is the non-existence of what is to be refuted.

original: de shes ba mi dmigs pa yis rtogs 'gyur na /
analyzed: de shes ba mi dmigs pa yis rtogs 'gyur na /
translated: If that is realized by the non-apprehension of the cognition of that,

original: shes pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid de shes pa de lta bu'i med do zhes bya ba rtags gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa mi dmigs pa ni med pa nyid de shes pa de lta bu'i med do zhes bya ba rtags gzhan gyis rtogs pa yin phyir te /
translated: Non-apprehension of consciousness is non-existence, and that consciousness is non-existent is understood by means of another sign.

original: de rang gis ni mi rtogs te med pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de rang gis ni mi rtogs te med pa yin pa'i phyir don gyi med pa bzhin no //
translated: It is not understood by itself, because it is non-existent, like the non-existence of an object.

original: rtags de yang mi dmigs pa nyid yin te dgag pa med pa'i snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: rtags de yang mi dmigs pa nyid yin te dgag pa med pa'i snga ma bzhin no //
translated: And that sign is non-apprehension itself, as before, without negation.

original: de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yang rtags gzhan la ltos te snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i rim gyis thug pa med 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir yang rtags gzhan la ltos te snga ma bzhin zhes bya ba'i rim gyis thug pa med 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because of the non-apprehension of that, it depends on another sign, as before.

original: gzhan yang dag par myong ba med par zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dag par myong ba med par zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Moreover, it is said: ‚Äúwithout the experience of reality.‚Äù

original: dgag par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par myong ba ste shes pa ste'o //
analyzed: dgag par bya ba'i phyir yang dag par myong ba ste shes pa ste'o //
translated: The experience of reality is consciousness, in order to negate it.

original: de med par shes pa rang gis rang rig pa'i stobs kyis phyogs ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa rang nyid kyis mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de med par shes pa rang gis rang rig pa'i stobs kyis phyogs ma 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i shes pa rang nyid kyis mi 'grub ste /
translated: Without that, consciousness is not established by itself through the power of self-awareness, with regard to a non-mixed object.

original: nges pa'i shes pa mi skyed na'o ;
analyzed: nges pa'i shes pa mi skyed na'o ;
translated: If it does not produce a definite cognition,

original: /'o na ni shes pa de'i khyad par gyis yul la yang dgag par bya ba med pa'i khyad par du mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: /'o na ni shes pa de'i khyad par gyis yul la yang dgag par bya ba med pa'i khyad par du mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But then it follows that the object is not cognized as qualified by the absence of negation due to the qualification of the cognition.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par myong ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par te 'di nyams su myong ba yod kyi 'di nyams su myong ba ni med do zhes rang gi khyad par rtogs pas gzhan don gang gi dmigs pa med pa'i don gzhan de yang de bzhin du
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par myong ba ni bdag nyid kyi khyad par te 'di nyams su myong ba yod kyi 'di nyams su myong ba ni med do zhes rang gi khyad par rtogs pas gzhan don gang gi dmigs pa med pa'i don gzhan de yang de bzhin du
translated: Thus, the experience of the object is the qualification of the self, and the experience of this is present, but the experience of that is not present. Since the qualification of the self is cognized, the object that is the referent of that is also cognized as nonexistent.

original: shes pa bzhin du med par rtogs par byed la gang gi dmigs pa yod pa ni yod par ro //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du med par rtogs par byed la gang gi dmigs pa yod pa ni yod par ro //
translated: Just as cognition is cognized as existent, the object that is its referent is cognized as existent.

original: gzhon nu ma len na re gang gi skyon med la zhes zer te /
analyzed: gzhon nu ma len na re gang gi skyon med la zhes zer te /
translated: Kumarila says, ‚ÄúWhen there is no fault.‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa'i rtags thug pa med pa la gang gi skyon med pa la'o //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa'i rtags thug pa med pa la gang gi skyon med pa la'o //
translated: When there is no fault of infinite regress in the sign of nonapprehension.

original: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa med pa ste shes pa med pa ma yin par smra ba dag gi ltar yang ma yin pa'i phyir yang thug pa med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin khyad par can gyi shes pa med pa ste shes pa med pa ma yin par smra ba dag gi ltar yang ma yin pa'i phyir yang thug pa med do //
translated: Even for those who say that there is no cognition that has a special nature, there is no infinite regress.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What then?

original: 'on kyang gang mi dmigs pas te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang mi dmigs pas te /
translated: However, it is due to the non-apprehension of that.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says this.

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir bum pa med do zhes bum pa de nyid med pa dmigs pa las med rtogs te /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir bum pa med do zhes bum pa de nyid med pa dmigs pa las med rtogs te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says: ‚ÄúOne understands non-existence from the apprehension of the non-existence of that very pot, saying ‚ÄòThere is no pot.‚Äô

original: rnam par rtog pa can des kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa las rang rgyud pa'i tshad ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can des kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa las rang rgyud pa'i tshad ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Even the conceptualist says that it is an inference based on itself, because it apprehends its own characteristic, not from non-conceptual cognition.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bum pa med do zhes shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni bum pa med do zhes shes pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù means ‚ÄúOne understands there is no pot.‚Äù

original: gang las te bum pa med pa gang las bum pa med do zhes shes ba'i rgyu yin pas @259a * //
analyzed: gang las te bum pa med pa gang las bum pa med do zhes shes ba'i rgyu yin pas @259a * //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom what?‚Äù means ‚ÄúFrom what is the cause of understanding there is no pot, saying ‚ÄòThere is no pot.‚Äô‚Äù

original: 'dod pa de ji ltar shes ba'i rkyen yin /
analyzed: 'dod pa de ji ltar shes ba'i rkyen yin /
translated: How is that asserted to be a condition of understanding?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: med pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚ÄúNon-existence does not depend on another non-existence,‚Äù and so on.

original: med pa ni med ba gzhan la mi ltos pas zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir med pa de gzhan gang la yang mi ltos te ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa ni med ba gzhan la mi ltos pas zhes bya ba ni med pa'i phyir med pa de gzhan gang la yang mi ltos te ltos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúNon-existence does not depend on another non-existence‚Äù means that because it does not exist, that non-existence does not depend on anything else, because it does not depend.

original: yang na med par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la mi ltos pa de rgyu phyi nas med pa'i phyir med pa byed na byed pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na med par bya ba'i phyir gzhan la mi ltos pa de rgyu phyi nas med pa'i phyir med pa byed na byed pa 'gog par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, if it is not dependent on another to make it non-existent, then if it makes it non-existent because the cause is later non-existent, then it would be the case that the agent is refuted.

original: de las byung ba ni med do snyam ba'i rtog ba can gyi tshad ma'o //
analyzed: de las byung ba ni med do snyam ba'i rtog ba can gyi tshad ma'o //
translated: The cognition that thinks ‚Äúit does not arise from that‚Äù is a valid cognition.

original: bye brag la brten pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bye brag skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bye brag la brten pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba bye brag skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a characteristic based on a particular, it is a characteristic of the arising of a particular.

original: de nyid la yang brten pa'i sgra 'jug pas so //
analyzed: de nyid la yang brten pa'i sgra 'jug pas so //
translated: Because the term ‚Äúbased on that‚Äù is used in that very context.

original: mtshan nyid de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa skyed par nus ba dang gzhan la bye brag skye ba ste bya ba byed pa dang rang grub pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid de dag dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa skyed par nus ba dang gzhan la bye brag skye ba ste bya ba byed pa dang rang grub pa'o //
translated: Possessing those characteristics means being able to generate cognition and giving rise to a particular in another, which is performing an action and being established oneself.

original: 'di la rkyen du 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bya ba ni bum pa med pa 'di med do zhes shes ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la rkyen du 'gyur ba mi srid do zhes bya ba ni bum pa med pa 'di med do zhes shes ba'o //
translated: It is impossible for it to be a condition here, meaning the cognition ‚Äúthis non-existent pot is non-existent.‚Äù

original: tshad ma rang rgyud pa dgag ba'i phyir mthong ba'i de ma thag pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: tshad ma rang rgyud pa dgag ba'i phyir mthong ba'i de ma thag pa can zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to refute the autonomous valid cognition, it says ‚Äúhaving the immediately preceding condition of seeing.‚Äù

original: khyed dang kho bo cag la mthun par grub pa'i mthong ba rtog ba med pa'i de ma thag pa can gyi shes pa mthong ba kho na'i stobs las skyes shing de kho na'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyed dang kho bo cag la mthun par grub pa'i mthong ba rtog ba med pa'i de ma thag pa can gyi shes pa mthong ba kho na'i stobs las skyes shing de kho na'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: For you and us, the cognition that is the immediately antecedent condition of the non-conceptual seeing is produced by the power of seeing alone, and it conforms to that alone.

original: de'i stobs kyis skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis rang dga'am rtags las ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis skye ba zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis rang dga'am rtags las ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its power‚Äù means that it is produced by the power of the object, not by itself or by a sign.

original: shes pa de yang dngos po de nyid du nus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rtogs par nus te shes pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad zin pa'i phyir dang po shes pa rtogs pa med pa de kho na don de la tshad mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa de yang dngos po de nyid du nus pa'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni rtogs par nus te shes pa nyid kyis yongs su bcad zin pa'i phyir dang po shes pa rtogs pa med pa de kho na don de la tshad mar 'gyur ro //
translated: And that cognition is capable of that object, i.e., it is capable of understanding, because it is already determined by cognition itself. The first cognition, which is non-conceptual, is valid cognition in regard to that object.

original: de ltar rnam pa gcig tu mthong ba rnam par rtog pa gcig tu nges pa can bskyed pas gcig tu nges pa de'i mthus gcig po las gzhan ba dgag par bya ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gcig tu mthong ba rnam par rtog pa gcig tu nges pa can bskyed pas gcig tu nges pa de'i mthus gcig po las gzhan ba dgag par bya ba med do //
translated: Thus, by producing a single aspect that is ascertained as a single concept, that single ascertainment by its power excludes the object that is other than that single one.

original: 'gog pa'i phyir snga ma kho na tshad ma yin gyi de'i mthu las skyes pa de'i rjes su byed pas ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa rnam par rtog pa can ni rang rgyud pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i phyir snga ma kho na tshad ma yin gyi de'i mthu las skyes pa de'i rjes su byed pas ma rtogs pa rtogs pa med pa rnam par rtog pa can ni rang rgyud pa'i tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Because it is refuted, only the former is valid knowledge, because it arises from the power of that, it conforms with that. The conceptual one that does not realize what was not realized is not an autonomous valid knowledge.

original: mthong ba rnam pa gzhan dang 'dres na ma mthong ngo zhes shes pa'i rtogs pa can de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthong ba rnam pa gzhan dang 'dres na ma mthong ngo zhes shes pa'i rtogs pa can de mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when seeing is mixed with another aspect, the conceptual one that knows ‚ÄúI did not see‚Äù does not occur.

original: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi mjug bsdu ba'i phyir de phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to summarize those, he says, therefore,

original: mthong ba kho nas don de rtogs zin pa dang / rtog pa can de yang mthong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i phyir rang dags rtogs pa med @259b pas so ;
analyzed: mthong ba kho nas don de rtogs zin pa dang / rtog pa can de yang mthong ba'i mthu las byung ba'i phyir rang dags rtogs pa med @259b pas so ;
translated: because that object is already realized by seeing alone, and because that conceptual one also arises from the power of seeing, it is not realized autonomously.

original: / gzhan gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir dbang bo la mi brten pa zhes sbyar te /
analyzed: / gzhan gyi stobs kyis bskyed pa de nyid bye brag tu bstan pa'i phyir dbang bo la mi brten pa zhes sbyar te /
translated: In order to specifically teach that it is generated by the power of another, he says, it does not rely on the sense faculties.

original: 'di mtshon pa yin pas bsgoms pa la brten pa ma yin no zhes kyang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di mtshon pa yin pas bsgoms pa la brten pa ma yin no zhes kyang sbyar ro //
translated: Because this is an illustration, it also applies to it does not rely on meditation.

original: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir mngon sum ma yin par bsams pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not direct perception.

original: phyi rol gyi don nges pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig par dogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don nges pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir rang rig par dogs pa ni med do //
translated: And because it is the cognition that ascertains the external object, there is no doubt that it is self-cognition.

original: rtags dag la brten pa ma yin pas ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rtags dag la brten pa ma yin pas ni rjes su dpag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: And because it is not based on a logical mark, it is not inference.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba nyid kyis sngon po rtogs zin pas de la nges pa'i rtogs pa ni sngon po de nyid la rtogs par byed par zad kyi ma rtogs pa'i dngos po'i chos rtogs pa med pas de tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mthong ba nyid kyis sngon po rtogs zin pas de la nges pa'i rtogs pa ni sngon po de nyid la rtogs par byed par zad kyi ma rtogs pa'i dngos po'i chos rtogs pa med pas de tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because blue is already understood by direct perception, the ascertainment of that is merely the understanding of that blue itself. Since there is no understanding of an entity's property that is not understood, that is not a valid cognition.

original: snang ba mi dmigs pa brten nas mi snang ba mi dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩma mthong bas med mi rigs phyir //
analyzed: snang ba mi dmigs pa brten nas mi snang ba mi dmigs pa bstan pa'i phyir / ma mthong bas med mi rigs phyir //
translated: In order to teach the non-observation of non-appearance based on the non-observation of appearance,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says, Because it is not reasonable that non-seeing is non-existence.

original: ma mthong ba tsam dang don yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam dang don yod par 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction between mere non-seeing and the existence of the object.

original: gzhan ni yod ba zlog byed de //
analyzed: gzhan ni yod ba zlog byed de //
translated: The other negates existence.

original: zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa las gzhan mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ni yod pa zlog byed de yod pa'i tha snyad ni yod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni snang ba mi dmigs pa las gzhan mi snang ba mi dmigs pas ni yod pa zlog byed de yod pa'i tha snyad ni yod pa'i 'bras bu yin pa'i phyir yod pa'o //
translated: This is because non-observation of the non-appearing is the negator of existence, because the convention of existence is the effect of existence.

original: de'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad zlog byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa'i tha snyad zlog byed de /
translated: Therefore, it is the negator of the convention of existence,

original: med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained that the effect of existence is nonexistent.

original: dper na rtags med rnam rtog sogs //
analyzed: dper na rtags med rnam rtog sogs //
translated: For example, the conception of non-existence, etc.

original: de rtags ltar snang ba la brten pa'i rtogs pas kyang gzhan yod sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de rtags ltar snang ba la brten pa'i rtogs pas kyang gzhan yod sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: Also, the conception of the existence of another based on a sign that is a deceptive sign is not an establishment of the existence of another,

original: med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not ascertained that the effect of existence is nonexistent.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i ma mthong ba tsam gyi mi dmigs pa 'di yang de 'bras nges pa de med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu nges pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag gis 'dod pa'i ma mthong ba tsam gyi mi dmigs pa 'di yang de 'bras nges pa de med pa'i tha snyad kyi 'bras bu nges pa can ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, this non-observation that is merely non-seeing, which is asserted by others, is not ascertained as the effect of the convention of nonexistence, because it is not ascertained that the effect of nonexistence is non-observation.

original: dngos po med na mi dmigs par mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med na mi dmigs par mi 'byung bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not ascertained that non-observation does not occur if the thing is nonexistent.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa sgrub par nus min no //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa sgrub par nus min no //
translated: Therefore, it is not possible to establish a negative.

original: de dngos po 'gog pa sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dngos po 'gog pa sgrub par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: That is not able to prove the negation of a thing.

original: gtan tshigs dang bo'i dbang byas te //
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang bo'i dbang byas te //
translated: The first reason is the basis.

original: zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa ste snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sngar bshad pa ste snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The appearance is not observed.

original: nges pa nyid ni sgrub byed yin te med par nges pa'o ;
analyzed: nges pa nyid ni sgrub byed yin te med par nges pa'o ;
translated: The ascertainment is the proof, the ascertainment of non-existence.

original: / rang gi ngo bo sbyor ba ni rtags snang ba mi dmigs pa rang gis sgrub ba'o //
analyzed: / rang gi ngo bo sbyor ba ni rtags snang ba mi dmigs pa rang gis sgrub ba'o //
translated: The application of the intrinsic nature is the proof by oneself of the reason, the non-observation of the appearance.

original: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gal ba yin no zhes bsdu ba'o //üîΩtshad mas gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig spangs pas cig shos gnas ba ma yin yang de gnyis bdag nyid gcig par @260a * //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gal ba yin no zhes bsdu ba'o // tshad mas gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gcig spangs pas cig shos gnas ba ma yin yang de gnyis bdag nyid gcig par @260a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúalso because of being harmed by valid knowledge‚Äù is also a contradiction, is the summary.

original: 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub bas 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: 'gal bar tshad ma gzhan gyis bsgrub bas 'gal ba ste /
translated: ‚ÄúBeing harmed by valid knowledge‚Äù means that when one is eliminated, the other is not present. Those two are established as being contradictory by another valid knowledge.

original: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa dag go //
analyzed: phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i chos dang ldan pa dag go //
translated: They are contradictory because they are phenomena that are mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: de nyid bshad par 'dod pas dper na ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'byung ba dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad par 'dod pas dper na ltos pa dang bcas pa dang nges par 'byung ba dag lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason is inconclusive‚Äù is that the reason is inconclusive because it proves the opposite of the probandum.

original: de nyid gcig par tshad mas gnod par bstan ba'i phyir tshad ma yang zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid gcig par tshad mas gnod par bstan ba'i phyir tshad ma yang zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason is contradictory‚Äù is that the reason is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason is inconclusive‚Äù is that the reason is inconclusive because it proves the opposite of the probandum.

original: gos la tshon bzhin zhes bya ba ltos pa dang bcas pa la nges pa med pas khyab par bstan to ;
analyzed: gos la tshon bzhin zhes bya ba ltos pa dang bcas pa la nges pa med pas khyab par bstan to ;
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason is contradictory‚Äù is that the reason is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the probandum.üîΩThe meaning of the statement ‚ÄúThe reason is inconclusive‚Äù is that the reason is inconclusive because it

original: / de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa ni nges pa med pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir gzhan ni rgyus 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag bar nges par 'gyur ba las bzlog bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir ltos pa dang bcas pa ni nges pa med pa nyid sgrub pa'i phyir gzhan ni rgyus 'jig pa'i phyir mi rtag bar nges par 'gyur ba las bzlog bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since the reason, ‚Äúbecause of dependence,‚Äù proves the very opposite of what is to be established, namely, that impermanence is not ascertained,

original: gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: it is contradictory.

original: nges ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa nges pa'i phyir 'gal ba'am skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: nges ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'jig pa nges pa'i phyir 'gal ba'am skyon med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of certainty‚Äù means that since destruction is certain, there is no contradiction or fault.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not so.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu de dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni 'jig pa'i rgyu de dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the causes of destruction.

original: rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag las pa'i bum pa'i rang gi rgyu las grub zin pa dag / rgyu gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa ste rag las par mthong ba med do //
analyzed: rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa la rag las pa'i bum pa'i rang gi rgyu las grub zin pa dag / rgyu gzhan la mngon du phyogs pa ste rag las par mthong ba med do //
translated: The pot, which is dependent on the collection of its own causes, is seen to be established from its own causes, and not to be dependent on other causes.

original: rang gi rang bzhin rdzogs zin pa'i phyir te ;
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin rdzogs zin pa'i phyir te ;
translated: Because its own nature is already complete,

original: gzhan de la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan de la rag ma las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not dependent on another.üîΩIf you say that it is so because it is certain that destruction occurs by the intrinsic reality of things,

original: gal te 'jig par byed pa 'di chos nyid yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig par byed pa 'di chos nyid yin pa'i phyir nges par 'byung ba de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: then that is so.

original: chos nyid yin par khas len pa de nyid skad cig ma yin 'dod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: chos nyid yin par khas len pa de nyid skad cig ma yin 'dod par 'gyur te /
translated: If you accept that it is the reality of things, then you must accept that it is momentary.

original: skad cig ma zhes bya ba grub ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na 'jig pa'i chos ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir sngon 'jig pa ma byung ba de phyis 'jig pa'i rgyus kyang mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis
analyzed: skad cig ma zhes bya ba grub ma thag tu 'jig pa'i rang bzhin ma yin na 'jig pa'i chos ma yin par bye brag med pa'i phyir sngon 'jig pa ma byung ba de phyis 'jig pa'i rgyus kyang mi 'byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir rang bzhin gyis
translated: If what is called ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù does not have the nature of disintegrating immediately after it has arisen, then it would not be different from what is not subject to disintegration. Therefore, it would follow that what did not disintegrate previously would not disintegrate later, even due to a cause of disintegration.

original: 'jig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would not disintegrate by its very nature.

original: gzhan yang chos nyid du khas len na de'am zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos nyid du khas len na de'am zhes bya ba ni dngos po'o //
translated: Moreover, if you accept that it is the reality of things, then it would be a thing.

original: rang bzhin nges na @260b bya bas sbyor te /
analyzed: rang bzhin nges na @260b bya bas sbyor te /
translated: If you say that it is definite by nature,

original: rgyu las mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du nges na'o //
analyzed: rgyu las mi rtag pa'i rang bzhin du nges na'o //
translated: then it would be definite as having the nature of impermanence due to a cause.

original: de rgyu zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: de rgyu zhes bya ba 'jig pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: That cause is the cause of disintegration.

original: de yang mi rtag pa'i rgyu rang bzhin nges na'o //
analyzed: de yang mi rtag pa'i rgyu rang bzhin nges na'o //
translated: Moreover, if it is definite as having the nature of impermanence due to a cause,

original: de'am zhes bya ba dngos po'am de'i skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de'am zhes bya ba dngos po'am de'i skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: then it would be a thing or it would be the cause of its arising.

original: 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rgyu gzhan ma yin pa'o //
translated: It would not be a different cause of disintegration.

original: rang bzhin yin par de dngos po rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin par de dngos po rang bzhin gyis 'jig pa'o //
translated: If it is by nature, then it is the nature of things to be destroyed.

original: de'i skyed par byed pa dang yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin par cis mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de'i skyed par byed pa dang yang 'jig pa'i rang bzhin du skyed pa'i rang bzhin yin par cis mi 'dod de /
translated: Why not accept that the cause of its production is also the cause of its destruction?

original: ji ltar na brgyud pas yin de skyed par byed pa las ni dngos po'o //
analyzed: ji ltar na brgyud pas yin de skyed par byed pa las ni dngos po'o //
translated: How is it indirectly? The thing is produced from the cause of its production.

original: des na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: des na ni 'jig pa'i rgyu las 'jig pa'o //
translated: Then its destruction is from the cause of its destruction.

original: thog ma nas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin skyed pa'i rgyu las skye ba na mi rtag pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid yin na ni phyis 'jig pa ni rgyus kyang 'jig pa de 'byung bar mi nus
analyzed: thog ma nas de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid la ni zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin skyed pa'i rgyu las skye ba na mi rtag pa de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid yin na ni phyis 'jig pa ni rgyus kyang 'jig pa de 'byung bar mi nus
translated: If it is not by nature, then if it is produced from the cause of its production, it is not by nature impermanent. Later, destruction cannot be produced by a cause,

original: te / nam mkha' bzhin no //
analyzed: te / nam mkha' bzhin no //
translated: like space.

original: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ma nges pa khyab par bshad pas so //üîΩres 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin ni ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis zhes bya ba ni gzhan la rag las pa ma nges pa khyab par bshad pas so // res 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin ni ma nges pa'o //
translated: By those, he explains the pervasion of dependence and uncertainty.üîΩAn occasional nature is uncertain.

original: ltos pa med pa nges pa ste //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa nges pa ste //
translated: Independence is certain.

original: gang zhig de yod gzhan ltos med //
analyzed: gang zhig de yod gzhan ltos med //
translated: That which exists in dependence on another does not exist in itself.

original: de dag di yod la nges yin //
analyzed: de dag di yod la nges yin //
translated: Those which exist in dependence on another are certainly not established.

original: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is the meaning of the verse.

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ni /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba ni /
translated: The contradiction of mutual exclusion is

original: res 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin dang ltos pa med pa dag go ;
analyzed: res 'ga' ba'i rang bzhin dang ltos pa med pa dag go ;
translated: the nature of being occasional and the nature of not depending on another.

original: / de dag nyid ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pas zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
analyzed: / de dag nyid ma nges pa yin pa'i phyir ma nges pas zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
translated: Since those are uncertain, he says, ‚Äúbecause of uncertainty,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Contradiction‚Äù means the contradiction of mutual exclusion.

original: tshad mas grub pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa nyid yin gyi tshad mas gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gsum pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: tshad mas grub pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa nyid yin gyi tshad mas gnod pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gsum pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Not established by valid cognition‚Äù means that it is the contradiction of mutual exclusion, not the contradiction of being harmed by valid cognition.

original: tshad mas gnod pa ma yin te phan tshun spangs pas gnod pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin par 'gyur bar ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod pa ma yin te phan tshun spangs pas gnod pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin par 'gyur bar ro //
translated: ‚Äú Not harmed by valid cognition‚Äù means that the contradiction of being harmed by valid cognition would be the observation of a contradiction of nature.

original: 'gal bas khyab ba'i rang bzhin yang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i 'gal ba ma yin yang ngo //
analyzed: 'gal bas khyab ba'i rang bzhin yang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i 'gal ba ma yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThe nature of that which is pervaded by contradiction‚Äù means that it is not a contradiction in the sense of being mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: de 'gal bar bzhag pa ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de 'gal bar bzhag pa ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: That is posited as a contradiction, but it is not mutually exclusive and exhaustive.

original: ltos pa dang bcas pa spangs pas nges par 'byung ba nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /üîΩde ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rang nyid med pa'i phyir ltos pa po med pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid spangs kyang nges par 'byung @261a * //
analyzed: ltos pa dang bcas pa spangs pas nges par 'byung ba nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir te / de ri bong gi rva la sogs pa rang nyid med pa'i phyir ltos pa po med pas ltos pa dang bcas pa nyid spangs kyang nges par 'byung @261a * //
translated: Because it is not established as a definite emergence that abandons dependence,

original: ba mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: since it is not the case that the rabbit‚Äôs horns and so on do not exist by themselves, and therefore there is no one who depends on them, so even though dependence is abandoned, definite emergence is not established.

original: de nyid la nges par 'byung ba spangs kyang ltos pa dang bcas par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la nges par 'byung ba spangs kyang ltos pa dang bcas par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not the case that definite emergence is abandoned, but dependence is not established.

original: 'o na ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it?

original: phan tshun spangs te gnas pas khyab pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de nges par 'byung ba dang / nges pa med pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: phan tshun spangs te gnas pas khyab pa'i rang bzhin yin pas de nges par 'byung ba dang / nges pa med pa ni phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i 'gal ba ste /
translated: The nature of that which is pervaded by contradiction is mutually exclusive and exhaustive. Therefore definite emergence and indefiniteness are mutually exclusive and exhaustive contradictions.

original: de'i dngos po dang de'i dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po dang de'i dngos po med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the entity of that and the non-entity of that.

original: nges pa de'i dngos po med pas khyab pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ni'o //
analyzed: nges pa de'i dngos po med pas khyab pa ni gzhan la ltos pa ni'o //
translated: The pervasion by the non-entity of that certainty is in relation to another.

original: de yang shugs kyis te phan tshun spangs pa ma yin yang de dang ldan pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis zhes bya ba brgyud pas 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de yang shugs kyis te phan tshun spangs pa ma yin yang de dang ldan pa'i chos yin pa'i phyir shugs kyis zhes bya ba brgyud pas 'gal ba ste /
translated: And that is by implication, because it is a property concomitant with that, although not mutually exclusive. Thus, by implication, there is an indirect contradiction.

original: de dang de med pa ni mngon sum du 'gal la /
analyzed: de dang de med pa ni mngon sum du 'gal la /
translated: The non-existence of that and that is a direct contradiction.

original: 'gal ba de dang ldan pa ni de'i shugs kyis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba de dang ldan pa ni de'i shugs kyis so //
translated: The property concomitant with that contradiction is by the force of that.

original: shugs kyis 'gal ba de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyor ba des rang bzhin 'gal ba las gzhan sbyor ba dang ; shugs kyis 'gal ba yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar bstan pa'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa las sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'gal ba de sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma ni mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba sbyor ba des rang bzhin 'gal ba las gzhan sbyor ba dang ; shugs kyis 'gal ba yang grub par 'gyur ro zhes de ltar bstan pa'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa mi dmigs pa zhes bya ba rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa las sbyor ba tha dad par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúnon-observation of the pervasion by contradiction‚Äù is a separate syllogism from the observation of the contradiction of intrinsic identity, and is taught in order to show that.

original: chos can gyi ngag dag gi sbyor bar brjod pa ni don chos can yod pa la rung gi med pa la mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: chos can gyi ngag dag gi sbyor bar brjod pa ni don chos can yod pa la rung gi med pa la mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe expression of the syllogism with respect to the subject is appropriate when the object-subject exists, but not when it does not exist‚Äù is a response to the opponent‚Äôs objection.

original: de sgra'i don phyi'i don ma yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de sgra'i don phyi'i don ma yin par bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the object of the word is not an external object.

original: de bkag par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni the tshom la sogs pa dgag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de bkag par mi 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni the tshom la sogs pa dgag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt would not be a negation‚Äù means that it would not be a negation of doubt, etc.

original: ci'i phyir sbyor ba brjod par mi bya zhe na /üîΩyul med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sbyor ba brjod par mi bya zhe na / yul med pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Why is it not expressed as a syllogism?üîΩThe statement ‚Äúbecause there is no object‚Äù is the response.

original: rtags gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: rtags gzhi ma grub pa'i phyir ;
translated: The reason is not established.

original: dgag pa'i sbyor ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dgag pa'i sbyor ba mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the syllogism of negation is not perceived.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pas yod bzhag pa ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba la yod par snang ba ni yod par rten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas yod bzhag pa ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba la yod par snang ba ni yod par rten pa'o //
translated: The appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.

original: med par snang ba ni med par rten pa'o //
analyzed: med par snang ba ni med par rten pa'o //
translated: The appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.

original: yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar snang ba ni gnyi gar rten pa ste bum pa dang ri bong gi rva dang lus can ma yin zhes bya ba rnams dang go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa gnyi gar snang ba ni gnyi gar rten pa ste bum pa dang ri bong gi rva dang lus can ma yin zhes bya ba rnams dang go rims bzhin te /
translated: The existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.

original: lus can ma yin pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa yod par snang ba dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag tu snang ba gnyi gar bstan pa /üîΩder ni phyi dngos nyer blangs te //
analyzed: lus can ma yin pa ni nam mkha' la sogs pa yod par snang ba dang / ri bong gi rva la sogs pa med pa dag tu snang ba gnyi gar bstan pa / der ni phyi dngos nyer blangs te //
translated: The appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.

original: zhes bya ba gtso bo la sogs pa dgag @261b pa der ni phyi'i dngos zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa la snang ba las gzhan ba rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gtso bo la sogs pa dgag @261b pa der ni phyi'i dngos zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa la snang ba las gzhan ba rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence.üîΩThe appearance of both existence and nonexistence is the appearance of both.üîΩThe existence of something posited by conceptualization is the appearance of existence to conceptualization.üîΩThe appearance of nonexistence is the appearance of nonexistence

original: de nye bar bzung ste dgag par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de nye bar bzung ste dgag par bsgrub par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: and it is not to be refuted by taking it in that way.

original: de ltar na yang sgra don med min te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gtso bo la sogs pa chos can med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang sgra don med min te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gtso bo la sogs pa chos can med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the word is not meaningless, for the subject, such as the principal, which appears in the conceptual differentiation, does not not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na sbyor ba brjod phyir te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba med pa ni brjod pa mi srid pas so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na sbyor ba brjod phyir te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba med pa ni brjod pa mi srid pas so //
translated: Why? Because of the expression of the connection, for the expression of the connection is not possible without the appearance in the conceptual differentiation.

original: de'i rnam ba can gyi rnam par skyed pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni smra ba bo sgras ston pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i rnam ba can gyi rnam par skyed pa'i phyir yang ngo zhes bya ba ni smra ba bo sgras ston pa yang ngo //
translated: And also because of the generation of the form of that, i.e., the speaker also expresses the word.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i shes pa la zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang nyan pa po'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i shes pa la zhes bya ba ni ston pa dang nyan pa po'o //
translated: The cognition of the cause and effect refers to the teacher and the hearer.

original: so sor mi snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don to ;
analyzed: so sor mi snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don to ;
translated: The meaning of the individual non-appearance is the individual intrinsic identity.

original: / so sor rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / so sor rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the individual self-awareness.

original: zhes bya ba rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba la rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rgol ba dang / phyir rgol ba la rang rig pa'i mngon sum gyis grub pa'o //
translated: This is established by the self-awareness direct perception of the proponent and the opponent.

original: 'di la gzhan rigs pa ni med de /
analyzed: 'di la gzhan rigs pa ni med de /
translated: There is no other reasoning here.

original: gzhan de brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan de brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the other is false.

original: yang dag par ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par ma thob pa ni ma 'ongs pa'o //
translated: That which is not yet obtained is future.üîΩBecause there is no contradiction with this,

original: 'di la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba 'di la gnod pa med pa de med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba 'di la gnod pa med pa de med par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no contradiction with the appearance in conceptual cognition, it does not become nonexistent.

original: 'di dag blo don yul can 'dod //
analyzed: 'di dag blo don yul can 'dod //
translated: These are asserted to be the objects of cognition.

original: ces bya ba ni sgra 'di dag thams cad dngos su ni blo la snang ba'i don can no //üîΩde la yang rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu med pa can bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa dgag pa de la yang pha rol gyis ji ltar bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni sgra 'di dag thams cad dngos su ni blo la snang ba'i don can no // de la yang rnam par gzhag pa'i mtshan nyid rgyu med pa can bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa dgag pa de la yang pha rol gyis ji ltar bzhag pa ste /
translated: All these words are actually the objects of the appearance in cognition.üîΩRegarding that, the definition of the established is the proof of the causeless,

original: mi gsal ba dang rtag pa dang spyi dang skyed par byed pa dag tu blo la snang ba de'i phyi'i rgyu med pa can du sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa'i yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi gsal ba dang rtag pa dang spyi dang skyed par byed pa dag tu blo la snang ba de'i phyi'i rgyu med pa can du sgrub par byed pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa'i yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: which is the negation of primal matter and so on. In that, the opponent posits the appearance in cognition as unclear, permanent, universal, and productive. Therefore the proof of the causeless is established because of the nonobservation of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gzhi sgrub pas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i gzhi sgrub pas so //
translated: because the basis of the appearance in conceptual thought is established.

original: de blo nye bar gzhag pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i snang ba'i blo de'i phyi'i rgyu ma yin no zhes nye bar sgrub pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: de blo nye bar gzhag pa'i don du zhes bya ba ni gtso bo la sogs pa'i snang ba'i blo de'i phyi'i rgyu ma yin no zhes nye bar sgrub pa'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of establishing that, it is said, ‚Äúthat is not the cause of the appearance of the idea of primal substance, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dir ni dngos po nyid sems te //
analyzed: 'dir ni dngos po nyid sems te //
translated: Here, ‚Äúthe idea of primal substance, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dgag pa la sogs pa 'dir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dgag pa la sogs pa 'dir ro //
translated: refers to the negation of primal substance, etc.

original: dngos po nyid yin nam ma yin pa sems kyi sgra'i don rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid yin nam ma yin pa sems kyi sgra'i don rnam par rtog pa la snang ba ni sems pa'o //
translated: The idea of the meaning of the word ‚Äúmind‚Äù as either a real entity or not a real entity is the appearance in conceptual thought.

original: dngos po kho na sems pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'bras bu skyed dang 'brel phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po kho na sems pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na / 'bras bu skyed dang 'brel phyir ro //
translated: Why is it that only a real entity is the idea?

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause of the connection with the production of an effect.‚Äù

original: dngos po kho nas 'bras bu skyed la rtog pa dang ldan pa yang 'bras bu yod pa kho na la blang dang dor bar rtog go //
analyzed: dngos po kho nas 'bras bu skyed la rtog pa dang ldan pa yang 'bras bu yod pa kho na la blang dang dor bar rtog go //
translated: Only a real entity produces an effect. And one who has an idea about an existent effect only has an idea about what is to be accepted or rejected.

original: @262a * // de kho na nyid kyang yang dag par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas so //
analyzed: @262a * // de kho na nyid kyang yang dag par mi rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pas so //
translated: Because reality is not understood correctly.

original: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa thams cad do //
analyzed: 'di dag thams cad ni zhes bya ba ni rtog pa dang ldan pa thams cad do //
translated: ‚Äú All of these‚Äù refers to all those who have conceptual thoughts.

original: gsungs te zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang bos so //
analyzed: gsungs te zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang bos so //
translated: ‚Äú It has been said‚Äù by the master DignƒÅga.

original: brjod zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro //
analyzed: brjod zin pa yin no zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro //
translated: ‚Äú It has been explained‚Äù in chapter two.

original: grangs can dag gtso bo yod pa nyid spyi de sgrub par 'dod nas /
analyzed: grangs can dag gtso bo yod pa nyid spyi de sgrub par 'dod nas /
translated: The SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, wishing to prove the existence of the primal substance, say,

original: yod pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs na //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa rang bzhin gtan tshigs na // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe reason is existence.‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äú The reason is existence.‚Äù

original: yod pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú Because it exists, it is impermanent.‚Äù

original: spyi yod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya min te /
analyzed: spyi yod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya min te /
translated: How is the existence of a universal not the probandum?

original: bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It becomes the probandum.

original: gal te rtag pa dang mi gsal ba dang / skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag rjes su 'gro med ce na zhes bya ba ni dpe ma grub po zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rtag pa dang mi gsal ba dang / skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i bye brag rjes su 'gro med ce na zhes bya ba ni dpe ma grub po zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference between permanent and impermanent, unclear and clear, and productive and nonproductive is not universal, then the example is not established.

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dag 'gal 'gyur te /
