analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub bya dag 'gal 'gyur te /
translated: The reason is contradictory to the probandum,

original: khyed kyi gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba yang sgrar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa ni bum pa la med la rtags kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: khyed kyi gtan tshigs byas pa'i phyir mi rtag ces bya ba yang sgrar 'gyur ba'i mi rtag pa ni bum pa la med la rtags kyang de dang 'dra'o zhes pa'o //
translated: because you make it a reason.  The impermanence that is called ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù does not exist in a pot, and the reason is similar to that.

original: gal te 'di ltar bye brag ces bya ba nas gsungs te zhes bya ba'i bar ni bye brag rjes 'gro med ces zhes bya ba'i cha 'chad do //
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar bye brag ces bya ba nas gsungs te zhes bya ba'i bar ni bye brag rjes 'gro med ces zhes bya ba'i cha 'chad do //
translated: If it is like this, the statement up to ‚Äúthe universal is not a quality of the particulars‚Äù explains the part ‚Äúbecause there is no following of the particulars.‚Äù

original: tshad ma yul gyis mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma yul gyis mi shes pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the valid cognition does not know the object, that is, because the particulars are not established by valid cognition.

original: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: gsungs so zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is said‚Äù is by master DignƒÅga.

original: gtan tshigs kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag la brten na bum par gyur pa'i yod pa yang dpe la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyang yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag la brten na bum par gyur pa'i yod pa yang dpe la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is also a reason‚Äù is because if it depended on the particulars, existence that is a pot would not exist in the example.

original: bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba kho na skyon dang bcas pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni yod pa bye brag gis te ;
analyzed: bye brag gis bsgrub par bya ba kho na skyon dang bcas pa ma yin gyi zhes bya ba ni yod pa bye brag gis te ;
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúIn particular, it is not only the probandum that is faulty.‚Äù

original: gtso bo yod pa spyi nyid dang rtag pa dang skyed bar byed pa'am dbang phyug yod pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang rjes su gzung ba dang / chad pas gcod par byed pa la sogs pa bye brag tu byas te sgrub na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yod pa nyi tsher ma zad de 'on kyang yod pa gtan tshigs su byas na yang rjes su 'gro ba med par skyon mtshungs pa yin te
analyzed: gtso bo yod pa spyi nyid dang rtag pa dang skyed bar byed pa'am dbang phyug yod pa rtag pa dang bde ba dang rjes su gzung ba dang / chad pas gcod par byed pa la sogs pa bye brag tu byas te sgrub na rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i skyon yod pa nyi tsher ma zad de 'on kyang yod pa gtan tshigs su byas na yang rjes su 'gro ba med par skyon mtshungs pa yin te
translated: If one proves the existence of a general principle, such as the existence of a primal substance, or the existence of a permanent, blissful, pure, and autonomous ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, then not only is there the fault of the absence of a positive concomitance, but also if one uses existence as a reason, there is the fault of the absence of a positive concomitance.

original: / bum par gyur pa'i yod pa ni sgra la med pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin la sgrar gyur pa'i yod pa ni dpe la med pas so //
analyzed: / bum par gyur pa'i yod pa ni sgra la med pa'i phyir ma grub pa yin la sgrar gyur pa'i yod pa ni dpe la med pas so //
translated: This is because the existence of a pot does not exist in sound, and the existence of sound does not exist in the example.

original: skyon 'di med de zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: skyon 'di med de zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'o //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThis fault does not exist.‚Äù

original: yod pa tsam zhig nyer blangs te //
analyzed: yod pa tsam zhig nyer blangs te //
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúExistence alone is accepted.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba rtag pa @262b dang skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bor te'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba rtag pa @262b dang skyed par byed pa la sogs pa'i bye brag bor te'o //
translated: Thus, it is said, ‚Äúhaving discarded the distinctions of permanence, production, etc.‚Äù

original: don 'ga' grub par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: don 'ga' grub par mi 'gyur la /
translated: ‚ÄúNo meaning is established‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi 'dod pa'am ma rtogs pa'i don no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyod kyi 'dod pa'am ma rtogs pa'i don no //
translated: means that your assertion or the meaning that is not understood.

original: yod pa tsam ste kho bo cag kyang yod pa tsam ni 'gog par mi byed do //
analyzed: yod pa tsam ste kho bo cag kyang yod pa tsam ni 'gog par mi byed do //
translated: ‚ÄúWe also do not refute mere existence.‚Äù

original: bye brag gang la yang yongs su ma sbyar bar smras pas zhes bya ba ni rang dgar dang skyed par byed pa dang // rtag pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gang lam sbyar ba'i yod pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag gang la yang yongs su ma sbyar bar smras pas zhes bya ba ni rang dgar dang skyed par byed pa dang // rtag pa la sogs pa'i bye brag gang lam sbyar ba'i yod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving stated mere existence without applying it to any distinction‚Äù means that existence is not applied to any distinction, such as ‚Äúspontaneously present‚Äù or ‚Äúproductive‚Äù or ‚Äúpermanent,‚Äù etc.

original: yod pa de ni sgrub byed na //üîΩbye brag kho nar bsgrub bya yin //
analyzed: yod pa de ni sgrub byed na // bye brag kho nar bsgrub bya yin //
translated: ‚ÄúThat existence is established‚ÄùüîΩ‚Äúis only a distinction that is to be established.‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na rtags don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzhan du na rtags don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the reason would be meaningless.

original: gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug yod par 'dod pas kyang rang dbang dang bde ba dang 'byin pa po la sogs par dang / des ni de'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu bsgrub pa'i rtags des sam smra ba po de gtso bo la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung zhes bya ba ni dbang phyug yod par 'dod pas kyang rang dbang dang bde ba dang 'byin pa po la sogs par dang / des ni de'i rang bzhin sgrub par byed pa yin te zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu bsgrub pa'i rtags des sam smra ba po de gtso bo la sogs pa de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat is the proof of its nature‚Äù means that the reason that proves that is the proof of the specific nature of the creator, and so on.üîΩ‚ÄúThere is no pervasion‚Äù means that such a thing is never seen by a valid cognition.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta bu tshad mas gar yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzhi bye brag gis bye brag can du 'dod na zhes bya ba ni ri'i me zhes bya bar sgrub na'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no zhes bya ba ni de lta bu tshad mas gar yang mthong ba med pa'i phyir gzhi bye brag gis bye brag can du 'dod na zhes bya ba ni ri'i me zhes bya bar sgrub na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf one asserts that the specific is based on the particular‚Äù means that if one proves that it is the fire of the mountain.

original: de ltar gzhi des bye brag tu byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ri'i me yod do zhes sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar gzhi des bye brag tu byed pa ni ma yin te zhes bya ba ni ri'i me yod do zhes sgrub pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not that the specific is based on that particular‚Äù means that it is not the case that the proof of the existence of the fire of the mountain is the proof of the specific.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhat, then, is it?‚Äù

original: mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa ni bye brag ste /
analyzed: mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa ni bye brag ste /
translated: The specific is the exclusion of the non-possessor.

original: 'di la me yod pa'o zhes me dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'o zhes le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di la me yod pa'o zhes me dang mi ldan pa rnam par gcod pa'o zhes le'u gnyis par bshad zin to //
translated: This is the exclusion of the non-possession of fire, as was explained in the second chapter.

original: de la spyi kho na zhes bya ba ni chos can de la spyi me tsam ste cha bye brag tu ma byas pa ldan par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: de la spyi kho na zhes bya ba ni chos can de la spyi me tsam ste cha bye brag tu ma byas pa ldan par 'grub pa'o //
translated: The phrase there is only the universal means that the subject is established as possessing the mere universal of fire, not as possessing a particular aspect of fire.

original: gang la yang med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang la yang med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it does not exist in anything else.

original: bye brag med pa ni zhes bya ba ni dper 'dod pa'i chos can gang la yang rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / rang dbang can tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir bye brag de lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag med pa ni zhes bya ba ni dper 'dod pa'i chos can gang la yang rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / rang dbang can tshad mas ma grub pa'i phyir bye brag de lta bu dag dang ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba med pa yin no //
translated: The phrase without distinction means that, for example, the subject, space, is not established as possessing such distinctions as permanence, pleasure, and independence, because those distinctions are not established by valid cognition. Thus, there is no pervasion by those distinctions.

original: gal te ji ltar med de zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ji ltar med de yod pa de shes bya ba la sogs pa yin la de lta na shes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar med de zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba ji ltar med de yod pa de shes bya ba la sogs pa yin la de lta na shes bya ba la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba can yin no zhe na /
translated: If one says, How is it that there is no pervasion? meaning, How is it that there is no pervasion by existence? and so on, and if one says, In that case, existence and so on are the pervasion, then one should reply as follows.

original: ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub zin pa'i phyir dang / de grub pa yang khyed kyi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ci zhig 'grub par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni shes bya ba la sogs pa ni grub zin pa'i phyir dang / de grub pa yang khyed kyi 'dod pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúWhat is established?‚Äù‚Äîit is not the case that the object of knowledge, etc. are established, and it is not your intention that they are established.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba ni don @263a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo'i snang ba ni don @263a * //
translated: The appearance of the conceptual mind is not the object.

original: la ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba dang 'byin pa po dag snang la de'i rten rang gi mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: la ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa ni rtag pa dang bde ba dang 'byin pa po dag snang la de'i rten rang gi mtshan nyid sgrub par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: ‚ÄúThe object‚Äù means that the conceptual mind appears as permanent, blissful, and the creator, and is not the basis of the establishment of its own characteristic.

original: du bas me la sogs pa yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rten grub pa nyid yin pa bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: du bas me la sogs pa yang rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rten grub pa nyid yin pa bzhin zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Just as smoke, fire, etc. are established as the basis of the appearance in the conceptual mind.

original: sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni gal te me la sogs pa ltar rten rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don can bsgrub bar nus na ni sgrubs shig ste /
analyzed: sgrubs shig ces bya ba ni gal te me la sogs pa ltar rten rang gi mtshan nyid kyi don can bsgrub bar nus na ni sgrubs shig ste /
translated: ‚ÄúProve it!‚Äù‚Äîif you can prove that the basis is an object that has its own characteristic, like fire, etc., then prove it!

original: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir nus pa mi srid snyam du dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: dpe ma grub pa'i phyir nus pa mi srid snyam du dgongs pa'o //
translated: But it is impossible, because the example is not established.

original: gal te phyi rol gyi don gyi rten can nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te phyi rol gyi don gyi rten can nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa ste /
translated: If it is not established as the basis of external objects, then the specific characteristics of the primary nature and so on,

original: dbang phyug la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ste /
analyzed: dbang phyug la sogs pa de'i mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ste /
translated: that is, of ƒ™≈õvara and so on,

original: phyi'i don gyi mtshan nyid la mi brten na ste /
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi mtshan nyid la mi brten na ste /
translated: are not based on the characteristics of external objects.

original: de lta bur mi 'grub na rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i sgra'i don tsam ste /
analyzed: de lta bur mi 'grub na rtags zhes bya ba la sogs pa de'i sgra'i don tsam ste /
translated: If they are not established in that way, then the mere sound meaning of the term ‚Äúreason‚Äù and so on,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyis stong pa'o //
translated: is empty of its own characteristics.

original: rten gyi chos de dag nye bar brtags pa yin te /
analyzed: rten gyi chos de dag nye bar brtags pa yin te /
translated: Those dependent phenomena are imputed,

original: gtso bo'i bye brag gi rang bzhin rten sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i rten gyi don btags pa tsam du zad kyi me la sogs pa ltar don dam pa'i rten ni mi srid do //
analyzed: gtso bo'i bye brag gi rang bzhin rten sgrub par byed do zhes bya ba'i rten gyi don btags pa tsam du zad kyi me la sogs pa ltar don dam pa'i rten ni mi srid do //
translated: because the meaning of the basis, which is said to be established as the nature of the specific characteristics of the primary nature, is mere imputation. It is not possible that there is a ultimate basis, like fire and so on.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rten ma grub pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rten ma grub pa la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúbecause the basis is not established.‚Äù

original: don dam pa'i rten dang rjes su 'gro ba gar yang ma grub pa'i phyir de bye brag med pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa shes pa la sogs pa de rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rjes su 'gro ba grub pa med pas rnam
analyzed: don dam pa'i rten dang rjes su 'gro ba gar yang ma grub pa'i phyir de bye brag med pas zhes bya ba ni yod pa shes pa la sogs pa de rtag pa dang bde ba la sogs pa'i bye brag rjes su 'gro ba grub pa med pas rnam
translated: Since the ultimate is not established anywhere as a basis or as a subsequent state, it is said to be ‚Äúwithout distinctions.‚Äù Since the existence of consciousness and so on is not established as a subsequent state with the distinctions of permanence, bliss, and so on, it isüîΩ

original: par rtog pa la snang ba'i rten gyis don nyid don yod pa tsam nyid de bye brag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: par rtog pa la snang ba'i rten gyis don nyid don yod pa tsam nyid de bye brag dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because the ultimate basis and the subsequent pervasion are not established anywhere, it is said to be ‚Äúwithout distinctions.‚Äù Since the existence of consciousness and so on is not established as having the distinctions of permanence, pleasure, and so on, the mere existence of the object that is the basis of appearance to conceptual consciousness is just without distinctions.

original: don med ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rtags so //
analyzed: don med ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rtags so //
translated: ‚Äú It is not nonexistent‚Äù is the reason.

original: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba yod pa rnams so //
analyzed: gzhan du ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba yod pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Otherwise‚Äù and so on indicate the existence of the pervasion.

original: me spyi de chos can gyi bye brag gis dpen pa'i me tsam du ba tsam dang 'brel pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: me spyi de chos can gyi bye brag gis dpen pa'i me tsam du ba tsam dang 'brel pa grub pa'o //
translated: The mere fire that is the property of the subject is established as being related to mere smoke.

original: de nyid chos can de lam grub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: de nyid chos can de lam grub pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Since that is established as the property of the subject, there is no fault in the proof.

original: de spyi yis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos can 'brel pa'i spyi yin pa'i phyir chos can la mi ldan pa spangs kyang 'brel pa'i spyi dang rjes su 'gro ba med do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de spyi yis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang chos can 'brel pa'i spyi yin pa'i phyir chos can la mi ldan pa spangs kyang 'brel pa'i spyi dang rjes su 'gro ba med do snyam pa'o //
translated: The phrase in general means that even though the subject is devoid of the relation to the general property of the probandum, there is no concomitance with the general property of the relation.

original: de ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i bdag nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa'i bdag nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba grub zin pa'i bdag nyid dang rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase concomitance in the nature of that means that the probandum is concomitant with the nature of what is already established.

original: byed pa ni zhes bya ba de dang rtags 'brel @263b ba 'dzin pa rigs pa la mkhas pa su yang med de dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byed pa ni zhes bya ba de dang rtags 'brel @263b ba 'dzin pa rigs pa la mkhas pa su yang med de dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No one who is skilled in logic would say that the reason is the cause of the establishment of the probandum. This is because there is no purpose in that.

original: 'o na ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba ston ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rjes su 'gro ba ston ce na /
translated: If it is asked, Well then, how is concomitance taught?

original: pha rol gyis go bar byed pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: pha rol gyis go bar byed pa ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: it is said, The understanding of the opponent.

original: nyan pa bos bsgrub par bya ba ma gtogs ba la ston pa na'o //
analyzed: nyan pa bos bsgrub par bya ba ma gtogs ba la ston pa na'o //
translated: When the teacher teaches to the listener, excluding the establishment of the probandum, .

original: me tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chos can dang ma sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: me tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni chos can dang ma sbyar ba'o //
translated: The phrase merely by fire means without connecting it to the subject.

original: dper na tshang bang lta bu zhes dpe'i chos can smos pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dran par bya ba tsam yin gyi chos can sdud pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dper na tshang bang lta bu zhes dpe'i chos can smos pas ni rjes su 'gro ba dran par bya ba tsam yin gyi chos can sdud pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, when the exemplification is mentioned, ‚Äúlike a kitchen,‚Äù it merely reminds one of the pervasion, but it does not include the subject.

original: khyad par byed ba ni mtshon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir du ba yang chos can gyi bye brag dang bral ba nyid la rjes su 'gro bar blta'o //
analyzed: khyad par byed ba ni mtshon par byed pa yin pa'i phyir du ba yang chos can gyi bye brag dang bral ba nyid la rjes su 'gro bar blta'o //
translated: Since the qualifier is the indicator, one should see that the pervasion is with respect to smoke alone, free of the particular of the subject.

original: de ltar me tsam gyi du ba tsam la khyab par grub pa dang / chos can gang kho na la du ba de 'dra ba rang nyid mthong ba'i chos can kho na la me'i blo skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar me tsam gyi du ba tsam la khyab par grub pa dang / chos can gang kho na la du ba de 'dra ba rang nyid mthong ba'i chos can kho na la me'i blo skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: Thus, the pervasion is established with respect to mere fire and mere smoke, and the cognition of fire arises with respect to the subject alone, the subject on which one sees such smoke.

original: des khyab bar shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des khyab bar shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because one knows the pervasion.

original: de lta na ri me dang ldan pa zhes sgrub bar byed pa shugs kyis rtogs pas bsgrub bar bya bar bstan pa ni ri'i me zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i tshe bstan pa ni ci yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ri me dang ldan pa zhes sgrub bar byed pa shugs kyis rtogs pas bsgrub bar bya bar bstan pa ni ri'i me zhes rjes su 'gro ba'i tshe bstan pa ni ci yang ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since the proof ‚Äúthe mountain has fire‚Äù is implicitly understood, it is not taught as the probandum. When the pervasion ‚Äúthe mountain‚Äôs smoke‚Äù is taught, it is not taught at all.

original: de 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i rjes su 'gro ba mi srid pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for there to be such a universal, and because there would be no purpose in positing it.

original: de lta bas na de la brten cing zhes bya ba ni chos can de la du ba de brten cing ste phyogs kyi chos brjod cing khyab pa brjod pa ste me dang du ba tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can brjod
analyzed: de lta bas na de la brten cing zhes bya ba ni chos can de la du ba de brten cing ste phyogs kyi chos brjod cing khyab pa brjod pa ste me dang du ba tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'brel pa'i rtsa ba can brjod
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúbased on that‚Äù means that the property of the subject, smoke, is stated, and the pervasion is stated, and the mere statement of the root of the relation of the mere invariable concomitance and opposition of fire and smoke

original: pa tsam gyi 'dod pa ri me dang ldan pa zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med par yang ma yin la rtags don med pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: pa tsam gyi 'dod pa ri me dang ldan pa zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya bsgrub pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba med par yang ma yin la rtags don med pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: is asserted. The mere statement of the pervasion is not without the evidence, and the evidence is not pointless.

original: de'i phyir spyi rjes su 'gro ba'i tshe kho bo cag gis ma bstan na ji ltar rtags de khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi rjes su 'gro ba'i tshe kho bo cag gis ma bstan na ji ltar rtags de khyad par can gyi rjes su 'gro ba ste /
translated: Therefore, when we state the universal, how could the evidence be without the pervasion, that is, how could it be that the evidence does not pervade the specific property of the subject?

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par 'gyur /
translated: It could not!

original: yang de'i bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni bsgrub par bya ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gang na du ba yod pa de ni ri'i me yod do zhes spyi bkod pa can gyi'o //
analyzed: yang de'i bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ni bsgrub par bya ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gang na du ba yod pa de ni ri'i me yod do zhes spyi bkod pa can gyi'o //
translated: Moreover, the formulation of the reason is preceded by the formulation of the probandum, and the formulation of the general rule is preceded by the formulation of the probandum, for example, ‚Äúwhere there is smoke there is fire on the mountain.‚Äù

original: 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rjes su 'gro ba smra ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ston pa na'o //
analyzed: 'dir yan lag ma yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma rtogs par bya ba'i ched du rjes su 'gro ba smra ba yin pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba ston pa na'o //
translated: Here, the reason is not a part of the statement of the reason, because the statement of the reason is for the purpose of understanding the probandum, and the statement of the reason is for the purpose of stating the pervasion.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i ngag las dam bca' ba'i ngag logs shig tu bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dngos spyi dang rjes su ston pa yin no //üîΩdam bca' ba'i ngag nyid rjes @264a * //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i ngag las dam bca' ba'i ngag logs shig tu bya bar ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba dngos spyi dang rjes su ston pa yin no // dam bca' ba'i ngag nyid rjes @264a * //
translated: How can the statement of the thesis be separate from the statement of the proof? The statement of the probandum is the general rule, and the statement of the reason is the specific instance.

original: su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngag yin pas sgrub pa'i ngag ste /
analyzed: su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i ngag yin pas sgrub pa'i ngag ste /
translated: The statement of the thesis itself is the statement of the pervasion and the statement of the counter-pervasion, because it is the statement of the proof.

original: sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de las logs shig ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i tshig tu 'gyur ba'i phyir de las logs shig ste /
translated: Therefore, it is not separate from that, because it becomes the words of the syllogism.

original: sgrub bar byed pa'i ngag las logs shig tu dam bca' ba'i ngag ni sgrub ba'i yan lag ma yin no zhes ston par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgrub bar byed pa'i ngag las logs shig tu dam bca' ba'i ngag ni sgrub ba'i yan lag ma yin no zhes ston par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be shown that the thesis-statement, which is separate from the statement that proves it, is not a part of the proof?

original: de sgrub pa'i ngag nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de sgrub pa'i ngag nyid du bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It would be shown that it is itself the statement that proves it.

original: rtags kyi chos kyis mi 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: rtags kyi chos kyis mi 'khrul pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe invariable concomitance of the property of the reason‚Äù is the pervasion.

original: chos can la bstan pa ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bsam pa med par chos can gzhan dpe'i chos can la chos tsam dang 'brel pa rab tu bstan pa'o //
analyzed: chos can la bstan pa ni zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can bsam pa med par chos can gzhan dpe'i chos can la chos tsam dang 'brel pa rab tu bstan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe teaching with regard to the subject‚Äù is the teaching of the mere relation of the property to the subject, in the example, without considering the subject of the property to be proven.

original: de la rab tu grub pa yis bya ba chos tsam dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i rtags bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rab tu grub pas so //
analyzed: de la rab tu grub pa yis bya ba chos tsam dang 'brel pa bstan pa'i rtags bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rab tu grub pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of that teaching, the proof of the mere relation of the property to the subject is established with regard to the subject of the property to be proven.‚Äù

original: chos can la yang ldan par rtogs //
analyzed: chos can la yang ldan par rtogs //
translated: ‚ÄúOne understands the possession with regard to the subject.‚Äù

original: de rtags dag la grub pa'i chos can de la yang khyab par byed pa'i chos de rtogs so //
analyzed: de rtags dag la grub pa'i chos can de la yang khyab par byed pa'i chos de rtogs so //
translated: One also understands the pervasion of the property to be proven by the reason with regard to that subject.

original: gsungs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
analyzed: gsungs zhes bya ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos so //
translated: The master Dignaga said this.

original: me la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba yod pas sgrub par byed pa ltar gtso bo la sogs par yod pa yang kha na ma tho ba med pa ste skyon med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: me la sogs pa rjes su 'gro ba yod pas sgrub par byed pa ltar gtso bo la sogs par yod pa yang kha na ma tho ba med pa ste skyon med pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as fire and so on have a cause, so also the existence of prakriti and so on is not faultless, that is, it is not without fault.

original: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byung ba bshad nas rang gi phyogs kyi klan ka'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phyogs sun 'byung ba bshad nas rang gi phyogs kyi klan ka'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: Having explained the refutation of the opponent's position, in order to respond to the objection to our own position, he says:

original: bye brag yongs su mi sbyor phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bye brag yongs su mi sbyor phyir // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the particular is not applied.

original: sgra'i yod pa zhes bye brag yongs su mi sbyor ba'i phyir te yod ba tsam mo //
analyzed: sgra'i yod pa zhes bye brag yongs su mi sbyor ba'i phyir te yod ba tsam mo //
translated: Because the particular of existence of sound is not applied, it is mere existence.

original: dngos po tsam zhig ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa tsam zhig go //
analyzed: dngos po tsam zhig ces bya ba ni mi rtag pa tsam zhig go //
translated: Mere thing means mere impermanence.

original: sgrub byed ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa de tsam zhig dang khyab pa grub pa'i yod pa yis so //
analyzed: sgrub byed ces bya ba ni khyab par byed pa de tsam zhig dang khyab pa grub pa'i yod pa yis so //
translated: The proof is by that mere pervasion and the existence that establishes the pervasion.

original: gal te sgra'i yod pa zhes bye brag tu ma gzung na ji ltar sgra la grub par byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te sgra'i yod pa zhes bye brag tu ma gzung na ji ltar sgra la grub par byed ce na /
translated: If the particular of existence of sound is not specified, how is it established for sound?

original: de la bye brag gzung bar bya ba nges pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de la bye brag gzung bar bya ba nges pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: There is no certainty in apprehending the particular.

original: sgra'i yod pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba gzung bar nges ba ni med de /üîΩyod pa tsam la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro bas kyang bya ste /
analyzed: sgra'i yod pa zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba gzung bar nges ba ni med de / yod pa tsam la brten pa'i rjes su 'gro bas kyang bya ste /
translated: There is no certainty in apprehending the pervasion that the existence of sound is the property of the subject.

original: bye brag med kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'dod pa sgrub pa nus pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar yod pa tsam la mi rtag pa tsam gyis khyad par grub pa ni khyab pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa de chos can gang la yod par phyogs kyi chos su brjod @264b pas rang la khyab par byed pa'i chos mi rtag pa yang chos can de
analyzed: bye brag med kyang bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la 'dod pa sgrub pa nus pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar yod pa tsam la mi rtag pa tsam gyis khyad par grub pa ni khyab pa dang ldan pa'i yod pa de chos can gang la yod par phyogs kyi chos su brjod @264b pas rang la khyab par byed pa'i chos mi rtag pa yang chos can de
translated: Because the pervasion is established by the mere existence of the probandum, even without a particular.üîΩThis is because the mere existence of the probandum is established by the mere impermanence, and the pervader that exists is the property of the subject.

original: la yod pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: la yod pas rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When the property of the subject is stated, the pervader, impermanence, is also understood to exist in that subject.

original: yod pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin na ni bye brag rjes su 'gro ba med pa la yod pa tsam ni grub zin pa'i phyir rtags gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu med do //
analyzed: yod pa bsgrub par bya ba nyid yin na ni bye brag rjes su 'gro ba med pa la yod pa tsam ni grub zin pa'i phyir rtags gzhal bar bya ba la sogs pa 'bras bu med do //
translated: If it is to be established as existent, then since mere existence is already established in the absence of the universal‚Äôs subsequent inherence, there is no effect, such as the establishment of the evidence.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skyon rnams sdud pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni skyon rnams sdud pa'o //
translated: Moreover, means ‚Äúin summary.‚Äù

original: yod pa ma grub pa la ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgtso bo la sogs pa yod par nam yang ma grub pa de la de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yod pa ma grub pa la ji ltar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni / gtso bo la sogs pa yod par nam yang ma grub pa de la de'i rang bzhin gyi rtags yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could it be in the nonestablishment of existence?üîΩSince the existence of primal matter and so on is never established, how could the evidence of its nature exist?

original: gtso bo la sogs pa rang bzhin yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'ga' zhig rtags su grub na ni de'i rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa'i de nyid yin par yang ji ltar mi 'dod pa de tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa rang bzhin yod pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos 'ga' zhig rtags su grub na ni de'i rang bzhin grub pa'i phyir gtso bo la sogs pa'i de nyid yin par yang ji ltar mi 'dod pa de tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the existence of the nature of primal matter and so on were established as some evidence of the property of nature, then since its nature would be established, why would you not accept that it is the reality of primal matter and so on? Because they are not different.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis rtags bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bo yin na ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi bye brag tu 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis rtags bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyi ngo bo yin na ji ltar rtags dang rtags can gyi bye brag tu 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the evidence is the very nature of the probandum, how can there be a distinction between the evidence and the probandum?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid yin yang ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid yin yang ste /
translated: Even though it is its very nature,

original: gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang khyad par gzhan spangs pa 'ga' zhig la ltos te chos zhes chos can las ldog pa lta bur bstan te tha dad pa lta bur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba'i rang gi ngo bo yang khyad par gzhan spangs pa 'ga' zhig la ltos te chos zhes chos can las ldog pa lta bur bstan te tha dad pa lta bur ro //
translated: the evidence is taught to be like a property that is distinguished from the subject, in dependence on the exclusion of some other property.

original: chos dang chos can gyi tshig sgra dag ste sgra'i don tha dad pas kyang ngo //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi tshig sgra dag ste sgra'i don tha dad pas kyang ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúproperty‚Äù and ‚Äúsubject‚Äù are different, and their meanings are different.

original: brjod par bya ba ni de dag gi rten phyi'i don to //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ni de dag gi rten phyi'i don to //
translated: The referent of the words is the external object that is the basis of those words.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi rtags med par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi rtags med par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching that there is no evidence of essential nature.

original: 'bras bu yang mi srid par don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu yang mi srid par don gyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: The evidence of effect is also impossible, as is understood from the meaning.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bye brag can la ma grub pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yang cung zad tsam yang mi 'grub pas so //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa ji ltar 'dod pa'i bye brag can la ma grub pa'i phyir de'i 'bras bu yang cung zad tsam yang mi 'grub pas so //
translated: Because the particulars that are asserted, such as the primal substance, are not established, its effect is not established in the least.

original: dngos po la mi brten pa zhes bya ba ni med pa'i dngos po la mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po la mi brten pa zhes bya ba ni med pa'i dngos po la mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase not based on an entity means that it does not engage an entity that does not exist.

original: gal te ma yin par dgag pa med pa yin yang dngos po la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin par dgag pa med pa yin yang dngos po la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Is it not the case that although it is an external negation, it engages an entity?

original: ma yin par dgag pa ma yin par zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ma yin par dgag pa ma yin par zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase not an external negation is stated.

original: 'o na de ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, Well then, how is it?

original: med par bkag pa ste dngos po'i chos thams cad du ldog pa tsam gyi med pa ste /
analyzed: med par bkag pa ste dngos po'i chos thams cad du ldog pa tsam gyi med pa ste /
translated: It is an internal negation, an absence that is the mere elimination of all the properties of an entity, and it is established by conceptual thought.

original: rnam par rtog pas gzhag pa yod pa las gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas gzhag pa yod pa las gtan tshigs so //
translated: The reason is because it exists.

original: de yang mi 'gal ba ste de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: de yang mi 'gal ba ste de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: It is also noncontradictory. If it is asked, How is that?

original: ji ltar lus med bya ba lus med pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ci yang med pa la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: ji ltar lus med bya ba lus med pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin pa nyid de ci yang med pa la yang 'jug go //
translated: The absence of a body in the absence of an action is the nonexistence of an absence, and it engages anything at all.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i @265a * //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i @265a * //
translated: The word also

original: sgras ni sems la sogs pa yod pa la yang 'jug go //
analyzed: sgras ni sems la sogs pa yod pa la yang 'jug go //
translated: indicates that it engages the existence of mind and so on.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Therefore it is a confused phenomenon of both.

original: med pa la bkag pa'i sgras 'jug par bshad pa na gsal byed pa na re /
analyzed: med pa la bkag pa'i sgras 'jug par bshad pa na gsal byed pa na re /
translated: When it is explained that the word absence engages an internal negation, the Grammarians say,

original: yod pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yod pa ma yin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because what does not exist does not exist.

original: gzhi med pa'i phyir bkag pa'i yul ma yin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhi med pa'i phyir bkag pa'i yul ma yin pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Because there is no basis, it is not the object of negation.

original: de ni zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin pa dgag pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
translated: That which is called ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù is not the object of negation.

original: da ni de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin bsgrub pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
analyzed: da ni de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni yod pa ma yin bsgrub pa'i yul ma yin na'o //
translated: Now, how can it be the object of affirmation?

original: gal te ma yin pa nyid kyis dgag pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ma yin pa nyid kyis dgag pa'i yul du 'gyur ba yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If it is the object of negation because it is nonexistent, how can it be?

original: dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgrub pa log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgrub pa log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of negation is the reversal of affirmation.

original: 'on te sgrub pa'i tshul ma yin pa nyid kyis dgag pa'i yul du gyur pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgrub pa'i tshul ma yin pa nyid kyis dgag pa'i yul du gyur pa yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Or, if it is the object of negation because it is not the mode of affirmation, how can it be?

original: dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i mtshan nyid ni sgrib pa log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Because the definition of negation is the reversal of obscuration.

original: mtshan nyid dang yul dag gzhan nyid ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang yul dag gzhan nyid ni ma yin no ;
translated: The definition and the object are not different.

original: / gal te yongs su bgrangs pa kho na la zhes bya ba ni gang la dgag pa 'jug par 'dod pa kho na la dgag pa la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: / gal te yongs su bgrangs pa kho na la zhes bya ba ni gang la dgag pa 'jug par 'dod pa kho na la dgag pa la 'jug pa ste /
translated: If you say that negation is applied only to what is enumerated, then negation is applied only to what is desired to be negated.

original: dper na grangs can gang dag dbang phyug med pa dag ni gtso bo 'ga' zhig las sna tshogs skye bar 'dod la /
analyzed: dper na grangs can gang dag dbang phyug med pa dag ni gtso bo 'ga' zhig las sna tshogs skye bar 'dod la /
translated: For example, the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas who do not accept ƒ™≈õvara assert that various things are produced from some pradhƒÅna.

original: de dag na re grangs can rnal 'byor spyod pa la drang srong chu klung la sogs pa dbang phyug tu smra ba dag bkag pa'i phyir dbang phyug med do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med par 'jug gi med pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag na re grangs can rnal 'byor spyod pa la drang srong chu klung la sogs pa dbang phyug tu smra ba dag bkag pa'i phyir dbang phyug med do zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs med par 'jug gi med pa gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: They say that the NaiyƒÅyikas and Mƒ´mƒÅ·πÉsakas who propound ƒ™≈õvara are refuted by the SƒÅ·πÉkhya yogƒÅcƒÅras, so the statement ‚Äúƒ™≈õvara does not exist‚Äù is applied without reason, not to other non-existents.

original: de la 'jug par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ba lta bu'o //
translated: Because they do not wish to apply it to that.

original: de'i phyir lus med ces bya ba yang sems la sogs pa kho na la 'jug gi yod pa ma yin pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus med ces bya ba yang sems la sogs pa kho na la 'jug gi yod pa ma yin pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚Äúit is without body‚Äù is also applied only to mind and so on, not to non-existents.

original: yongs su ma bgrangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su ma bgrangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is not enumerated.

original: de la 'jug par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: de la 'jug par mi 'dod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer na'o //
translated: Because they do not wish to apply it to that.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni skyo bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni skyo bar ston pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlas!‚Äù indicates distress.

original: yang na snying rje ba'o //üîΩsdug bsngal bas 'tsho ba sgrub pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'i skyon chags pa'i nyes pa bsrung dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na snying rje ba'o // sdug bsngal bas 'tsho ba sgrub pa 'di zhes bya ba ni rang gi 'dod pa'i skyon chags pa'i nyes pa bsrung dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, it indicates compassion.üîΩ‚ÄúThis life is difficult to maintain because of suffering‚Äù means that it is difficult to protect oneself from the faults of attachment to one‚Äôs own desires.

original: bdag nyid kyi gson pa sdug bsngal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi gson pa sdug bsngal bar byed pa'o //
translated: One‚Äôs life is made miserable.

original: ji ltar bsrung bar mi nus she na /
analyzed: ji ltar bsrung bar mi nus she na /
translated: How is it that one is unable to protect oneself?

original: brda las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩsgra'i 'jug pa ni brda las byung ba ste de la brten pa'o //
analyzed: brda las byung ba zhes bya ba smos te / sgra'i 'jug pa ni brda las byung ba ste de la brten pa'o //
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of the conventional.‚Äù

original: brda de @265b yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: brda de @265b yang skyes bu'i 'dod pa tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ste /
translated: The use of words is based on the conventional, which is related to mere desire.

original: dngos po yod pa kho na la brten par ma nges pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa kho na la brten par ma nges pa'o //
translated: That conventional usage is not necessarily based on the existence of an entity.

original: de lta bu'i sgra de 'dod pa tsam las brgyud de /
analyzed: de lta bu'i sgra de 'dod pa tsam las brgyud de /
translated: Such words are used in accordance with mere desire.

original: 'jug pas lus med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin ba la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'jug pas lus med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin ba la yang 'jug ste /
translated: Since they are used in this way, they are said to be ‚Äúnonexistent,‚Äù because they are used in reference to what does not exist.

original: skyes bus de la yang brda byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bus de la yang brda byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because people have used them in that way.

original: de 'dra ba'i sgra de don la nges par te rang 'dod pas 'jug pa gzhan du zhugs bar 'dod pa ste grags pa'i dngos po dang 'gal bar byed 'dod ba de'i tshe'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sgra de don la nges par te rang 'dod pas 'jug pa gzhan du zhugs bar 'dod pa ste grags pa'i dngos po dang 'gal bar byed 'dod ba de'i tshe'o //
translated: Such a sound is in fact definite, i.e., one wishes to engage in it according to one‚Äôs desire, and one wishes to engage in it in a way that is contrary to the known thing.

original: cho nges btab kyang zhes bya ba ni lus med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin la ma brjod cig ces gsol ba shin tu btab kyang ngo ;
analyzed: cho nges btab kyang zhes bya ba ni lus med ces bya ba yod pa ma yin la ma brjod cig ces gsol ba shin tu btab kyang ngo ;
translated: Even though one cries out, i.e., even though one makes a very strong request, ‚ÄúDo not say that the body does not exist,‚Äù

original: /'jig rten mi ldog go zhes bya ba ni grags pa brda ji lta ba bzhin du go bar 'gyur bar mi ldog pa'o //
analyzed: /'jig rten mi ldog go zhes bya ba ni grags pa brda ji lta ba bzhin du go bar 'gyur bar mi ldog pa'o //
translated: the world does not turn back, i.e., it does not turn back from understanding the conventional in accordance with what is well known.

original: 'jig rten ni yod pa ma yin pa yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir med ces bya ba'i sgra la brdar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten ni yod pa ma yin pa yang rtogs par bya ba'i phyir med ces bya ba'i sgra la brdar byed pa'o //
translated: The world makes a convention with regard to the word ‚Äúdoes not exist‚Äù in order to understand that which does not exist.

original: gal te brdar byas kyang mi rtogs na ni 'dod pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gal te brdar byas kyang mi rtogs na ni 'dod pa dang bye brag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: If one does not understand even though one makes a convention, then there is no difference between what one desires and what one does not desire.

original: mi rtogs par 'dod pa'i yod pa ma yin pa dang brdar byas bar bye brag med pa'i phyir gnyis pa ma yin par dgag pa sems la sogs pa la yang lus med ces bya ba ni sgras mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtogs par 'dod pa'i yod pa ma yin pa dang brdar byas bar bye brag med pa'i phyir gnyis pa ma yin par dgag pa sems la sogs pa la yang lus med ces bya ba ni sgras mi rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the second, because there is no difference between the existence that is not understood and the one that is conventionally designated.üîΩThe statement ‚ÄúThe mind, etc., do not exist in the body‚Äù is not a negation because it is understood on the basis of a word that is not understood.

original: de las kyang rtogs pa yang dag par brten ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa sems la sogs pa'i brda las kyang rtogs pa med pa'i sgra la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de las kyang rtogs pa yang dag par brten ba'i phyir te zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa sems la sogs pa'i brda las kyang rtogs pa med pa'i sgra la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is not so because it is understood on the basis of a word that is not understood‚Äù means that the mind, etc., are not understood on the basis of a word that is not understood.

original: med pa'i sgras rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'i sgras rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is understood from the word ‚Äúnot.‚Äù

original: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba brda'i mthu las rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni gzhan la yang mtshungs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba brda'i mthu las rtogs pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThat is the same for others‚Äù means that it is understood on the basis of the power of conventional symbols.

original: the tshom za ba yang rnam par bcad pas go bar byed pa nyid thob ste rtags su 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yang rnam par bcad pas go bar byed pa nyid thob ste rtags su 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Even doubt is understood through exclusion, and thus it is established as a word that is understood.

original: rnam par gcad pa cam lus med ces bya ba de ni ma yin par bkag pas sems la sogs pa yod pa la yang 'jug pa yod pa la yin pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la yang srid pas so //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa cam lus med ces bya ba de ni ma yin par bkag pas sems la sogs pa yod pa la yang 'jug pa yod pa la yin pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa la yang srid pas so //
translated: It is not the case that the mere exclusion is not a thing, because the exclusion is also present in the existence of mind, etc., and it is also possible in the horns of a rabbit, etc.üîΩHow is it established as having that nature?

original: de ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la srid pa'i rtags ji ltar na yod pas de'i bdag nyid du nges pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ji ltar de'i bdag nyid du sgrub par byed ces bya ba ni gnyi ga la srid pa'i rtags ji ltar na yod pas de'i bdag nyid du nges pa sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: how is it established as having that nature by the reason that is possible in both?

original: rnam par gcad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dgag pa ma yin pa ste sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa ma yin pa'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni dgag pa ma yin pa ste sgrub pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-exclusion is not a negation, but an affirmation.

original: dngos po med pa la yang blos rnam par gzhag @266a * //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la yang blos rnam par gzhag @266a * //
translated: Because a non-entity is also established by the mind.

original: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brda'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni brda'i dbang gis so //
translated: By the power of convention.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs yod pa de med pa la yang 'jug ba'i phyir thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no zhes snga ma rnam par bcad pas bshad pa yin to go bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gtan tshigs yod pa de med pa la yang 'jug ba'i phyir thun mong gi ma nges pa yin no zhes snga ma rnam par bcad pas bshad pa yin to go bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, since the existent reason is also engaged in the nonexistent, it is a common inconclusive reason.

original: gnyi ga'i chos de zhes bya ba lus med ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chos de zhes bya ba lus med ces bya ba'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúthat which is the property of both‚Äù refers to ‚Äúwithout body.‚Äù

original: yod pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa rang gi ngag gis smras pas bshad ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yod pa las gzhan yod pa ma yin pa la 'jug pa rang gi ngag gis smras pas bshad ces bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúStated by your own words‚Äù means that the reason is engaged in the existent and the nonexistent.

original: gtan tshigs gnyi ga'i chos yin pa'i rtogs pa'i skabs kyis so //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gnyi ga'i chos yin pa'i rtogs pa'i skabs kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the occasion of the understanding of the reason that is the property of both‚Äù means that the reason is the property of both.

original: gnyi ga'i chos nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga'i chos yin yang ngo //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i chos nyid yin yang zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga'i chos yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though it is the property of both‚Äù means even though it is the property of both the permanent and the impermanent.

original: skyon med de zhes pa ni ma nges pa'i'o //
analyzed: skyon med de zhes pa ni ma nges pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no fault‚Äù means that it is inconclusive.

original: de yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga yin pas ci'i phyir 'khrul pa can ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga yin pas ci'i phyir 'khrul pa can ma yin zhe na /
translated: ‚ÄúWhy is it not mistaken?‚Äù means that since it is both permanent and impermanent, why is it not mistaken?

original: phyogs nyid la 'khrul pa'i yul ni ma yin te /
analyzed: phyogs nyid la 'khrul pa'i yul ni ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the object of mistake in the position itself‚Äù means that it is not the object of mistake in the position of the opponent.

original: bum pa dang nam mkha' dag mthun ba'i phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir de la 'jug pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
analyzed: bum pa dang nam mkha' dag mthun ba'i phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir de la 'jug pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i 'khrul par mi rigs pa'i phyir ro snyam pa'o //
translated: because the subject is the common locus of both the property to be established and the property that is the reason, and because it is not reasonable that what engages the subject should be mistaken with regard to the dissimilar class.

original: khyod ces bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba smra ba'o //
analyzed: khyod ces bya ba ni phyogs dang mthun pa'i phyogs la gang yang rung ba zhes bya ba smra ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú You‚Äù refers to the proponent of the position.

original: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya brtag pa dang mi rtag pa nam mkha' dang bum pa'i chos de bum pa'i chos nyid du ni bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa med pa
analyzed: de ji ltar zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin na gnyi ga'i chos zhes bya brtag pa dang mi rtag pa nam mkha' dang bum pa'i chos de bum pa'i chos nyid du ni bsgrub par bya ba rtag pa med pa
translated: ‚Äú How?‚Äù means that if the dissimilar class is the absence of the property to be established, then the property of both, that is, the property of space and pot, is the property of the pot, but the property to be established, permanence, is absent in the dissimilar class.

original: la 'jug pa nam mkha'i chos ni bzlog pa la'o //
analyzed: la 'jug pa nam mkha'i chos ni bzlog pa la'o //
translated: The property of space engages the opposite of that.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos de ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug / gal te de dag mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos de ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug / gal te de dag mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du byas pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could the property of both not engage the dissimilar class? If you say that it is not the dissimilar class because it is made into the similar class, then it is not the dissimilar class because it is made into the similar class.

original: phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par phye ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas rnam par phye ba la ltos pa ste /
analyzed: phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par phye ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni skyes bu'i 'dod pas rnam par phye ba la ltos pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúDepending on the distinction of the property and the counter-property‚Äù means depending on the distinction by the desire of the person.

original: de'i stobs kyis mi 'khrul ba dang cig shos su mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de'i stobs kyis mi 'khrul ba dang cig shos su mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: By the power of that, there is no error and no other.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩmi 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa ni dngos po ba ste /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / mi 'khrul pa dang 'khrul pa ni dngos po ba ste /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i stobs kyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because error and non-error are based on the power of the thing.

original: de'i phyir phyogs kyis byas pa thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs kyis byas pa thams cad ces bya ba smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says ‚Äúall that is produced by the property.‚Äù

original: rgol bas phyogs su byas pa la yod pa'i byas pa yin na ji ltar gyur kyang mi rtag bas khyab po zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol bas phyogs su byas pa la yod pa'i byas pa yin na ji ltar gyur kyang mi rtag bas khyab po zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it exists in what is produced by the disputant‚Äôs property, then no matter what it is, it is pervaded by impermanence.

original: khyab pa tshad mas nye @266b bar ston te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa tshad mas nye @266b bar ston te zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe pervasion is shown by a valid cognition‚Äù is not accepted.

original: byas pa thams cad ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi byas pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa thams cad ces bya ba ni phyogs kyi byas pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAll that is produced‚Äù is without distinction, and ‚Äúproduced by the property‚Äù is without distinction.

original: de ltar grub na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyi khyad par ro //
analyzed: de ltar grub na zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyi khyad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it were established in that way‚Äù is a special case of the power of fact.üîΩIf it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?üîΩIf it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?üîΩIf it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba'i skyes bu'i 'dod pas gal te 'dod pas khyab pa sgrub pa yang ci'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na /üîΩskyes bu'i 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba'i skyes bu'i 'dod pas gal te 'dod pas khyab pa sgrub pa yang ci'i phyir go bar byed pa ma yin zhe na / skyes bu'i 'jug pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: If it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?üîΩIf it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?

analyzed: dngos pos yin la de yod pa yang dngos pos yin pa'i phyir gnyi ga'i chos mi 'khrul ba nyid do zhe na'o //
translated: If it were established by the power of fact, then why would it not be a reason?üîΩIf it were established by the power of fact, then why

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs zhugs la'o //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs zhugs la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the domain of inference‚Äù means in the case of an inference based on fact.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod pa yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang ngo //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod pa yang zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pas gnod pa yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven if there is no contradiction by perception‚Äù means even if there is no contradiction by inference.

original: smras zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis ba la sogs pa mang du'o //
analyzed: smras zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis ba la sogs pa mang du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù means in the second chapter and many other places.

original: gnod pa med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang de la ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni de yang sngar smras zin to zhes bya ba ste le'u 'di nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyang de la ma nges pa'i mtshan nyid do zhes kyang ngo zhes bya ba ni de yang sngar smras zin to zhes bya ba ste le'u 'di nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe definition of noncontradiction is also the definition of nondeviance‚Äù means that this also has been explained earlier, in this very chapter.

original: de dag gis ci zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: de dag gis ci zhig brjod ce na /
translated: What is the point of all this?

original: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du smra ba de lta bus ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags la phyogs rnam par phye bas rtags kyis go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid la phan par 'gyur ba'am gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
analyzed: phyogs kyi mtshan nyid ji skad du smra ba de lta bus ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'i rtags la phyogs rnam par phye bas rtags kyis go bar byed pa'i mtshan nyid la phan par 'gyur ba'am gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no
translated: It shows that the definition of a premise as stated is not helpful in defining the nature of an inferential sign that is based on fact, nor is it harmful in defining the nature of an inferential sign that is based on fact.

original: // de ltar na zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi go bar byed par mi 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: // de ltar na zhes bya ba ni phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyi gtan tshigs kyi go bar byed par mi 'gyur na'o //
translated: Thus means that if it were not so, the reason would not serve to make one understand the characteristic of the position.

original: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba la mi ltos na go bar byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba la mi ltos na go bar byed pa nyid do zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig ces bya ba 'di bsgrub par bya ba las gzhan pa'o //
translated: What is this that is said, if it does not depend on the probandum, it is the means of understanding? It is other than the probandum.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la ma ltos pa'i rtags kyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba la ma ltos pa'i rtags kyis so //
translated: By what means by the reason that does not depend on the probandum.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gang gi rgyus so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs gang gi rgyus so //
translated: For what reason means for what reason of the reason.

original: don la mi 'khrul par sems par byed pa ste /
analyzed: don la mi 'khrul par sems par byed pa ste /
translated: It causes the mind to be non-erroneous with regard to the object.

original: don dam pa'i don la mi slu ba'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'i don la mi slu ba'o //
translated: It is non-deceptive with regard to the ultimate object.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i @267a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don dam pa'i @267a * //
translated: Therefore means because of that.

original: don la mi slu bar sems dang ba'o //
analyzed: don la mi slu bar sems dang ba'o //
translated: It causes the mind to be confident with regard to the non-deceptive ultimate object.

original: dngos pos khyad bas ni don dam pas so //
analyzed: dngos pos khyad bas ni don dam pas so //
translated: By the ultimate, it is distinguished by the ultimate.

original: de'i phyir skyes bus phyogs nyid du mi 'dod kyang dngos pos khyab pa'i rtags yod na khyab par byed pa'i don de la mi 'khrul la /
analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bus phyogs nyid du mi 'dod kyang dngos pos khyab pa'i rtags yod na khyab par byed pa'i don de la mi 'khrul la /
translated: Therefore, even though a person does not accept a reason as a property of the subject, if the reason is pervaded by the property of the subject, the reason is nonerroneous with regard to the property of the subject.

original: dngos pos khyab ba de med na skyes bus phyogs su byas kyang mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos pos khyab ba de med na skyes bus phyogs su byas kyang mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: If the reason is not pervaded by the property of the subject, then even if a person accepts the reason as a property of the subject, it is not nonerroneous.

original: de'i phyir rtags gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de skyes bu 'di phyogs su byed na rtags mi 'khrul la gzhan phyogs su mi byed pa dag ni 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags gang zhig mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de skyes bu 'di phyogs su byed na rtags mi 'khrul la gzhan phyogs su mi byed pa dag ni 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni shin tu rnam par dag pa'i
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that any reason that engages with the discordant side but is nonerroneous with regard to the property of the subject when that discordant side is accepted as the subject by a person, and is erroneous when another subject is accepted, is a completely pure

original: tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma yin te /
translated: means of valid knowledge.

original: dngos po dang mi mthun par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir 'thing slad du byas pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po dang mi mthun par zhugs pa yin pa'i phyir 'thing slad du byas pa'o //
translated: Because it engages with the property of the subject, it is not a case of overextension.

original: de ltar gnyi ga'i chos gtan tshigs 'khrul par bstan pa bshad nas med pa'i chos 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir med ba tsam gyis khyab pa ni med par bkag pas khyab pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar gnyi ga'i chos gtan tshigs 'khrul par bstan pa bshad nas med pa'i chos 'gal bar bstan pa'i phyir med ba tsam gyis khyab pa ni med par bkag pas khyab pa'o ;
translated: Having explained the demonstration that the property of both is a mistaken reason, in order to demonstrate that the property of nonexistence is contradictory, he says, ‚ÄúThe pervasion by mere nonexistence is the pervasion by the negation of existence.‚Äù

original: / don gyi rnam par bcad pa ni yod pa'i don log pa tsam mo //
analyzed: / don gyi rnam par bcad pa ni yod pa'i don log pa tsam mo //
translated: The elimination of the object is the mere negation of the existent object.

original: yang 'di zhes bya bas rang gi phyogs la kla na ka'i lan 'debs pa ste 'di zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
analyzed: yang 'di zhes bya bas rang gi phyogs la kla na ka'i lan 'debs pa ste 'di zhes bya ba ni yod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú This‚Äù is the reply to the CƒÅrvƒÅka‚Äôs position. ‚Äú This‚Äù is existence.

original: de tsam gyis khyab pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa sgra la sogs ba'i bye brag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis khyab pa zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa sgra la sogs ba'i bye brag dang bral ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú The pervasion by mere that‚Äù is impermanence, free from the distinctions of sound, etc.

original: spyi'i dngos po zhes bya ba yod pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i bye brag dang bral ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: spyi'i dngos po zhes bya ba yod pa yang sgra la sogs pa'i bye brag dang bral ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: ‚Äú The universal entity‚Äù is existence, free from the distinctions of sound, etc.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni spyi'i dngos po khyab pa grub pas so //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni spyi'i dngos po khyab pa grub pas so //
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù is because the pervasion by the universal entity is established.

original: ldog pa med pas so zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgra la sogs pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa med pas so zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i rtags ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs sgra la sogs pa las ma log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no reversal. The reason ‚Äúbecause of impermanence‚Äù does not reverse from the discordant side, sound, etc.

original: 'dir yang de ltar yin te zhes bya ba ni log pa yod pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang de ltar yin te zhes bya ba ni log pa yod pa yin pa'o //
translated: Here also, it is like that, i.e., there is reversal.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bum pa la sogs pa la ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is reversal from the discordant side, the pot, etc.

original: rjes su 'gro ba gtso mi che ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba'i phyir snyam pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba gtso mi che ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni stobs chung ba'i phyir snyam pa'o //
translated: Because the pervasion is not strong, i.e., because it is weak.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bye brag pa'i lugs ltar rdul phra rab dag rtag pa yin la de la reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la ma khyab pas so //
analyzed: bye brag pa'i lugs ltar rdul phra rab dag rtag pa yin la de la reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs la ma khyab pas so //
translated: According to the Vai≈õe·π£ika system, the atoms are permanent, and the non-contact of those is not pervaded by the similar side.

original: gal te de ltar na 'di go bar byed bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na 'di go bar byed bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is like that, this will be understood:

original: 'dir mi rtags pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir stobs dang ldan @267b ba'o ;
analyzed: 'dir mi rtags pa nyid mthun pa'i phyogs rtsol ba las byung ba thams cad la rjes su 'gro ba'i phyir stobs dang ldan @267b ba'o ;
translated: Here, non-eternality is powerful because it pervades all that is produced, which is the similar class.

original: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig las ldog pa yang yod la de stobs chung ba ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs glo ga dang rtsal la sogs ba las ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mi mthun pa'i phyogs nam mkha' la sogs pa 'ga' zhig las ldog pa yang yod la de stobs chung ba ste mi mthun pa'i phyogs glo ga dang rtsal la sogs ba las ldog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It also has a reversal from some dissimilar classes, such as space, but that is weak because it does not have a reversal from dissimilar classes such as the body, strength, speed, and so on.

original: rtag pa rnam par bcad ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rtag pa la sogs pas so //
analyzed: rtag pa rnam par bcad ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad du rtag pa la sogs pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe exclusion of permanence‚Äù is by all means such as permanence and so on.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyi tshe mnyam pa'am de stobs che bas so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba nyi tshe mnyam pa'am de stobs che bas so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù is the mere pervasion by the similar class or that is strong.

original: 'di yod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'di yod pa tsam zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe mere existence of this‚Äù is the pervasion.

original: 'di'i nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtags dag gis sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i nus pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtags dag gis sgrub par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause its power is complete‚Äù is the proof by the signs because it is what is to be established.

original: bye brag de dag 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni sgra dang phyogs rtag pa dang / me med par rnam par bcad pa dag go //
analyzed: bye brag de dag 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni sgra dang phyogs rtag pa dang / me med par rnam par bcad pa dag go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly those specific things‚Äù refers to sound, permanent spatial location, and the exclusion of the absence of fire.

original: 'o na ci zhig na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhig na /
translated: What is it?

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ni spyi ste phyogs nyid ces bya ba'i spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa ni spyi ste phyogs nyid ces bya ba'i spyi bsgrub par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The general property that is not the discordant class is the property to be established, which is called the ‚Äúproperty of the position.‚Äù

original: spyi yis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya bar rtogs par 'gyur la ;
analyzed: spyi yis ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya bar rtogs par 'gyur la ;
translated: The general property is understood to be ‚Äúthat which is not the discordant class.‚Äù

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa de ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa rtogs pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir spyi'i tshad mas ma grub cing dgos pa med pa des ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa de ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa rtogs pa nyid kyis grub pa'i phyir spyi'i tshad mas ma grub cing dgos pa med pa des ci zhig bya zhes bstan pa'i phyir gal te gzhan dang ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba la
translated: Since that which is not mixed with the discordant class is established by the mere understanding of the exclusion of other, what is the use of a general property that is not established by a valid cognition and has no purpose?

original: sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sogs pa smos so //
translated: To explain this, [Dharmakƒ´rti] states ‚ÄúIf it is unmixed with other . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: de ltar ldog pa gtso cher sgrub pa zhes pa ni rtags kyang ldog pa stobs dang ldan bar grub la rtags can yang ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar ldog pa gtso cher sgrub pa zhes pa ni rtags kyang ldog pa stobs dang ldan bar grub la rtags can yang ldog pa ste /
translated: Thus, the establishment of the principal of the exclusion is established as the powerful exclusion of the reason, and the exclusion of the sign is also established.

original: rnam par gcad pa nyid gtso bo yin gyi spyi ni mi dgos so zhes grub pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa nyid gtso bo yin gyi spyi ni mi dgos so zhes grub pa'o //
translated: The principal is the exclusion itself; the universal is not necessary.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam 'brel pa'i yul log pas zhes bya ba tshad ma'i stong ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong du zin kyang zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam 'brel pa'i yul log pas zhes bya ba tshad ma'i stong ba'o //
translated: Even though one does not see the reason in the discordant side, the mere non-seeing is the object of the negation of the relation, and the negation of the valid cognition is the negation of the object.

original: lus dang dbang po dang blo dag ces so sor phye nas sbyar te /
analyzed: lus dang dbang po dang blo dag ces so sor phye nas sbyar te /
translated: The body, the sense faculty, and the mind are applied separately.

original: dpyod pa'i sbyor ba gsum po dag ni rig byed kyi lud de nyid kyi tshad ma de skyes bu'i thams cad mkhyen ba ni mi srid do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dpyod pa'i sbyor ba gsum po dag ni rig byed kyi lud de nyid kyi tshad ma de skyes bu'i thams cad mkhyen ba ni mi srid do zhes zer ro //
translated: The three applications of analysis are the valid cognition of the Veda itself. It is said that the omniscience of a person is impossible.

original: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin mod kyi nye bar len pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bral ba rnams ni nus ba shin tu med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir lus la sogs pa rnams 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu yin mod kyi nye bar len pa'i tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang bral ba rnams ni nus ba shin tu med do //
translated: Therefore, although the body, etc. are the causes of attachment, etc., those who are free from the improper mental activity of grasping do not have the ability.

original: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes ma mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni log pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa ldog go zhes bya bar ston @268a * //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi'o zhes ma mthong ba nyid la zhes bya ba ni log pa na 'dod chags la sogs pa ldog go zhes bya bar ston @268a * //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the non-seeing of ‚ÄòI‚Äô and ‚Äòmine‚Äô‚Äù shows that attachment, etc. are eliminated when the error is eliminated,

original: to // dper na bdag dang bdag gir ma bzung ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
analyzed: to // dper na bdag dang bdag gir ma bzung ba'i dngos po lta bu'o //
translated: just as when one does not grasp ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine.‚ÄùüîΩTherefore, attachment, etc. exist merely through the existence of the grasping of ‚ÄúI‚Äù and ‚Äúmine,‚Äù and do not exist when that does not exist.

original: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yod pa tsam gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa yod la de med na med ba'i phyir lus la sogs pa nyi tshe'i nus pa ma yin ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa yod pa tsam gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa yod la de med na med ba'i phyir lus la sogs pa nyi tshe'i nus pa ma yin ba'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba
translated: Therefore, the body, etc. are not the causes of attachment, etc. in the sense of being the dominant condition, because they are not the cause of attachment, etc. in all cases.

original: dag la ma mthong du zin kyang de dag dang 'gal ba med de de dag yod la 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed mi nus ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dag la ma mthong du zin kyang de dag dang 'gal ba med de de dag yod la 'dod chags la sogs pa skyed mi nus ba srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they are not seen in them, there is no contradiction, because it is possible that they exist but are unable to generate attachment, etc.

original: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i ro la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rgyu dang 'bras bur ma gyur pa gzhan ro la sogs pas gzugs la sogs pa rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni da ltar ba'i ro la sogs pa ste /
translated: If that is so, then it is said that form, etc. is cognized by other things that are not its cause, such as taste, etc.

original: dus mnyam pa'i dngos po gnyis la rgyu dang 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro //
