original: dper brjod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa nges par byas pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dper brjod pa ma yin te zhes bya ba ni dper brjod pa nges par byas pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúNot an example‚Äù means that the example is not ascertained.

original: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba gcig la ma grub pa tsam bstan pa gtsor brjod kyi tshad mas grub pa dang lung gi dbye ba ma dpyad pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba gcig la ma grub pa tsam bstan pa gtsor brjod kyi tshad mas grub pa dang lung gi dbye ba ma dpyad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúJust a portion‚Äù means that just the unestablished basis is stated as the main point, without analyzing whether it is established by valid knowledge or scripture.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad na de dag gi rang bzhin du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad na de dag gi rang bzhin du mi rung ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the probandum and the proof are different‚Äù means that if they were not different, they could not be the nature of each other.

original: de yod pa tsam gyis zhar la 'ongs ba zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pa tsam gyis zhar la ste de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam gyis zhar la 'ongs ba zhes bya ba ni sgra yod pa tsam gyis zhar la ste de nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúMerely by the existence of that‚Äù means that sound is merely by the existence of that, that is, sound itself.

original: 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa zhes bya ba ni grub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen‚Äù means established.

original: de yang chos can sgra grub pa nyid kyis grub pa'o //
analyzed: de yang chos can sgra grub pa nyid kyis grub pa'o //
translated: And that is established by the mere establishment of the subject, sound.

original: de ltar grub pa la yang sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don med do //
analyzed: de ltar grub pa la yang sgra 'byin pa'i phyir ro zhes bstan pa ni don med do //
translated: Thus, it is pointless to teach that sound is established because it emits sound.

original: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni sgra de ltar /
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bshad pa ni sgra de ltar /
translated: That itself is explained in detail:üîΩIf it were like that,

original: gyur na zhes bya ba ni chos can grub pa nyid kyis sgra rang grub bas na phyogs bstan pa ste /
analyzed: gyur na zhes bya ba ni chos can grub pa nyid kyis sgra rang grub bas na phyogs bstan pa ste /
translated: the subject is established by the mere existence of sound. Therefore, the position is stated.

original: chos can bstan pa nyid kyis de ltar sgrar grub la /
analyzed: chos can bstan pa nyid kyis de ltar sgrar grub la /
translated: By merely teaching the subject, sound is established in that way.

original: phyis @274b rang nyid las kyang zhes bya ba ni sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes rtags bstan pas kyang sgra nyid las gzhan rtogs ba med pas so //
analyzed: phyis @274b rang nyid las kyang zhes bya ba ni sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes rtags bstan pas kyang sgra nyid las gzhan rtogs ba med pas so //
translated: Later, it is said that even from itself, the reason is stated as because it is sound. Since there is no understanding of anything other than sound itself,

original: de'i phyir sgra de phyogs su byas nas de grub par bya bar byas na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra de phyogs su byas nas de grub par bya bar byas na'o //
translated: therefore, having made that sound the position, it is to be established.üîΩThat itself is also the reason,

original: de nyid gtan tshigs kyang yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra phyogs yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs yin na'o ;
analyzed: de nyid gtan tshigs kyang yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra phyogs yin pa de nyid gtan tshigs yin na'o ;
translated: if that sound is the position, it is the reason.

original: / yang na bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yod pa tsam gyis zhar la 'ongs pas yang de bstan ba ni don med do zhes 'das ma thag tu bshad zin to //
analyzed: / yang na bstan par mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni yod pa tsam gyis zhar la 'ongs pas yang de bstan ba ni don med do zhes 'das ma thag tu bshad zin to //
translated: Or else, it should not be taught. It has just been explained that it is pointless to teach it again, since it is implied by the mere existence of the reason.

original: rtsod pa med par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rtags don med pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa med par yang 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni rtags don med pa'o //
translated: There would be no dispute. This is the pointlessness of the reason.

original: gal te rjes su 'gro bam mthong pas rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su 'gro bam mthong pas rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the pervasion is not established because the pervasion is not seen,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la rtags nyid grub par 'dod na rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la rtags nyid grub par 'dod na rjes su 'gro ba ma mthong ba ni ma yin te /
translated: then, if you accept that the reason itself is established, it is not the case that the pervasion is not seen.

original: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba mi srid pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la rjes su 'gro ba mi srid pa yin te /
translated: It is impossible for there to be a pervasion here.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar chos can chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar chos can chos can gzhan la rjes su 'gro ba yin te /
translated: How could the subject pervade another subject?

original: de ni mi srid ba ste chos can gyi bye brag la rtags kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi srid ba ste chos can gyi bye brag la rtags kyis grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is impossible, because the reason establishes the difference between subjects.

original: de'i phyir rtags kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags kyi rang bzhin ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not the nature of the reason.

original: des na de grub ba na rtags grub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de grub ba na rtags grub pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, when that is established, the reason is not established.

original: gal te mar me la sogs pa rang gis rang rtogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i byed pa ltar rtags kyang rang gis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mar me la sogs pa rang gis rang rtogs pa'i shes pa skyed pa'i byed pa ltar rtags kyang rang gis rtogs par byed do zhe na /
translated: generate a cognition that perceives itself, so also a reason proves itself,

original: mar me la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩrang gi shes pa'i yul du rtags can rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mar me la sogs pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rang gi shes pa'i yul du rtags can rtogs pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúA lamp, etc.üîΩdo not prove themselves.‚ÄùüîΩThe reason is not the object of the cognition that perceives the reason,

original: rtags rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid yul du bsgrub par bya ba nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te //
analyzed: rtags rtogs pa'i shes pa nyid yul du bsgrub par bya ba nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin te //
translated: because the cognition that perceives the reason is not the object that is to be proved.

original: rtags shes pa las dus phyis rtags can rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: rtags shes pa las dus phyis rtags can rtogs pa ste /
translated: The cognition of the reason and the object that possesses the reason occur at different times.

original: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dus gcig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa'i phyir dus gcig pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not simultaneous, because they are cause and effect.

original: 'dir thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rtags shes pa rtags can yul du byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba rtags shes pa rtags can yul du byed pa'o //
translated: Here, the consequence is that the cognition of the reason makes the object that possesses the reason its object.

original: gal te chos dang chos can zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag kyang don dam par tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa'o snyam pa'o ;
analyzed: gal te chos dang chos can zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa dag kyang don dam par tha mi dad pa'i phyir skyon mtshungs pa'o snyam pa'o ;
translated: If you say that the same fault applies to the example of the property and the possessor of the property, because the produced and impermanent are ultimately not different,üîΩwe reply, ‚ÄúNo, because they are different from the point of view of conception.‚Äù

original: / smras zin te zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro //üîΩde ltar gyur pa ma grub ste //
analyzed: / smras zin te zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro // de ltar gyur pa ma grub ste //
translated: It has been said means in the second chapter.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi tha dad ba ma grub pa'o //üîΩde dang gzhan nyid dgag bar bya //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can gyi tha dad ba ma grub pa'o // de dang gzhan nyid dgag bar bya //
translated: That is not established means that the difference between the property and the subject is not established.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag par bya ba'i don @275a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dgag par bya ba'i don @275a * //
translated: That and otherness should be refuted means that the identity and difference of the property and the subject should be refuted.

original: dam bar de nyid dang gzhan nyid kho na'o //üîΩrang gi bye brag la brten pa'i //
analyzed: dam bar de nyid dang gzhan nyid kho na'o // rang gi bye brag la brten pa'i //
translated: The meaning is that identity and difference are the only two possibilities.

original: zhes bya ba ni byas ba dang mi rtag pa dag gi ldog pa'i chos kyi bye brag la brten pa'o //üîΩshes la ji ltar tha dad par //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byas ba dang mi rtag pa dag gi ldog pa'i chos kyi bye brag la brten pa'o // shes la ji ltar tha dad par //
translated: Based on its own distinction means based on the distinction of the property of being produced and impermanent.

original: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral bar snang ba'i phyir byas ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos du ma snang ba de la rtags dang rtags can gyi tha snyad brten pa'i phyir skyon mi mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni chos dang chos can dag de nyid dang gzhan nyid dang bral bar snang ba'i phyir byas ba dang mi rtag pa'i chos du ma snang ba de la rtags dang rtags can gyi tha snyad brten pa'i phyir skyon mi mtshungs pa'o //
translated: How is it different in cognition? means that since the property and the subject appear as free from identity and difference, the appearance of multiple properties such as being produced and impermanent is not similar to the fault, because the convention of signifier and signified is based on that.

original: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni zhes bya ba ni sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'dir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúHere‚Äù refers to ‚Äúbecause of being sound.‚ÄùüîΩ‚ÄúIn convention‚Äù means that the cognition that sees the difference in the exclusion of the produced and the impermanent makes the convention of reason and what is to be inferred.

original: tha snyad la mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa ldog pa'i khyad par gyis rtags dang rtags can du byed ba'i tha snyad la tha dad pa'i mthong ba'i blo de nyid la yang ma reg phyir te /
analyzed: tha snyad la mthong ba'i zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang mi rtag pa ldog pa'i khyad par gyis rtags dang rtags can du byed ba'i tha snyad la tha dad pa'i mthong ba'i blo de nyid la yang ma reg phyir te /
translated: It does not touch that itself.

original: ldog pa'i bye brag 'dzin pa'i blo la'ang ma reg pa ste /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag 'dzin pa'i blo la'ang ma reg pa ste /
translated: It also does not touch the cognition that apprehends the difference in the exclusion.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i bye brag kyang mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i bye brag kyang mi snang ba'o //
translated: It does not appear as a difference like that.

original: nyid la'ang zhes bya ba ni dngos pos tha dad ba du ma lta bu ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid la'ang zhes bya ba ni dngos pos tha dad ba du ma lta bu ga la zhig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚ÄúIn itself‚Äù means ‚Äúhow could it be many different things?‚Äù

original: de yang sgra las sgra ni ldog pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed ba med do //
analyzed: de yang sgra las sgra ni ldog pa'i bye brag med pa'i phyir go bar bya ba dang go bar byed ba med do //
translated: Moreover, because sound does not have a difference in the exclusion of sound, there is no difference between what is understood and what makes it understood.

original: gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs tha dad pa cung zad kyang ma grub bas so //
analyzed: gnyi ga la ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang phyogs tha dad pa cung zad kyang ma grub bas so //
translated: Because it is not established for both, because neither the proponent nor the opponent has established even the slightest difference in position.

original: de dag gis chos kyang bshad ba yin te zhes bya ba sgra mi rtag ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba chos nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i ma grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gis chos kyang bshad ba yin te zhes bya ba sgra mi rtag ste mi rtag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba chos nyid gtan tshigs nyid du brjod pa'i ma grub pa yang bshad par rig par bya'o //
translated: By these, the thesis is also stated. The unestablished reason that is stated as the property itself should be understood as Sound is impermanent because of impermanence, where the property itself is stated as the reason.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: The reversal from the discordant side means not being on the discordant side.

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni chos can nam chos nyid sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba'o //üîΩnyid yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni chos can nam chos nyid sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba'o // nyid yin no zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And there, it is said, on the subject or on the property itself, it would be established.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir rtags ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir rtags ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the property to be established, the reason is unestablished.

original: gal te phyogs la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: gal te phyogs la sogs pa ste //
translated: If it is the position and so on,

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gis phan tshun tha dad pa gsum du gnas pa'i phyir mi mthun ba'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba rtags kyi rang bzhin gyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag gis phan tshun tha dad pa gsum du gnas pa'i phyir mi mthun ba'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba rtags kyi rang bzhin gyi chos mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin la /
translated: Because the three states of being are mutually different due to the concordant and discordant sides, the property of the reason called ‚Äúnot the discordant side‚Äù is not the discordant side,

original: bsgrub par bya ba can du gyur pa mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin ba gsum pa phyogs la yod ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba can du gyur pa mthun pa'i phyogs kyang ma yin ba gsum pa phyogs la yod ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: and the third, the property of the reason called ‚Äúnot the concordant side‚Äù is not the concordant side.

original: de'i phyir rtags grub po snyam mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rtags grub po snyam mo //
translated: Therefore, the reason is established.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis so //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù means by the continuum.

original: de las bzlog pa mi mthun @275b pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni sgrub bar mi 'dod pa'o /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa mi mthun @275b pa'i phyogs so zhes bya ba ni sgrub bar mi 'dod pa'o /
translated: ‚ÄúThe opposite of that is the discordant side‚Äù means that which is not to be established.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin yang zhes bya ba pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag gi dngos po ma yin na sgrub bar 'dod pas ni phyogs su 'gyur pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba med pa dngos pos gnas pa yang 'dod pas 'jig parüîΩ'gyur te / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin yang zhes bya ba pa'i phyogs su rnam par gzhag gi dngos po ma yin na sgrub bar 'dod pas ni phyogs su 'gyur pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsgrub par bya ba med pa dngos pos gnas pa yang 'dod pas 'jig par 'gyur te / mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the discordant side is not established as a thing, and it is also not accepted as a thing.

original: de lta na gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs 'ga' yang ma nges par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were so, then no reason would be indefinite,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir 'dod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par byas nas rtags nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyang 'dod pas byas pa'i phyir 'dod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs med par byas nas rtags nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the discordant side is also made by acceptance, and by making the discordant side nonexistent through acceptance, it would become a reason.

original: mang du smras so zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di nyid du'o //
analyzed: mang du smras so zhes bya ba ni le'u 'di nyid du'o //
translated: As for much has been said, it is in this very chapter.

original: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa tsam thams cad ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam mo //
analyzed: gal te bsgrub par bya ba ma grub pa tsam thams cad ces bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam mo //
translated: If it is said that only the nonestablishment of the probandum is the reason, the nonestablishment of the probandum is only the absence of the probandum.

original: gnyi ga la nges bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas bsgrub par bya ba med par nges pa'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga la nges bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi gas bsgrub par bya ba med par nges pa'o //
translated: Both must be ascertained: both the proponent and the opponent must ascertain the absence of the probandum.

original: de'i phyir chos can la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos can la zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la'o //
translated: Therefore, with regard to the subject, i.e., with regard to the subject of the probandum.üîΩBecause it is not ascertained, i.e., because the absence of the probandum is not ascertained by the proponent and the opponent.

original: ma nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis bsgrub par bya ba med par ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin grub po zhe na /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba dag gis bsgrub par bya ba med par ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin grub po zhe na /
translated: The non-difference from that is the nature of the reason.

original: 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs su byas pa 'dir bsgrub par bya ba la des na ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthunüîΩpa'i phyogs ma yin zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin yang zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gtan tshigs su byas pa 'dir bsgrub par bya ba la des na ni mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur bas bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba yin pa'i phyir mi mthunüîΩpa'i phyogs ma yin zhes bya ba gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Here, although it is not the dissimilar class, i.e., although the probandum is not the reason, in this case, the probandum is the similar class, because it is the probandum. Therefore, because there is doubt about the probandum, the non-difference from that is the reason.

original: de lta na gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba log pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
analyzed: de lta na gtan tshigs de bsgrub par bya ba log pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin la /
translated: In that case, the reason is the opposite of the predicate, which is the discordant side.üîΩIf the definition of the opposite of that is not ascertained, then the predicate is established.üîΩIf the path is reversed, then the ascertainment is established as the discordant side.

original: de las log pa'i mtshan nyid du ma nges na ni bsgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir lam log na nges pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du grub pa'i phyir ldog pa ma nges pa de ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de las log pa'i mtshan nyid du ma nges na ni bsgrub par bya ba grub pa'i phyir lam log na nges pa yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid du grub pa'i phyir ldog pa ma nges pa de ji ltar na sgrub par byed pa yin te /
translated: How can that which is not ascertained be a proof?

original: rtags de'i mtshan nyid ldog pa nges ba ma nges pa ste ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtags de'i mtshan nyid ldog pa nges ba ma nges pa ste ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the definition of the reason, the ascertainment of the opposite, is not established.

original: gal te de nyid kyis na de zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de nyid kyis na gtan tshigs te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyis na de zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa de nyid kyis na gtan tshigs te /
translated: If it is said that ‚Äúthat very thing which is not the discordant side is the reason,‚Äù

original: rtags kyi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid nges so zhe na /
analyzed: rtags kyi ldog pa'i mtshan nyid nges so zhe na /
translated: the definition of the opposite of the reason is ascertained.üîΩHow can that which is not ascertained be ascertained?

original: ji ltar ma nges pas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni des na sngar smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa ma nges @276a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ma nges pas nges pa yin no zhes bya ba ni des na sngar smos pa'i skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ldog pa ma nges @276a * //
translated: Because the previously mentioned fault would ensue.

original: pa rtags yin na des ji ltar nges pa yin /
analyzed: pa rtags yin na des ji ltar nges pa yin /
translated: If the opposite is not ascertained, how can it be a reason?

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir ldog pa ma nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩ'di 'di la the tshom za ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par the tshom yang za la /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir ldog pa ma nges pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // 'di 'di la the tshom za ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rtags 'di mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par the tshom yang za la /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, ‚ÄúThe inconclusive is that which is doubted, etc.‚ÄùüîΩBecause of doubt about this, he says, ‚ÄúBecause of doubt about this, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid kyi phyir te the tshom za ba de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di gtan tshigs 'di la med do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir te the tshom za ba de nyid kyi phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'di gtan tshigs 'di la med do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because of that, i.e., because of doubt, the reason does not exist in the discordant side.

original: chos rnams 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med pas phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su dngos po'i dbang gis gnas kyi skyes bus phyogs su byas pa dang /
analyzed: chos rnams 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa la mi ltos pa'o zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang med pas phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su dngos po'i dbang gis gnas kyi skyes bus phyogs su byas pa dang /
translated: It is not dependent on the establishment of the presence and absence of the property in the similar and dissimilar instances, i.e., the probandum is not absent from the similar instance and is not present in the dissimilar instance by the power of things, but is posited as the similar and dissimilar instances by the person who posits them.

original: ma byas pa las bsgrub par bya ba mi ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o//
analyzed: ma byas pa las bsgrub par bya ba mi ldog par mi 'gyur ba'o//
translated: The probandum does not fail to be absent from the reason when it is not posited as the similar instance and is posited as the dissimilar instance.

original: phung po gsum pa'i ldog pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin zhes bya ba rtags su 'dod pa gang bsgrub par bya ba yod pa 'am /
analyzed: phung po gsum pa'i ldog pa ni med do zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin zhes bya ba rtags su 'dod pa gang bsgrub par bya ba yod pa 'am /
translated: The third alternative is not possible.üîΩThis is the reason that is accepted as the reason, ‚Äúis not the discordant side.‚Äù

original: med pa las gzhan pa phung po gsum pa ni med do //
analyzed: med pa las gzhan pa phung po gsum pa ni med do //
translated: The third alternative is not possible, which is other than the existence or nonexistence of the probandum.üîΩBecause when one of them is eliminated, the other is engaged.

original: de dag gcig ldog na gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang / med pa dang de dag las phyogs la gcig log na cig shos 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gcig ldog na gzhan 'jug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba yod pa dang / med pa dang de dag las phyogs la gcig log na cig shos 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because when one of them is eliminated, the other is engaged, in the subject that is the probandum, existence or nonexistence.

original: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa med pa log pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtags kyis so //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mi rtag pa med pa log pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin pa nyid ces bya ba'i rtags kyis so //
translated: Otherwise, the nonexistence of impermanence would not be the discordant side, by the reason, ‚Äúis not the discordant side.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la zhes bya ba sgra la'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la zhes bya ba sgra la'o //
translated: In the subject that is the probandum, impermanence, sound is the subject.

original: ji ltar sgrub par byed de phyogs kyi chos phung po gsum par gyur pa na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgrub par byed de phyogs kyi chos phung po gsum par gyur pa na /
translated: How is it established? When the property of the subject becomes the third alternative,

original: bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir te yod pa dang med par nges pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba la the tshom za ba'i phyir te yod pa dang med par nges pa ma yin par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is doubt about the probandum, because it is not accepted that it is ascertained as existent or nonexistent.

original: yang ji ltar na mi rtag pa med pa ldog pas zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: yang ji ltar na mi rtag pa med pa ldog pas zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa nyid kyis so //
translated: Moreover, how is it that the nonexistence of impermanence is negated?

original: mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed de rtags nyid grub zin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med do //
analyzed: mi rtag pa bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la sgrub par byed de rtags nyid grub zin pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba med do //
translated: The probandum is not established in the subject that is being proven by the sign of impermanence, because the sign itself is already established.

original: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin na'o //
analyzed: gal te de ni zhes bya ba ni gal te skyes bu'i 'dod pas phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin na'o //
translated: If it is said that the probandum is not established, if the person's desire does not make something a similar or dissimilar class,

original: phyogs su 'dod kyang dngos pos bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i yang srid pa'i phyir phyogs su byas pa dang yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ram zhe na'o //
analyzed: phyogs su 'dod kyang dngos pos bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i yang srid pa'i phyir phyogs su byas pa dang yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ram zhe na'o //
translated: then even if something is asserted as a similar class, it may be possible that it is not established by the thing, so would it not be a dissimilar class?

original: rnam grangs kyis na zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa la rtags ltar snang bas phyogs su byas na dngos pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis na zhes bya ba ni res 'ga' ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa la rtags ltar snang bas phyogs su byas na dngos pos mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some cases‚Äù means sometimes. When a pseudo-reason is taken as the subject, it is not a real counter-position.

original: gal te de ltar na phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag bye brag med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag bye brag med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then the position and the counter-position will be indistinguishable.

original: mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni zhes bya ba phyogs kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres par bstan zin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi bye brag ni zhes bya ba phyogs kha na ma tho ba med pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres par bstan zin to //
translated: The difference in their definitions has already been explained: a faultless position is one that is not mixed with a counter-position.

original: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid sngar smras pa @276b yin te ;
analyzed: yang na mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid sngar smras pa @276b yin te ;
translated: Or, the definition of a counter-position was stated earlier:

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan par zhes so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang mi ldan par zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is a position that does not possess the property to be proven.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi the tshom med pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par nges pa nyid yin la de la yang phyogs kyi chos su gyur na phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya
analyzed: gzhan yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi the tshom med pa la zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin par nges pa nyid yin la de la yang phyogs kyi chos su gyur na phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya
translated: Moreover, with regard to the phrase ‚Äúwithout doubt about the discordant class,‚Äù the reason is ascertained as not being a member of the discordant class.üîΩ

original: ba med par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba med par the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúthe absence of doubt with regard to the discordant side‚Äù is the very ascertainment that the reason is not the discordant side. And, if it were the property of the subject, then there would be doubt as to the probandum being absent from the discordant side.

original: de lta bu'i phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba med pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam bar bcad pa grub zin pa la'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i phyogs la bsgrub par bya ba med pa zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam bar bcad pa grub zin pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe probandum being absent from such a side‚Äù is the exclusion of the discordant side, which is already established.

original: yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa 'chad pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ni don med do //
analyzed: yang bsgrub par bya ba med pa 'chad pa'i don du gtan tshigs brjod pa ni don med do //
translated: Moreover, it is pointless to state a reason for the purpose of explaining the absence of the probandum.

original: gal te khyod ci ltar na yang phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba ma nges pa yin la de'i chos kyang ji ltar ldog par nges she na /
analyzed: gal te khyod ci ltar na yang phyogs ni bsgrub par bya ba ma nges pa yin la de'i chos kyang ji ltar ldog par nges she na /
translated: But how can the side be uncertain with regard to the probandum, and how can its property be ascertained as the preclusion?

original: de 'ba' zhig nyid kyi zhes bya ba phyogs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa stong pa'i rtags kyi chos kyi'o //
analyzed: de 'ba' zhig nyid kyi zhes bya ba phyogs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa stong pa'i rtags kyi chos kyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat alone‚Äù is the property of the reason, which is devoid of the understanding of the side, etc.

original: gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos de me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas du ma'i tshig tu byas so //
analyzed: gang dag gis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos de me dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i dbye bas du ma'i tshig tu byas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy which‚Äù refers to the many words of the probandum, such as fire, impermanence, and so on.

original: de dag yod pa dang med pa go rims bzhin du gtan tshigs 'jug pa dang ldog pa nye bar ston la /
analyzed: de dag yod pa dang med pa go rims bzhin du gtan tshigs 'jug pa dang ldog pa nye bar ston la /
translated: The existence and nonexistence of those, respectively, indicate the application and reversal of the reason.

original: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi rtags kyi dngos po'i phyogs la yod par grub na /
analyzed: de ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa can grub pa'i bdag nyid kyi rtags kyi dngos po'i phyogs la yod par grub na /
translated: Thus, when the existence of the sign is established in the subject, it is established that the probandum is pervaded by the sign.üîΩWhen the nature of that pervasion is implicitly established, the probandum is established. After that, the term ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is applied to the subject that is the object of affirmation.

original: de'i khyab pa'i rang bzhin shugs kyis phyogs de bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de ltar grub na bsgrub par bya ba grub pa de'i rjes la chos can dang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos can dag sdom pa'i spyi'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du tha snyad btags pa 'byung
analyzed: de'i khyab pa'i rang bzhin shugs kyis phyogs de bsgrub par bya ba yod pa de ltar grub na bsgrub par bya ba grub pa de'i rjes la chos can dang sgrub par 'dod pa'i chos can dag sdom pa'i spyi'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid du tha snyad btags pa 'byung
translated: The term ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is a general term that is applied to the subject and the probandum.

original: bas phyis shugs kyis phyogs kyi yul de phyogs kyang yin la yul yang yin pas de skad brjod do //
analyzed: bas phyis shugs kyis phyogs kyi yul de phyogs kyang yin la yul yang yin pas de skad brjod do //
translated: Later, the term ‚Äúsubject‚Äù is applied to the subject that is the object of affirmation.

original: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa nye bar ston pa'i dus na phyogs ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i chos ni rtags nyi tshe ba'i mtshan nyid du nges pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dag
analyzed: de'i phyir phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa nye bar ston pa'i dus na phyogs ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir de'i mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i chos ni rtags nyi tshe ba'i mtshan nyid du nges pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dag
translated: Therefore, when the relation of the property of the subject to the reason is being taught, the subject is not a part, because the property of the subject is ascertained as the definition of the reason.

original: rtogs pa'i dus na ste 'brel pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtogs pa'i dus na phyogs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dag yod pa ma yin yang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa nus pa'i phyir phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtags kyi yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i dus na ste 'brel pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can la rtogs pa'i dus na phyogs la sogs pa'i rtogs pa dag yod pa ma yin yang bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa nus pa'i phyir phyogs la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid ni rtags kyi yan lag ma yin no //
translated: When the property to be proven is understood, the subject and so on are not understood, because the understanding of the subject and so on is not a condition for the understanding of the property to be proven.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i bye brag 'ba' zhig go //üîΩde las bzlog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i bye brag 'ba' zhig go // de las bzlog pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: The other is the mere absence of the property to be proven.üîΩThe opposite of that is the discordant class.

original: de las gol ba ni de ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de las gol ba ni de ma yin pa'o //
translated: Deviating from that is the dissimilar instance.

original: ji lta bu bya ba ni ma grub pa yin nom ma yin snyam pa'o //
analyzed: ji lta bu bya ba ni ma grub pa yin nom ma yin snyam pa'o //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúWhat is the example?‚ÄùüîΩThe response is, ‚ÄúIt is like the non-establishment of the non-existence of sound.‚Äù

original: de la yang skyon med pa nyid de zhes zer ba ni pha rol lo //
analyzed: de la yang skyon med pa nyid de zhes zer ba ni pha rol lo //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThere is no error in that.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù

original: cig shos zhes smras ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //üîΩ'di ltar bsam pa ni de las @277a * //
analyzed: cig shos zhes smras ba'i phyir ro zhes zer ro // 'di ltar bsam pa ni de las @277a * //
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúBecause the other is mentioned.‚Äù

original: bzlog pas stong pa 'ba' zhig smos na ni de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlog pas stong pa 'ba' zhig smos na ni de bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir skyon snga ma nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: The thought here is that if only the negation were mentioned, the error would be the same as before, because the mere property of the probandum would be established.

original: 'dir cig shos zhes bya ba smos pas bsgrub par bya ba gang yang rung ba ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam las ldog pa ni rtags ma yin gyi med pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig las ldog pa'i phyir rtags 'grub po snyam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir cig shos zhes bya ba smos pas bsgrub par bya ba gang yang rung ba ste bsgrub par bya ba med pa tsam las ldog pa ni rtags ma yin gyi med pa'i khyad par 'ga' zhig las ldog pa'i phyir rtags 'grub po snyam pa'o //
translated: The response is, ‚ÄúBecause the other is mentioned, the mere absence of the probandum is not the evidence, but the evidence is established because it is the negation of some particular absence.‚Äù

original: ji ltar zhe na /üîΩmed pa tsam las ldog pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na / med pa tsam las ldog pa ni /
translated: How is that?

original: bsgrub bar bya ba yin la bye brag 'ba' zhig las log pa ni rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgrub bar bya ba yin la bye brag 'ba' zhig las log pa ni rtags yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere absence is the probandum, but the evidence is the negation of some particular absence.

original: lan gdab ba 'di la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan gdab ba 'di la yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to this is ‚ÄúIn this case, too, . . .‚Äù

original: cig shos la zhes rtags bye brag tu smos pa la rang gi 'dod pas gnod pa nyid de /
analyzed: cig shos la zhes rtags bye brag tu smos pa la rang gi 'dod pas gnod pa nyid de /
translated: The reason, ‚Äúin the other,‚Äù is specified, and is undermined by our own position.

original: phyogs la yang bsgrub par bya ba med par khas blangs pas so //
analyzed: phyogs la yang bsgrub par bya ba med par khas blangs pas so //
translated: And in the case of the subject, the probandum is accepted as nonexistent.

original: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid las cig shos las log pas zhes bya ba 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid las cig shos las log pas zhes bya ba 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, it is tenable to say, ‚ÄúIn the other, the absence of the probandum is excluded.‚Äù

original: de med par khas mi len na zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid khas mi len na'o //
analyzed: de med par khas mi len na zhes bya ba ni phyogs de la bsgrub par bya ba med pa nyid khas mi len na'o //
translated: ‚Äú If you do not accept that‚Äù means if you do not accept that the probandum is nonexistent in the subject.

original: nus pa med ces bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nus pa med ces bya ba ni dgos pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It is not possible‚Äù means it is not necessary.

original: pha rol gyis bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa khyed kyi bsam pas 'di med pa yin pas zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsum du 'dod pas de dag la cig shos med pa las log pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: pha rol gyis bsam pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas pa khyed kyi bsam pas 'di med pa yin pas zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs gsum du 'dod pas de dag la cig shos med pa las log pa zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚Äú The intention of the opponent‚Äù refers to the intention of you Buddhists. Since this is nonexistent, the three types of counterexamples are accepted as the discordant class. Therefore, in those cases, the absence of the other is excluded.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las cig shos med pas rtags dben pa khyod khas len pa'i phyir khyod la grub brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs de las cig shos med pas rtags dben pa khyod khas len pa'i phyir khyod la grub brjod do zhe na /
translated: You accept the absence of evidence of the opposite of the discordant side, so we say that it is established for you.

original: de la nyes ba med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la nyes ba med pa ma yin te /
translated: There is no fault in this,

original: 'di ltar med pa la don dam par te dngos pos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa la don dam par te dngos pos so //
translated: because nonexistence is in the ultimate, that is, in reality.

original: cig shos zhes brjod par bya ba'i dbye bas phyogs las phan tshun gzhan du gzhag par rung ba ci zhig yod //
analyzed: cig shos zhes brjod par bya ba'i dbye bas phyogs las phan tshun gzhan du gzhag par rung ba ci zhig yod //
translated: What is there that is suitable to be posited as different from the side of the discordant side by the expression ‚Äúthe opposite‚Äù?

original: 'o na med pa zhes bya ba nyid ji ltar bzhag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na med pa zhes bya ba nyid ji ltar bzhag ce na /
translated: Well then, how is nonexistence itself posited?

original: 'di ltar gcig gi mtshan nyid gzhan ser po la sogs pa ma mthong na blos sngon po 'di las ser po 'di rnam par dbye ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gi mtshan nyid gzhan ser po la sogs pa ma mthong na blos sngon po 'di las ser po 'di rnam par dbye ba ste /
translated: In this way, when the characteristic of one thing, such as yellow, is not seen, the mind distinguishes this yellow from this blue.

original: sngon po med pa'i zhes rtogs so //
analyzed: sngon po med pa'i zhes rtogs so //
translated: It understands that it is the absence of blue.

original: de'i phyir med pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa 'di ni dngos po'i chos nyid de /
translated: Therefore this nonexistence is the reality of things.

original: de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni bye brag tu gzhag pa'o //
translated: Because of that, it is posited as a distinct category.

original: gal te de lta na khyed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye ba gsum du ji ltar 'gyur te med pa ni dbye bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta na khyed kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbye ba gsum du ji ltar 'gyur te med pa ni dbye bar mi srid pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how could there be three types of contradistinctions in your system, because it is impossible to divide that which does not exist?

original: rnam par rtog pas brtags pa 'ga' zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas brtags pa 'ga' zhig zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúsome imagined by thought,‚Äù and so on.

original: ldog pa dngos su rtogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i med pa dgag pa tsam gyis rtogs bar nus pa'i phyir dang dbye ba gsum pa yang blos byas pa'i phyir skyon med par ston to //
analyzed: ldog pa dngos su rtogs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'i med pa dgag pa tsam gyis rtogs bar nus pa'i phyir dang dbye ba gsum pa yang blos byas pa'i phyir skyon med par ston to //
translated: This shows that there is no error, because the actual contradistinctions are capable of being understood through the mere negation of the object of affirmation, and because the third contradistinction is mentally fabricated.

original: yod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba can zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa ste de las phan tshun tha dad pa can te /
analyzed: yod pa dang rjes su 'brel ba can zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa ste de las phan tshun tha dad pa can te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthat which is related to existence‚Äù is an external negation, and it is different from that.

original: de las grol bas 'di rtags su @277b brjod na yang rtags des bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad sel bar byed de de lta na yang rtags 'di bsgrub bar bya ba med pas stong pa zhes bya bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de las grol bas 'di rtags su @277b brjod na yang rtags des bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad sel bar byed de de lta na yang rtags 'di bsgrub bar bya ba med pas stong pa zhes bya bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If that were the reason, then that reason would eliminate all nonexistents that are objects of affirmation, and in that case, this reason would be called ‚Äúempty of the object of affirmation.‚Äù

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is that which is to be established.

original: rtags ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags ma grub pa yin no //
translated: The reason is not established.üîΩOr, it is mistaken.

original: yang na 'khrul pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin 'gal ba dang / gzhan pa yin la des stong na zhes bya ba de dag rnam par bcad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa ni /
analyzed: yang na 'khrul pa can yin no zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba ma yin par dgag pa'i rang bzhin 'gal ba dang / gzhan pa yin la des stong na zhes bya ba de dag rnam par bcad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa ni /
translated: That which is the opposite of the nature of the negation of the probandum is contradictory, and if it is empty of that, then the nature that is the mere exclusion of those is also an utterly nonexistent nature, because it is also an utterly nonexistent nature.

original: gtan med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i dngos po las gzhan gtan med pa yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan med pa'i bdag nyid kyang yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'i dngos po las gzhan gtan med pa yang 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is also engaged in a thing that is impermanent and utterly nonexistent, which is different from a thing.

original: gal te 'di ltar yang de zhes bya ba rgol ba de 'dod pa 'ba' zhig ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di ltar yang de zhes bya ba rgol ba de 'dod pa 'ba' zhig ste /
translated: If it is like this, then the opponent‚Äôs assertion is only that

original: de kho na las tha dad pa zhes bya ba de las grol ba rtags nyid kyi ngo bor bzhag pa yin pas de gtan med pa la yang mi 'jug la cig shos la zhes bya ba'i bye brag kyang 'grub ste /
analyzed: de kho na las tha dad pa zhes bya ba de las grol ba rtags nyid kyi ngo bor bzhag pa yin pas de gtan med pa la yang mi 'jug la cig shos la zhes bya ba'i bye brag kyang 'grub ste /
translated: that which is different from reality is liberated from that, and because that is posited as the nature of the reason, it is not engaged in an utterly nonexistent thing, and the distinction of the other is also established.

original: bzlog pa 'gal ba dang gzhan pa dag las cig shos ltar med pa las grol ba yin pa'i phyir dam bca' dang khyad par yod la cig shos kyi sgras phyogs ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzlog pa 'gal ba dang gzhan pa dag las cig shos ltar med pa las grol ba yin pa'i phyir dam bca' dang khyad par yod la cig shos kyi sgras phyogs ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The other is free from the contradictory and the different, and therefore it has a thesis and a distinction. But the other is not free from the subject, because the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù does not take a position.

original: 'dod pas gnod pa yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dod pas gnod pa yang med do zhe na /
translated: Nor is there any harm in the assertion.

original: de lta na zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya ba ni bshad ma thag pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú In that case‚Äù means as just explained.

original: de las tha dad pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las grol ba ni de rtags su mi 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de las tha dad pa ni de ltar mi 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa las grol ba ni de rtags su mi 'gyur ba ste /
translated: ‚Äú It would not be different from that‚Äù means that the probandum, which is free from nonexistence, would not be the logical reason.

original: 'gal ba dang gzhan pa dag las grol ba yang rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang gzhan pa dag las grol ba yang rtags ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the contradictory and the different, which are free from the logical reason, are not the logical reason.

original: 'on kyang 'dod pas yin la zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i 'dod pas dngos po mtshungs kyang 'ba' zhig kho na rtags su byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pas yin la zhes bya ba ni rgol ba'i 'dod pas dngos po mtshungs kyang 'ba' zhig kho na rtags su byed pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú But it is only because of the assertion‚Äù means that although the thing is the same, only the assertion of the opponent makes it the logical reason.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gyur na zhes bya ba 'dod pas med pa las grol ba yin la 'dod pa bzhin du gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa bzhin du gyur na zhes bya ba 'dod pas med pa las grol ba yin la 'dod pa bzhin du gyur na /
translated: ‚Äú If it were as asserted‚Äù means that because of the assertion, it is free from nonexistence. If it were as asserted,

original: 'gal ba la sogs pa dag la yang rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba la sogs pa dag la yang rtags su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would follow, absurdly, that even contradictions and so forth would be reasons.

original: de'i phyir dngos pos rtags gnas pa med kyi 'dod pas gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po drangs par rab tu brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos pos rtags gnas pa med kyi 'dod pas gnas pa'i phyir 'dod pa kho nas bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po drangs par rab tu brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, since the reason does not exist by virtue of the thing itself, but by virtue of what is accepted, it is said that the thing to be proven is drawn out by what is accepted alone.

original: de ltar bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de kho na ste kho bo 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ltar yin no zhes 'dod pa kho na rtags su brjod par rigs kyi phan tshun spangs te cig shos las grol bas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de ltar bstan par 'gyur ba'i phyir de kho na ste kho bo 'dod pa'i phyir 'di ltar yin no zhes 'dod pa kho na rtags su brjod par rigs kyi phan tshun spangs te cig shos las grol bas ci zhig bya /
translated: Since it is taught in this way, it is only what is accepted that is to be stated as the reason, saying, ‚ÄúIt is like this because it is what I accept,‚Äù but what purpose is there in stating that it is free from being either of the two, since that is implied?

original: de la yang zhes bya ba 'dod pa de la yang ngo//
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba 'dod pa de la yang ngo//
translated: ‚ÄúEven in that‚Äù means ‚Äúeven in that which is accepted.‚Äù

original: don rnam par gzhag pa'i lugs ni gzhung 'di dag gi phyogs so //
analyzed: don rnam par gzhag pa'i lugs ni gzhung 'di dag gi phyogs so //
translated: The system of positing the meaning is the position of these texts.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i sgra ni mi rtag ste /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i sgra ni mi rtag ste /
translated: Sound that occurs immediately upon the exertion of the faculties is impermanent

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid yin no //
translated: because it occurs immediately upon the exertion of the faculties.

original: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lan ni de nyid ces bya ba smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat itself.‚Äù

original: sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid ldog pa tha dad pa ste sgra dang sgra nyid dag ni sgra ma yin pa @278a * //üîΩlas log pa nyid du zad pas chos can rtogs pa la rtags kyi rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i yul gyis tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ste sgra yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de nyid ldog pa tha dad pa ste sgra dang sgra nyid dag ni sgra ma yin pa @278a * // las log pa nyid du zad pas chos can rtogs pa la rtags kyi rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i yul gyis tha snyad du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sound is impermanent because it is a sound. This is the same with a different exclusion, because sound and soundness are merely the exclusions of non-sound.üîΩSince the realization of the subject is not different from the realization of the reason, it is conventionally said that the reason has a non-different object.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid 'di la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du yang bye brag byas pa zhes bya ba brtsal ma thag pa las byung ba'i sgra zhes so //
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid 'di la ni bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can du yang bye brag byas pa zhes bya ba brtsal ma thag pa las byung ba'i sgra zhes so //
translated: This is the property of the subject in the proof of sound as impermanent.

original: gtan tshigs spyi'i chos zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba las byung ba tsam mo //
analyzed: gtan tshigs spyi'i chos zhes bya ba ni rtsol ba las byung ba tsam mo //
translated: The reason is a general property, merely arisen from effort.

original: yan lag ni rtags so //
analyzed: yan lag ni rtags so //
translated: The part is the reason.

original: yan lag can ni rtags can no //
analyzed: yan lag can ni rtags can no //
translated: The whole is the subject.

original: phyogs yan lag la mi gnod phyir te /
analyzed: phyogs yan lag la mi gnod phyir te /
translated: Because the part does not contradict the position.

original: phyogs dang yan lag dag chos kyi bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang yan lag dag chos kyi bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir ma grub pa'i gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: Since the position and the part are different particulars of the property, there is no fault of non-establishment.

original: chos can tha dad ma grub pa min te rtags rtsol ba las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya ba ma grub pa ma yin pa'o //üîΩrva can ni gong bu'i bye brag go //
analyzed: chos can tha dad ma grub pa min te rtags rtsol ba las byung ba'i sgra zhes bya ba ma grub pa ma yin pa'o // rva can ni gong bu'i bye brag go //
translated: The subject is not unestablished, because the reason, the sound that arises from effort, is not unestablished.üîΩThe horned one is a particular of the aggregate.

original: rva can phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
analyzed: rva can phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //
translated: The horned one is the general.

original: yang na zhes bya ba ni chos dang rtags dag kyang gcig ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na zhes bya ba ni chos dang rtags dag kyang gcig ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Or is the reason and the subject not the same?

original: bsgrub bya'i dus na ni zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i dus na ni zhes bya ba rtogs pa'i dus na'o //
translated: At the time of the probandum, at the time of understanding.

original: yan lag min rtags kyis rnam par rtog pa med pas na /
analyzed: yan lag min rtags kyis rnam par rtog pa med pas na /
translated: Because the reason is not conceptual,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang gcig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos dang gcig pa ma yin te /
translated: it is not the same as the probandum.

original: bsgrub par bya ba de rtogs kyi rtog pas nye bar mtshon te khong du chud par byas nas rtags kyi rtog pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir de ldog pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can nyid dag gcig pa med pas na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba de rtogs kyi rtog pas nye bar mtshon te khong du chud par byas nas rtags kyi rtog pa nyid dgag pa'i phyir de ldog pa'i phyir rtags dang rtags can nyid dag gcig pa med pas na'o //
translated: Because the probandum is understood, having been comprehended by the conceptual representation, the reason is negated by the conceptual representation itself. Therefore, because of the exclusion of that, the reason and the subject are not the same.

original: chos kyi bye brag ni mi rtag pa dang btsal ma thag tu byung ba dag go //
analyzed: chos kyi bye brag ni mi rtag pa dang btsal ma thag tu byung ba dag go //
translated: The particular of the property is impermanence and arising immediately after being sought.

original: tshang tshing zhes bya ba ni ri'i gsab gseb dag go //
analyzed: tshang tshing zhes bya ba ni ri'i gsab gseb dag go //
translated: The term ‚Äúthicket‚Äù refers to the interior of a mountain.

original: yang na nags ma tshang tshing ngo //
analyzed: yang na nags ma tshang tshing ngo //
translated: Or, it refers to a forest.

original: pha'i tha snyad btags pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid nyid mtshams sbyor te pa'i byed pa'o //
analyzed: pha'i tha snyad btags pa'i rgyu ni bdag nyid nyid mtshams sbyor te pa'i byed pa'o //
translated: The cause of the designation of father is the act of connecting with the self.

original: 'dis ni phyis dmigs pa med de mi dran pa'i phyir ma mthong ba dag 'dra bas so //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyis dmigs pa med de mi dran pa'i phyir ma mthong ba dag 'dra bas so //
translated: This is because, later, when the object is not present, one does not remember it, just as one does not remember what one did not see.

original: 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni smra ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal ba med pa'i mtshan nyid can zhes bya ba ni smra ba dang 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of non-contradiction refers to speech, freedom from passion, and so on.

original: dbang pos mi sod pa yang de dag nyid de sems kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyis bskal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang pos mi sod pa yang de dag nyid de sems kyi chos kyi rang bzhin gyis bskal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not perceived by the senses because they are mental phenomena, and because they are beyond the scope of the senses.

original: bdag nyid rang gis rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid rang gis rtogs pas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúone realizes by oneself‚Äù means that one is oneself free from passion and so on.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mang du za ba dang sngo bsangs pa la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du za ba dang / dkar sham dag la rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mang du za ba dang sngo bsangs pa la sogs pa yang gzhan nyid du za ba dang / dkar sham dag la rtogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The consequence of absurdity is that one would also eat the other, the fat man, etc., and one would understand the white cow, etc.

original: gal te mthong bas 'gal bas zhes bya ba ni mi sbyor te de dag mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mthong bas 'gal bas zhes bya ba ni mi sbyor te de dag mthong bas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not connected because of the contradiction of seeing,

original: rigs pa mtshungs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la mthong bar 'dod chags dang dkar sham dag mtshungs zhes mang du za ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi sbyor te /
analyzed: rigs pa mtshungs bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid la mthong bar 'dod chags dang dkar sham dag mtshungs zhes mang du za ba la sogs pa ci'i phyir mi sbyor te /
translated: then, since the reason is the same, why is it not connected to the fat man, etc., just as it is to the white cow, which is the same in being seen?

original: mthong bas gnod par mi rigs so @278b snyam pa'o //
analyzed: mthong bas gnod par mi rigs so @278b snyam pa'o //
translated: It is not reasonable that it is contradicted by seeing.

original: yang na de rigs pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par mi bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rtogs pa de'o //
analyzed: yang na de rigs pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod par mi bya ba ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid rtogs pa de'o //
translated: Or, it should not be called a characteristic of reasoning.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba srid pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mthong bas gnod pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the contradiction is possible.

original: ldog pa las kyang zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas grogs byas pa'i bdag la mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa dpog par byed de /
analyzed: ldog pa las kyang zhes bya ba mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong bas grogs byas pa'i bdag la mthong bas 'dod chags la sogs pa dpog par byed de /
translated: Also, from the reverse, since one does not see attachment and so on in those who are free of attachment, one infers attachment and so on in those who are not free of attachment.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rdo la sogs pa la smra ba ma mthong bas so //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rdo la sogs pa la smra ba ma mthong bas so //
translated: One does not see speech in rocks and so on that are free of attachment.

original: de med na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa de med na ste /
analyzed: de med na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa de med na ste /
translated: If that does not exist, then that reverse does not exist.üîΩIf one does not see that, then one does not infer from that seeing of oneself that others eat a lot and so on, because one sees that one who does not eat a lot is not oneself.

original: bdag nyid la mthong ba des mang du za ba la sogs pa gzhan la dpog par mi byed de de gzhan nyung ngu za ba ma yin pa bdag nyid la mthong ba yin par mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par miüîΩbyed ce na /
analyzed: bdag nyid la mthong ba des mang du za ba la sogs pa gzhan la dpog par mi byed de de gzhan nyung ngu za ba ma yin pa bdag nyid la mthong ba yin par mthong bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par miüîΩbyed ce na /
translated: One does not establish that from the reverse, since it does not exist in the dissimilar class.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pa'i bdag nyid la mthong ba'i mang du za ba la sogs pa dang / 'jug par the tshom za ba bdag la mthong ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags nges pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag nyid la mthong bas bsgrub par mi bya'o //üîΩde nyid rgyas par bshad pa la mthong ba yang zhes bya ba ni dkar sham la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba mthong ba dag kyang bdag nyid la mthong ba mang du za ba la sogs pa de dag dang gzhan la de'i bdag nyid du dpag pa
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la zhugs pa'i bdag nyid la mthong ba'i mang du za ba la sogs pa dang / 'jug par the tshom za ba bdag la mthong ba dang 'dod chags la sogs pa dag gis mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rtags nges pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bdag nyid la mthong bas bsgrub par mi bya'o // de nyid rgyas par bshad pa la mthong ba yang zhes bya ba ni dkar sham la sogs pa mthong ba dang 'gal ba mthong ba dag kyang bdag nyid la mthong ba mang du za ba la sogs pa de dag dang gzhan la de'i bdag nyid du dpag pa
translated: The self that is engaged in the discordant side, such as the one who sees and the one who eats much, and the one who doubts engagement, cannot establish the evidence in the discordant side, such as the self who sees and the one who is attached. Therefore, attachment and so on are not established by seeing the self.üîΩThe extensive explanation of that: Seeing and seeing are also not established by the self. Seeing white and so on and seeing the opposite of that are also not established by the self. The one who sees and the one who eats much and so on are inferred to have that nature in others.

original: dag tu mthong ba dag 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan la bsgrub par mi bya'o //
analyzed: dag tu mthong ba dag 'gal ba dmigs pa'i phyir gzhan la bsgrub par mi bya'o //
translated: Seeing the opposite of that is observed. Therefore, they are not established in others.

original: 'gal ba ma mthong ba dag kyang bdag nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang la mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni mi mthong ba nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs bdag dang 'gal ba so sor sbyar ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal ba ma mthong ba dag kyang bdag nyid 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang la mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid rnams ni mi mthong ba nyid kyi phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs bdag dang 'gal ba so sor sbyar ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who do not see contradiction, who do not see themselves as being attached and so on, cannot establish the application of the contradiction to the self, because they do not see it.

original: gzhan la bsgrub par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan la bsgrub par mi bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they should not prove it to others.

original: 'di ltar rgyu gang gis na 'gal bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bsam par nges na rtags des bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rgyu gang gis na 'gal bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la bsam par nges na rtags des bsgrub par bya ba nges pa yin no //
translated: In this way, if one is certain that the reason is incompatible with the opposite of the probandum, then one is certain that the reason proves the probandum.

original: bdag nyid kyi nang gi chos zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag dang bdag nyid ldan par rang gis rtogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi nang gi chos zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag dang bdag nyid ldan par rang gis rtogs pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúOne‚Äôs own inner phenomena‚Äù are attachment and so on that one realizes one has oneself.

original: gzhan gyis shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i chos de dag rang la ji lta bar gzhan thams cad la yang nye bar sbyor ba'i bdag nyid gcig par tha snyad du byed pa'i skyes bus 'dis rigs pa'i dal ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis shes pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa'i chos de dag rang la ji lta bar gzhan thams cad la yang nye bar sbyor ba'i bdag nyid gcig par tha snyad du byed pa'i skyes bus 'dis rigs pa'i dal ba ste /
translated: Those phenomena that are not objects of knowledge for others are applied to all others just as they are to oneself. The person who conventionally makes the application of the same nature to all is the one who is certain about the reason.

original: rig pa bslab pa'i dka' ba byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: rig pa bslab pa'i dka' ba byas pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the difficulty of learning is the knowledge of the self.

original: rab tu 'dod pa ni bsting ba ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'dod pa ni bsting ba ste /
translated: The desire is the ridicule.

original: rmongs pa nyid thob ba'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa nyid thob ba'o //
translated: The attainment is the delusion itself.

original: ci rmongs pa yin zhe na /üîΩbud med dang dmangs rigs dag gis kyang bdag dang gzhan @279a * //
analyzed: ci rmongs pa yin zhe na / bud med dang dmangs rigs dag gis kyang bdag dang gzhan @279a * //
translated: What is the delusion?üîΩEven women and ≈õ≈´dras, who are not of the nature of the self and others, clearly understand that the self is not perceived by itself, but is perceived by another.

original: gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin par gsal bar shes te bdag nyid kyi bsam pa ni rang gis rtogs la gzhan gyis ni ma rtogs pas so zhes gsal bar rtogs pa de rang la mthong ba'i chos gtan tshigs su byed pa'i skyes bu 'dis mi rtogs pa'i phyir
analyzed: gcig gi rang bzhin ma yin par gsal bar shes te bdag nyid kyi bsam pa ni rang gis rtogs la gzhan gyis ni ma rtogs pas so zhes gsal bar rtogs pa de rang la mthong ba'i chos gtan tshigs su byed pa'i skyes bu 'dis mi rtogs pa'i phyir
translated: This person, who makes what is seen by himself the reason, does not understand that the self is not perceived by itself, but is perceived by another.

original: ro // sngar smos pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: ro // sngar smos pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pa'o //
translated: The non-perception of appearance mentioned earlier.

original: 'di 'dra ba'i sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar mi dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di 'dra ba'i sbyor ba ni zhes bya ba ni mi snang bar mi dmigs pa ste /
translated: The application like this is the non-perception of non-appearance.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu'i sems kyi chos dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba dag la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu'i sems kyi chos dmigs pa'i rig byar ma gyur ba dag la 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gog par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, one who is free from attachment to the phenomena of the mind of a person who is not an object of perception, stops the attachment.

original: gal te smra ba'i rtags 'dod chags dpog par byed pa de lta na de dang 'gal ba 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te smra ba'i rtags 'dod chags dpog par byed pa de lta na de dang 'gal ba 'dod chags dang bral ba 'gog pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you assert that speech is a reason for inferring attachment, then since it is incompatible with freedom from attachment, it is the observation of a contradictory object.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa yang don gzhan yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel ba med pa'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are also not different objects, because there is no relation of identity.

original: gal te smra bas 'dod chags dpag pa ni 'bras bu yin pas 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te smra bas 'dod chags dpag pa ni 'bras bu yin pas 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that speech is the effect of attachment and so on, then it is the observation of a contradictory effect.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'bras bu yang ma yin zhes bya ba smos te ;üîΩ'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang brjod par 'dod pa 'dod chags yin no 'dogs na'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa 'bras bu yang ma yin zhes bya ba smos te ; 'dod pa'i phyir skyon med do zhes bya ba ni g-yo ba dang brjod par 'dod pa 'dod chags yin no 'dogs na'o //
translated: Attachment and so on are also not effects.

original: gal te des na 'dod chags grub pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te des na 'dod chags grub pa nyid ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say there is no error because you assert that attachment is the desire to move and speak, then attachment is not established.

original: ma yin te 'dod chags dang rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin te 'dod chags dang rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
translated: If you say it is not so, then attachment and desire are not similar in nature.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa kho na'i yul can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i rnam pa can de 'di ltar 'di'i dmigs ni autpala sngon po'i
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags la sogs pa ni rtag pa la sogs pa phyin ci log las byung ba zag pa dang bcas pa kho na'i yul can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i yon tan la dga' ba'i rnam pa can de 'di ltar 'di'i dmigs ni autpala sngon po'i
translated: Thus attachment and so on arise from the error of permanence and so on. They are the focal object of those who possess defilements and they possess the aspect of delighting in unreal qualities.üîΩ

original: 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas dga' ba'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: 'dab ma lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pas dga' ba'i rnam pa can no //
translated: Thus, attachment and so on arise from error, such as the belief in permanence, and they are the objects of only those with outflows. They are the form of delight in false qualities. Thus, the object of this is like the petal of a blue lotus, and so on. Thus, they have the form of delight.

original: rnam 'brel du bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: rnam 'brel du bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is that they are related, as has been explained.

original: 'di dag gi rgyu dmigs pa mdo tsam du de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rgyu dmigs pa mdo tsam du de ma thag tu ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The cause and object of these will be taught immediately after, in brief.

original: 'di dag gi rnam pa ni brjod pa mang du dogs pas ma bstan par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rnam pa ni brjod pa mang du dogs pas ma bstan par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The form of these is not taught, because it is feared that there would be too many words. It should be understood.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not reasonable because of being free from attachment.

original: gzhan gyi don la yang 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don la yang 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not reasonable because of being free from desire even for the benefit of others.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad de zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang snying rje la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad de zhes bya ba 'dod chags dang snying rje la sogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristics are different. Attachment and compassion and so on.

original: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: phyin ci log med na med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / bdag dang bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
translated: because they do not exist when there is no error.

original: bdag yin na ni gzhan du shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yin na ni gzhan du shes la zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'dod chags la sogs pa 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The error of self and other is the cause of attachment and so on, because attachment and so on arise in sequence from the grasping of permanence, pleasure, self, and purity, and from the grasping of self and other.

original: 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi don cung zad kyang me pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rtsom pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi don cung zad kyang me pa'i phyir snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the statement, ‚Äúbecause there is no beginning of the effect,‚Äù is that the self has no purpose of its own.

original: gal te gzhan gyi don @279b 'dod pa nyid kyang 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi don @279b 'dod pa nyid kyang 'dod chags yin no zhe na /
translated: If you think that the desire for the benefit of others is attachment,

original: 'di ni snying rjes so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'di ni snying rjes so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: we have already explained that this is compassion.

original: 'khrul pa'i phyir mi dpog na zhes bya ba ni dkar sha ma dang mang du za ba la sogs pa bdag la mthong ba yang gzhan la de las bzlog par mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pas so //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i phyir mi dpog na zhes bya ba ni dkar sha ma dang mang du za ba la sogs pa bdag la mthong ba yang gzhan la de las bzlog par mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pas so //
translated: If you say that it is not measured because of error, it is seen that one who is white, fat, and so on, is oneself, and that one who is the opposite is another.

original: 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba gang la des zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o ;
analyzed: 'di la mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba gang la des zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa la'o ;
translated: There is no error here.

original: / gal te 'di la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: / gal te 'di la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba'i phyir 'khrul pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you think that there is no error here because the absence of the opposite is not seen,üîΩwe have already said that mere non-seeing is not a means of knowing.

original: ma mthong ba tsam la yang brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid 'gal bar so sor sbyor bar yang mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam la yang brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni sngar mi mthong ba'i bdag nyid 'gal bar so sor sbyor bar yang mi nus so zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: We have already said that the nature of non-seeing cannot be applied individually to the contradictory, etc.

original: lhan cig 'byung ba dang cig shos dag ni 'gal ba med pa dang 'gal bdag go //
analyzed: lhan cig 'byung ba dang cig shos dag ni 'gal ba med pa dang 'gal bdag go //
translated: The simultaneous and the other are not contradictory and are contradictory.

original: bsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i bdag nyid dag la ni gcig nye na cig shos med par gtan la dbab par mi nus te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal ba'i don zhes bya ba ni mi snang ba'i bdag nyid dag la ni gcig nye na cig shos med par gtan la dbab par mi nus te the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning of exclusion is that in the case of things that are not manifest, one cannot determine that the other is absent when one is near, because there is doubt.

original: byed pa'i yon tan ni ngang grims pa'i nus pa rkan bya ba'o //
analyzed: byed pa'i yon tan ni ngang grims pa'i nus pa rkan bya ba'o //
translated: The function of a quality is the capacity of a thing to perform an action.
