original: gal te 'di la yang bdag nyid la mthong ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i yon tan dang brjod par 'dod par smra bas dpog pa 'di yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'di la yang bdag nyid la mthong ba zhes bya ba ni byed pa'i yon tan dang brjod par 'dod par smra bas dpog pa 'di yang ngo //
translated: If you say that the word ‚Äúseeing‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúseeing itself‚Äù is a quality of the agent, and that the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is a restatement, then this argument is pointless.

original: bdag nyid la gzhan du yang mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med bar smra ba dmigs pas so //
analyzed: bdag nyid la gzhan du yang mthong ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags med bar smra ba dmigs pas so //
translated: Because it is seen elsewhere, that is, in the absence of desire, the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is a restatement.

original: gal te sems med pa'i ldog pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni rdo ba'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams la smra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa'i yul yin pa ste ldog ba rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gal te sems med pa'i ldog pa'i yul yin no zhes bya ba ni rdo ba'i dum bu la sogs pa rnams la smra ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ldog pa'i yul yin pa ste ldog ba rtogs pa'o //
translated: If you say that the object of negation is the absence of mind, then the object of negation is not seen in such things as a piece of stone, because they are not seen to have a mind.

original: ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis so //üîΩ'o na bum pa yod pa dang med pa nyid snying rjer rtogs she na /
analyzed: ldog pa'i rnam pa de lta bu zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis so // 'o na bum pa yod pa dang med pa nyid snying rjer rtogs she na /
translated: Such a negation is a mere absence of seeing.

original: de'i rgyu zhes smos te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu zhes smos te /
translated: If you say that the existence and nonexistence of a pot are objects of negation, then you must say what their cause is.

original: 'dod chags de'i rgyu'i nus pa zhes bya ba tshogs pa gzhan de rdo'i dum bu las gzhan pa dbang po dang sems la yod pa la sogs pa rdo la yod kyang 'bras bu 'dod chags mi bskyed na dbang po la sogs pa las rgyu gzhan nus pa rjesüîΩsu dpog par byed do //
analyzed: 'dod chags de'i rgyu'i nus pa zhes bya ba tshogs pa gzhan de rdo'i dum bu las gzhan pa dbang po dang sems la yod pa la sogs pa rdo la yod kyang 'bras bu 'dod chags mi bskyed na dbang po la sogs pa las rgyu gzhan nus pa rjes su dpog par byed do //
translated: If attachment, the result, is not produced even though it exists in the stone, then a cause other than the sense faculty and so on is inferred to be the potential.

original: sa dang drod dang chu dag yod kyang myu gu mi skye na /
analyzed: sa dang drod dang chu dag yod kyang myu gu mi skye na /
translated: Even though earth, heat and water exist, if a sprout is not produced,

original: de las rgyu gzhan ba sa bon dpog par byed pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de las rgyu gzhan ba sa bon dpog par byed pa bzhin no //
translated: then a cause other than that, the seed, is inferred.

original: sems med pa las mi srid de zhes bya ba ni rdo ba'i dum bu la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: sems med pa las mi srid de zhes bya ba ni rdo ba'i dum bu la sogs pa'o ;
translated: It is impossible from a nonmental state means from a stone fragment and so on.

original: / sems pa yod pa dang byed pa'i yon tan de goms pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / sems pa yod pa dang byed pa'i yon tan de goms pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Mental states and the qualities of action such as habituation and so on are the cause of the potential of the sense faculties and so forth.

original: dbang po la sogs pa nus pa'i rgyu snang ba zhes bltar rung ba yin te rdo'i dum bu de la mi srid pa'i phyir nus pa med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs te /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa nus pa'i rgyu snang ba zhes bltar rung ba yin te rdo'i dum bu de la mi srid pa'i phyir nus pa med do zhes bya bar mi rtogs te /
translated: The cause of the potential is called appearance and is visible, but it is impossible that the stone fragment is without potential.

original: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dag tshang bar yod kyang 'bras bu 'dod @280a * //
analyzed: nus pa'i rgyu gzhan dag tshang bar yod kyang 'bras bu 'dod @280a * //
translated: Even though other causes of the potential are complete, if the result, desire, is not generated, then it is inferred that the piece of stone lacks the potential.

original: chags mi skyed na gdod rdo'i dum bu nus pa med ces bya bar rjes su dpog pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyis nye bar phan mi 'dogs na zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dum bu las 'dod chags nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags mi skyed na gdod rdo'i dum bu nus pa med ces bya bar rjes su dpog pa'i phyir 'dod chags kyis nye bar phan mi 'dogs na zhes bya ba ni rdo'i dum bu las 'dod chags nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If desire does not benefit, then desire itself does not exist in the piece of stone.

original: bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yon tan de chos de lta bu la nus pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bdag nyid du gyur pa'i yon tan de chos de lta bu la nus pa nye bar btags pa'i phyir te /
translated: The quality that is the nature of the self is imputed to have the potential in that phenomenon,

original: 'dod chags kyi tshig smra ba bskyed bas 'bras bu 'dod nus pa ni 'dod chags nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi tshig smra ba bskyed bas 'bras bu 'dod nus pa ni 'dod chags nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result, the ability to desire, is desire itself, since it generates speech that expresses desire.üîΩIf you say that the potential that is the nature of the cause of desire generates speech, then that potential also is not able to generate it.

original: gal te 'dod chags kyi rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi nus pas smra ba skyed bar byed do zhe na de'i nus pas kyang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu la 'dod chags kyis phan par mi nus na 'dod chags kyis bar du chod basüîΩkyang mi nus so //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags kyi rgyu'i rang bzhin gyi nus pas smra ba skyed bar byed do zhe na de'i nus pas kyang mi nus so zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi 'bras bu la 'dod chags kyis phan par mi nus na 'dod chags kyis bar du chod basüîΩkyang mi nus so //
translated: If desire is not able to benefit the result of desire, then desire is not able to interrupt the potential of the result of desire.

original: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med ba dag la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel ba med ba dag la'o //
translated: The phrase in other cases refers to those that are unrelated.

original: cis na 'di ma smos zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i dper brjod pa dbye ba gnyis bstan pa'o //
analyzed: cis na 'di ma smos zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa'i dper brjod pa dbye ba gnyis bstan pa'o //
translated: The phrase Why is this not mentioned? refers to the two types of example that have been presented: the contradictory and the nonerroneous.

original: gal te smras pa la sogs par bsgrub pa dang / ma smras pa la sogs par sgrub pa zhes bya bar dbye bar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te smras pa la sogs par bsgrub pa dang / ma smras pa la sogs par sgrub pa zhes bya bar dbye bar rigs pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: One might ask, Why is it not correct to divide the thesis into two types: the thesis that is established by a statement and the thesis that is established by something other than a statement?

original: gcig pa brjod par bsgrub bar bya ba bye brag med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa brjod par bsgrub bar bya ba bye brag med par rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The answer is that the thesis is stated in a single form in order to make it understood without distinction.

original: 'ga' zhig tu brjod pa dang zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang rtsol ba las byung ba dag go //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu brjod pa dang zhes bya ba ni byas pa dang rtsol ba las byung ba dag go //
translated: The phrase in some cases refers to the two types of thesis that are stated in a single form: the thesis that is stated in the form of a reason and the thesis that is stated in the form of an example.

original: shugs kyis 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase because it is included by implication means that the thesis is included by implication.

original: shugs kyis 'dod pa phyin ci log de la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis 'ga' zhig tu chos su brjod par 'dod pas de 'dus pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'dod pa phyin ci log de la yang sbyor ba'i bye brag gis 'ga' zhig tu chos su brjod par 'dod pas de 'dus pa ni gzhan gyi don nyid do zhes so //
translated: The phrase in some cases, the property to be proven is stated in the form of a property means that the property to be proven is stated in the form of a property in order to avoid a misunderstanding of the thesis that is stated in the form of a reason.

original: 'ga' zhig tu chos can du brjod pas te gzhan gyi don mig la sogs pa zhes bya bas chos dang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa bsgrub pa dag gis so //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu chos can du brjod pas te gzhan gyi don mig la sogs pa zhes bya bas chos dang chos can gyi bye brag las bzlog pa bsgrub pa dag gis so //
translated: In some cases, the subject is stated, as in the case of the proof that the eye and so on are for the sake of others.

original: de dag kyang sbyor bar brjod par 'dod pas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa bsgrub par byar phyin ci log tu sgrub par ni bye brag ci yang med do //
analyzed: de dag kyang sbyor bar brjod par 'dod pas rnam par gzhag pa yin pa bsgrub par byar phyin ci log tu sgrub par ni bye brag ci yang med do //
translated: And in those cases, there is no difference in the proof that is the opposite of the distinction between subject and predicate, since the proponent wishes to state the syllogism.

original: gal te 'gal ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ci'i phyir tha dad du ma byas she na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang 'dod pa brjod pa bsgrub pa dang / shugs kyis 'dod pa bsgrub pa zhes so //
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba bzhin du gtan tshigs kyang ci'i phyir tha dad du ma byas she na zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i gtan tshigs dag kyang 'dod pa brjod pa bsgrub pa dang / shugs kyis 'dod pa bsgrub pa zhes so //
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is a correct reason not treated separately, as is the case with a contradictory reason?‚Äù‚Äîcorrect reasons are also stated in the form of a thesis and a proof, and they are also stated by implication.

original: shugs kyis 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs kyang tha dad du byas pa nyid de ma smras kyang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin par bstan pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: shugs kyis 'dod pa'i gtan tshigs kyang tha dad du byas pa nyid de ma smras kyang 'dod pa bsgrub par bya ba yin par bstan pa nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: A reason stated by implication is also treated separately, because it is stated by the mere indication of the thesis to be proven, even though it is not stated.

original: yang na @280b 'dus pa nyid kyis 'dus pa'i don nyid sgrub par 'dod na ma brjod par yang bsgrub pa nges par bstan pa nyid kyis shugs kyi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na @280b 'dus pa nyid kyis 'dus pa'i don nyid sgrub par 'dod na ma brjod par yang bsgrub pa nges par bstan pa nyid kyis shugs kyi 'dod pa bsgrub pa'i gtan tshigs bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, if you maintain that the meaning of ‚Äúcollection‚Äù is established by the collection itself, then you have definitely taught that the probandum is established without being stated, and so you have explained a reason that establishes your thesis by implication.

original: ci'i phyir 'gegs par byed ces bya ba ni ma bstan to zhes bya bar rgol ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'gegs par byed ces bya ba ni ma bstan to zhes bya bar rgol ba mi rigs so zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Why do you object that ‚Äúit is not taught‚Äù?

original: gal te 'dus pa rnam gzhan 'dus pa ma yin pa la phan par zhes bya ba ni 'dus pas 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed ba'o //
analyzed: gal te 'dus pa rnam gzhan 'dus pa ma yin pa la phan par zhes bya ba ni 'dus pas 'dus pa ma yin pa'i don byed ba'o //
translated: If you say that the collection helps the non-collection, which is different from the collection,

original: kha cig 'dus pa gzhan rnams gzhan 'dus pa la phan pa zhes 'don to //
analyzed: kha cig 'dus pa gzhan rnams gzhan 'dus pa la phan pa zhes 'don to //
translated: then some read this as ‚Äúthe other collections help the other non-collection.‚Äù

original: de ltar na bdag med par smra ba la klan kar sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag med par smra ba la klan kar sbyar ba'o //
translated: Thus, you are applying an objection to the doctrine of no-self.

original: 'gal ba ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba ma yin pa nyid du bsgrub pa ni 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: Similarity establishes that there is no contradiction.

original: snga ma ltar na ni 'gal ba yin par bsgrub par bya ba tsam du bya'o //
analyzed: snga ma ltar na ni 'gal ba yin par bsgrub par bya ba tsam du bya'o //
translated: If it is as you say, then you are proving that there is a contradiction.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tu 'bras bu bskyed pa'i don rnams mthar thug par tshogs pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni nges par 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa byed pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu 'bras bu bskyed pa'i don rnams mthar thug par tshogs pa yang yin zhes bya ba ni nges par 'bras bu 'byin pa'i phyir gzhan la phan pa byed pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: If it is said that the collection of things that produce an effect is also final, then the benefit of others is not established because of the certainty of the production of the effect.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúEven though that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: so sor phan pa byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dus pa kho na la phan par byed par bsgrub pas 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
analyzed: so sor phan pa byed pa dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'dus pa kho na la phan par byed par bsgrub pas 'gal ba nyid du ston te /
translated: By ‚Äúfrom those that individually produce a benefit,‚Äù and so on, he shows the contradiction by establishing that the benefit is only in the collection.

original: so sor phan pa byed pa ni 'dus pa rnams so sor phan pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor phan pa byed pa ni 'dus pa rnams so sor phan pa byed pa'o //
translated: The individual benefit is the benefit of the individual members of the collection.

original: phan par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: phan par bya ba'i rang bzhin gzhan skye ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni snga ma las khyad par du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause another nature that is benefited arises‚Äù means that it is different from the previous.

original: de ltar na phan par byed pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid rdo //
analyzed: de ltar na phan par byed pa de ni mi rtag pa nyid rdo //
translated: Thus, that benefit is impermanent.

original: rang bzhin gzhan mi skye ba ni phan par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan mi skye ba ni phan par bya ba nyid ma yin no //
translated: The non-arising of another nature is not the benefit.

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis phan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las gzhan du gyur pa ni phan pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyis phan pa zhes bya ba ni snga ma las gzhan du gyur pa ni phan pa ste /
translated: The so-called benefit of a different nature is a transformation from the previous state.

original: skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa yin gyi phan par bya ba gcig la dus gcig tu phan pa du ma byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: skad cig ma gzhan skyed pa yin gyi phan par bya ba gcig la dus gcig tu phan pa du ma byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is the production of another moment, not the performance of many benefits at one time for one who is benefited.

original: phan par bya ba du mar gyur na 'dus pa phan par bya ba ma yin gyi re re la phan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan par bya ba du mar gyur na 'dus pa phan par bya ba ma yin gyi re re la phan par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were many who were benefited, the assembly would not benefit them, because it would follow that each one would benefit them.

original: de lta bas na phan par bya ba'i skabs gzhan dang gzhan dag skye ba'i phyir mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na phan par bya ba'i skabs gzhan dang gzhan dag skye ba'i phyir mi rtag pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, because there are other and other occasions of being benefited, it is only impermanent that is benefited.

original: de'i phyir phan par bya ba'i skad cig ma 'dus pa kho na la don byed par grub pa'o //üîΩgal te phan pa bdag la don gzhan yin na phan pa las gzhan pa'i bdag de las phan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir phan par bya ba'i skad cig ma 'dus pa kho na la don byed par grub pa'o // gal te phan pa bdag la don gzhan yin na phan pa las gzhan pa'i bdag de las phan pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, it is established that the assembly of moments of being benefited alone performs a function.üîΩIf the benefit is a different object from the self, then that self which is different from the benefit is not benefited.

original: phan pa rnams phan pa skye na yang bdag de las tha @281a * //
analyzed: phan pa rnams phan pa skye na yang bdag de las tha @281a * //
translated: If the benefits arise from the benefit, then the self would be different from the benefit.

original: dad pa zhig ma yin zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba la sogs ba'i rig byed brtag ba la sogs pa smras zin to //
analyzed: dad pa zhig ma yin zhes bya ba thug pa med par 'gyur ba la sogs ba'i rig byed brtag ba la sogs pa smras zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is endless to say, ‚ÄúIt is not faith,‚Äù and so on, in the analysis of the Vedas and so on.

original: gal te bdag la mi phan pa nyid yin na bdag de la phan pa'i don du sgrub pa bkod pa don med pa nyid yin pas bdag la phan par byed pa de'i don du sgrub pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te bdag la mi phan pa nyid yin na bdag de la phan pa'i don du sgrub pa bkod pa don med pa nyid yin pas bdag la phan par byed pa de'i don du sgrub pa ni rang gi tshig dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If it is not beneficial to the self, then it is pointless to establish the self for the purpose of benefiting it. Therefore it is contradictory to your own words to establish it for the purpose of benefiting that which does not benefit itself.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phan ba'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dag tu skyed pa de'i phyir phan bar bya ba de rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i kho na'i don byed par grub pas 'dus
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni phan ba'i khyad par phyi ma phyi ma dag tu skyed pa de'i phyir phan bar bya ba de rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i kho na'i don byed par grub pas 'dus
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it does not become a single nature.‚Äù Because it generates a later and later benefit, that which is benefited does not become a single nature. Therefore it is established that it performs a function in dependence.

original: pa ma yin pa'i don byed par 'dod pa las phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: pa ma yin pa'i don byed par 'dod pa las phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa'i phyir 'gal ba'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is established that it performs a function in dependence, it is a fallacious reason that is contradictory because it proves the opposite of the thesis that it performs a function independently.

original: gnyis ka la ma grub pa yang 'gal ba yin te zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni'o //
analyzed: gnyis ka la ma grub pa yang 'gal ba yin te zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgras ni'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù in the phrase ‚Äúit is contradictory for something to be established neither in both nor in neither‚Äù indicates that it is also contradictory for something to be established neither in both nor in neither.

original: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa las gzhan pa'i phung po gang la zhes bya ba ni de gnyis pas phyi rol tu gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig la'o //
analyzed: bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa las gzhan pa'i phung po gang la zhes bya ba ni de gnyis pas phyi rol tu gyur pa'i chos 'ga' zhig la'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin any other aggregates, whether they are associated with a self or not associated with a self‚Äù means in any phenomenon that is external to those two.

original: gal te de la yod par gyur na ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir de dag la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur te gnyi ga las ldog bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te de la yod par gyur na ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa'i phyir de dag la the tshom za bar mi 'gyur te gnyi ga las ldog bar grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it existed in those two, then, because life and so on would be external to both that which is associated with a self and that which is not associated with a self, it would not be doubted that they are external to both, because they would be established as being external to both.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis grags par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bdag dang bdag med pa'i bdag nyid kyis chos su tshad mas ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis grags par ma grub pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don bdag dang bdag med pa'i bdag nyid kyis chos su tshad mas ma grags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are not established as being of the nature of either that which is associated with a self or that which is not associated with a self‚Äù means that they are not established as phenomena by a valid cognition.

original: de dag las ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag bcas dang bdag med gnyi ga las ldog pa ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de dag las ldog pa med do zhes bya ba ni bdag bcas dang bdag med gnyi ga las ldog pa ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthey are not external to those two‚Äù means that they are not established as being external to both that which is associated with a self and that which is not associated with a self.

original: gal te bdag dang bdag med pa gang la yang yod par ma grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gal te bdag dang bdag med pa gang la yang yod par ma grub pa'i phyir //
translated: If you say that because neither a self nor selflessness is established as existent,

original: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pas na rtogs bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang ba yin pas na rtogs bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ma nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: the reason is a nonestablished seeming reason, and therefore it is not indefinite because it does not prove anything,

original: go bar mi byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: go bar mi byed pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: we say that it is not that it does not prove anything.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?üîΩBecause it is related to something.

original: gang zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa 'di chos can gson po'i lus la 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa 'di chos can gson po'i lus la 'ga' zhig dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: The reason is related to the subject, the living body.

original: rtags de las chos can de las rtogs ba 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rtags de las chos can de las rtogs ba 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: From that reason, the understanding of the subject is engaged because

original: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa 'di ci bdag dang bcas pa zhig gam bdag med pa zhig gi chos can yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'di ltar srog la sogs pa 'di ci bdag dang bcas pa zhig gam bdag med pa zhig gi chos can yin no zhes so //
translated: it is like this: Is the subject, which has life and so on, one that has a self or one that is selfless?

original: ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang @281b ngo ;
analyzed: ma 'brel pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang @281b ngo ;
translated: It is not unrelated to the predicate.

original: / gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga dag las phyi rol du gyur pa yin na ni /
analyzed: / gnyi ga las phyi rol du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga dag las phyi rol du gyur pa yin na ni /
translated: The phrase that which is external to both means that if life-force, etc. were external to both the self and non-self, then it would be external to all things.

original: de bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga las log ba'i phyir srog la sogs pa de las gson po'i lus de la go ba dang the tshom za bar mi byed pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bdag dang bdag med pa gnyi ga las log ba'i phyir srog la sogs pa de las gson po'i lus de la go ba dang the tshom za bar mi byed pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase that which is external to both means that if life-force, etc. were external to both self and non-self, then because it would be removed from both self and non-self, it would not be understood or doubted as the living body.

original: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gang la yang yod par ma grub kyang de las ston pa 'jug pa de lta na'o //
analyzed: gal te de lta na zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang bdag med pa gang la yang yod par ma grub kyang de las ston pa 'jug pa de lta na'o //
translated: If that were so, means that if life-force, etc. were not established as existing in either self or non-self, then the teacher would not engage in that.

original: ma 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba de chos can dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba de chos can dang ma 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not related, means that the object apprehended by the eye is not related to the subject.

original: srog la sogs pa'i bye brag la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag med pa'i chos yin pa'i bye brag la'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa'i bye brag la zhes bya ba ni bdag dang bdag med pa'i chos yin pa'i bye brag la'o //
translated: In the case of the distinction of life-force, etc., means in the case of the distinction of being a phenomenon of self or non-self.

original: bskal pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag tshad mas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskal pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag tshad mas ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the eon‚Äù means because the self is not seen by a valid cognition.

original: 'jug ba dang ldog pa ni bum pa la sogs pa chos can khyad bar gyi khyad bar gang la yang bdag yod ba dang med ba nges par ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'jug ba dang ldog pa ni bum pa la sogs pa chos can khyad bar gyi khyad bar gang la yang bdag yod ba dang med ba nges par ma grub pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: ‚ÄúEngagement and disengagement‚Äù means that the engagement and disengagement of the self in the specific and general characteristics of the subject, such as a pot, is not established.

original: / de la srog la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag de la srog la sogs pa 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang tshad mas ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: / de la srog la sogs pa yang ngo zhes bya ba ni bdag de la srog la sogs pa 'jug pa dang / ldog pa yang tshad mas ma mthong ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLife and so on‚Äù means that the engagement and disengagement of life and so on in the self is not seen by a valid cognition.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa ma grub pa de'i phyir don gzhan srog la sogs ba bdag gi 'bras bur ma gyur pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa ma grub pa de'i phyir don gzhan srog la sogs ba bdag gi 'bras bur ma gyur pa'i phyir bdag la sogs pas rjes su 'gro ba ma grub pa yin no //
translated: Because the engagement and disengagement of the self is not established, the life and so on that are other objects are not the effects of the self, and therefore the self is not established as the substratum of life and so on.

original: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang bdag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa dang bdag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach that point extensively, he says, ‚ÄúThe self and life and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can no //
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni rigs pa can no //
translated: ‚ÄúOthers‚Äù refers to the NaiyƒÅyikas.

original: go bar byed pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pas bdag go bar byed pa kho na ste /
analyzed: go bar byed pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pas bdag go bar byed pa kho na ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúonly by the means of being understood‚Äù means that life force, etc. are only the means of understanding the self.üîΩThat life force, etc. are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩIt is asserted that they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.

original: srog la sogs pa de ni 'di'i rigs can de dag bdag sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te /üîΩgcig tu ldog pa can zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa de ni 'di'i rigs can de dag bdag sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs yin te / gcig tu ldog pa can zhes bya bar 'dod pa'o //
translated: Because they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.

original: de gcig tu ldog pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na las ldog pa zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gcig tu ldog pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na las ldog pa zhes 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.

original: de nyid kyi phyir srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ldog pa med de mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de gson po'i lus thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir la gson po'i lus las gzhan
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la mi 'jug pa'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs las ni ldog pa med de mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de gson po'i lus thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir la gson po'i lus las gzhan
translated: Because they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.üîΩBecause they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.

original: pa thams cad ni mi mthun ba'i phyogs yin par 'dod pa las mthun @282a * //
analyzed: pa thams cad ni mi mthun ba'i phyogs yin par 'dod pa las mthun @282a * //
translated: Because they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type.

original: pa'i phyogs med pa la /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs med pa la /
translated: Because they are the reason for establishing that the self is of their type, they are the reason for establishing that the self is

original: med pas ldog pa ni yul du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pas ldog pa ni yul du mi rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is impossible for a non-existent to be a counter-correlate.

original: gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba can ni 'og nas ston to //
analyzed: gcig tu rjes su 'gro ba can ni 'og nas ston to //
translated: That it is a universal is taught below.

original: mnyan bar bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa ngang mi rtag pa gang la yang yod bar ma grub ba'i phyir phyogs kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ma yin pas ldog pa can gyi rtags nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na bye brag ba na re ma nyan par
analyzed: mnyan bar bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa ngang mi rtag pa gang la yang yod bar ma grub ba'i phyir phyogs kyi thun mong ma yin pa'i chos ma yin pas ldog pa can gyi rtags nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na bye brag ba na re ma nyan par
translated: Since audibility is not established as existing in either permanent or impermanent things, it is not a property unique to the subject. Therefore, it is a reason that is a counter-correlate.

original: bya ba nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bya ba nyid ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika says: Audibility is not like that.üîΩBecause it is a counter-correlate of both.

original: gnyi ga las ldog ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyi ga las ldog ba'i phyir ro zhes bya bas mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang ldog pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is a counter-correlate of the similar class,

original: log pa ni 'dir ma mthong pa yin bas so //
analyzed: log pa ni 'dir ma mthong pa yin bas so //
translated: since in this context, non-observation is the opposite.

original: srog la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin zhe'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ni de lta ma yin zhe'o //
translated: Life force and so on are not like that.

original: de lta bu'i ldog pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gcig tu ldog pa smras pa des so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ldog pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gcig tu ldog pa smras pa des so //
translated: That kind of counter-correlate is said to be a counter-correlate that is a universal.

original: bdag med pa nyid la med pa nyid do zhes nges pa smra na don gyis gzhan ma yin pa bdag dang 'dre bas bdag la srog la sogs pa 'jug par brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag med pa nyid la med pa nyid do zhes nges pa smra na don gyis gzhan ma yin pa bdag dang 'dre bas bdag la srog la sogs pa 'jug par brjod pa yin la /
translated: If you say that the self is nonexistent in the sense of nonexistence of selflessness, then you are saying that the self is not different in meaning from the aggregates, and that life force, etc. are ascribed to the self.

original: de lta na bdag kho na la 'jug pa de nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta na bdag kho na la 'jug pa de nyid med na mi 'byung ba yin no //
translated: In that case, the self alone is what is ascribed, and that is not nonexistent.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba grub pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa nyi tshe can ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba grub pas srog la sogs pa ldog pa nyi tshe can ma yin no //
translated: Since the existence of the self is established, life force, etc. are not merely negated.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bas ldog ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs ba bdag gam bdag med pa'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba med pa la ldog pa yang med do //üîΩgal te ma mthong bas ldog ba mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ma mthong bas ldog ba mi 'grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs ba bdag gam bdag med pa'i bye brag gi rjes su 'gro ba med pa la ldog pa yang med do // gal te ma mthong bas ldog ba mi 'grub ste /
translated: Therefore, because negation is not established by nonapprehension, life force, etc. do not follow the distinction of the self or nonself, and therefore they are not negated.

original: de lta na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar ldog pa can zhes gsungs she na /
analyzed: de lta na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos mnyan par bya ba nyid ji ltar ldog pa can zhes gsungs she na /
translated: If negation is not established by nonapprehension, then how could the Acarya Dignaga say, ‚ÄúWhat is to be heard is what has a negation‚Äù?

original: slob dpon gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs ba smos so //
translated: The Acarya says, etc.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that alone‚Äù means by the mere non-seeing.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa des na mnyan par bya ba nyid the tshom za ba'i rgyur nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa des na mnyan par bya ba nyid the tshom za ba'i rgyur nges pa'i gtan tshigs ltar snang bar slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that the mere non-seeing is the cause of doubt, and the master has said that it is a fallacious reason.

original: 'di ltar rtags mnyan par bya ba gang rtag ba gang la mi srid pa de sgra la dmigs pa las sgra rtag pa de la the tshom za bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtags mnyan par bya ba gang rtag ba gang la mi srid pa de sgra la dmigs pa las sgra rtag pa de la the tshom za bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not right to doubt that sound is permanent on the ground that the reason, which is to be heard, is not possible in a permanent thing.

original: 'di ltar me med pa la mi srid pa'i du ba phyogs la dmigs pa las me med ba la the tshom bya bar mi rigs pa bzhin no /
analyzed: 'di ltar me med pa la mi srid pa'i du ba phyogs la dmigs pa las me med ba la the tshom bya bar mi rigs pa bzhin no /
translated: Just as it is not right to doubt that there is no fire on the ground that smoke, which is not possible where there is no fire, is perceived in a place.

original: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa ni shi ba'i lus dang bum ba la sogs pa la khyab pa'i phyir du ba med pas me med pa la khyab pa @282b ltar ro ;
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med pas bdag med pa ni shi ba'i lus dang bum ba la sogs pa la khyab pa'i phyir du ba med pas me med pa la khyab pa @282b ltar ro ;
translated: The non-existence of the self is pervaded by the non-existence of life, etc., just as the non-existence of fire is pervaded by the non-existence of smoke.

original: / de'i phyir nye ba'i lus dang bum ba la sogs pa rgyu bdag log ba'i phyir /
analyzed: / de'i phyir nye ba'i lus dang bum ba la sogs pa rgyu bdag log ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because of the cessation of the body and the pot, etc.,

original: srog la sogs pa log ba'i phyir te me log pas du ba log pa bzhin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa log ba'i phyir te me log pas du ba log pa bzhin no //
translated: because of the cessation of life, etc., just as smoke ceases when fire ceases.

original: de ltar na 'bras bu srog la sogs pa ldog pa'i khyab par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras bu srog la sogs pa ldog pa'i khyab par byed pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the cessation of the effect, life, etc., is the pervader.

original: de gson po'i lus la log ste srog la sogs pa yod par gyur na khyab par bya ba dag med pa yang ldog pa'i phyir gson bo'i lus la bdag grub po snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de gson po'i lus la log ste srog la sogs pa yod par gyur na khyab par bya ba dag med pa yang ldog pa'i phyir gson bo'i lus la bdag grub po snyam pa'o //
translated: And when that ceases in the living body, the pervaded, life, etc., also cease. Therefore, the self is established in the living body.

original: lan sbyin ba ni ma 'brel pa srog la sogs pa med pa ste ldog pas nye bar mi sbyor ba bdag med pa ste log pa la khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: lan sbyin ba ni ma 'brel pa srog la sogs pa med pa ste ldog pas nye bar mi sbyor ba bdag med pa ste log pa la khyab pa mi 'grub ste /
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúThere is no connection. ‚Äù The cessation of life, etc., is not connected with the absence of the self, because the cessation of the one does not imply the cessation of the other.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no connection between them.

original: de log pas mi 'jug ces bya ba ni bdag log pas srog mi 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de log pas mi 'jug ces bya ba ni bdag log pas srog mi 'jug pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWhen that ceases, this does not cease‚Äù means that when the self ceases, life does not cease.

original: bzlog pa'i 'brel pa ni nye bar sbyor ba log pa de dang 'brel pa log pas khyab pa'o //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i 'brel pa ni nye bar sbyor ba log pa de dang 'brel pa log pas khyab pa'o //
translated: The connection of the opposite is the connection of the cessation of the connected.

original: shin tu bskal pa de ni bdag go //
analyzed: shin tu bskal pa de ni bdag go //
translated: I am that very self.

original: srog la sogs pa med bas khyab pa bdag med pa yang gang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i khyab pa'i yul mi mthun pa'i dpe 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa med bas khyab pa bdag med pa yang gang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa'i khyab pa'i yul mi mthun pa'i dpe 'dri ba'o //
translated: Since there is no life-force, etc., he asks, ‚ÄúWhat is the pervasion of selflessness?‚Äù This is an inquiry into a counterexample that is the opposite of the pervasion.

original: gzhan la yang mi mthong na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba tsam gyis bdag med par 'grub na gzhan yang phyogs la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir de yang bdag med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan la yang mi mthong na zhes bya ba ni mthong ba tsam gyis bdag med par 'grub na gzhan yang phyogs la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir de yang bdag med par 'gyur la /
translated: If it is not seen in another, then, if selflessness were established by mere seeing, since it is not seen in another, in the direction, etc., that also would be selfless.

original: de lta ma yin pa bdag de bum pa la sogs ba la med do zhes bya ba gang las de ma mthong ba tsam du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin pa bdag de bum pa la sogs ba la med do zhes bya ba gang las de ma mthong ba tsam du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were not so, then since there is no difference in the mere non-seeing of the self in a pot, etc., it would follow that the self does not exist in a pot, etc.

original: ldog pa mi shes pa med pas de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gang las log pa mi shes pa de'i'o //
analyzed: ldog pa mi shes pa med pas de'i zhes bya ba ni bdag gang las log pa mi shes pa de'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSince there is no non-cognition of the reversal of that‚Äù means that it is the self from which there is no non-cognition of the reversal.

original: 'ga' zhig mthong ba kho na la zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus 'ga' zhig kho na la'o //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig mthong ba kho na la zhes bya ba ni gson po'i lus 'ga' zhig kho na la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn some seeing‚Äù means in some living body.

original: bdag ni de ltar gzhan yod pa dang med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni de ltar gzhan yod pa dang med par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: The self is not understood in that way as existing or not existing in another.

original: gal te gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba'i ngag go //
analyzed: gal te gang yang zhes bya ba la sogs ba ni ldog pa can gyi sbyor ba'i ngag go //
translated: If someone says, ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äòany‚Äô is a statement that negates an alternative.üîΩ‚Äù

original: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bdag log pas srog la sogs pa ldog par sgrub pa de yang ngo //
analyzed: de la yang zhes bya ba ni bdag log pas srog la sogs pa ldog par sgrub pa de yang ngo //
translated: In that case, the proof that the life-force, etc. are negated by the negation of the self is also.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni bdag ni rang las tha dad pa srog la sogs pa rgyu ma grub pas so //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po ma yin pas zhes bya ba ni bdag ni rang las tha dad pa srog la sogs pa rgyu ma grub pas so //
translated: Because the self is not a real entity that is the cause of the life-force, etc., which are different from itself, it is not established as a cause.

original: de yang le'u gnyis par mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba'i skabs su don gzhan dgag par smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang le'u gnyis par mi dmigs pa'i dbye ba'i skabs su don gzhan dgag par smras pa yin no //
translated: Moreover, in the second chapter, in the context of the divisions of non-apprehension, it is said that other objects are negated.

original: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod ces 'das ma thag par brjod zin te /üîΩ'di ltar bdag dang bcas pa'i dpe'i chos 'ga' yang tshad @283a * //
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhes brjod ces 'das ma thag par brjod zin te / 'di ltar bdag dang bcas pa'i dpe'i chos 'ga' yang tshad @283a * //
translated: Because it is not seen, it is said that it is not seen. This was just said.

original: mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mas grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because no example that has the self is established by valid cognition.

original: gal te 'ga' zhig tu bdag mthong bar khas blangs kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis ni rjes su 'gro ba mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' zhig tu bdag mthong bar khas blangs kyang mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba tsam gyis ni rjes su 'gro ba mi 'grub ste /
translated: Even if one accepts that the self is seen somewhere, mere seeing in a concordant case does not establish concomitance.

original: ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the negation is not established.

original: de lta bu'i ldog pa las ni zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ma mthong ba tsam gyis med par 'dod pa'o //üîΩnus pa'i rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa bum pa yod kyang srog la sogs pa mi 'byung na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i ldog pa las ni zhes bya ba bum pa la sogs pa la bdag ma mthong ba tsam gyis med par 'dod pa'o // nus pa'i rgyu gzhan zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa bum pa yod kyang srog la sogs pa mi 'byung na /
translated: The phrase in that way, from that point of view means that the pot, etc. are asserted to be nonexistent by the mere non-seeing of self.

original: blo la sogs pa'i gzhan ba'i rgyu med pas srog la sogs ba med par 'gyur ro zhes dpag bar rung na de lta bu'i ni bum pa la sogs pa la mi srid do //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa'i gzhan ba'i rgyu med pas srog la sogs ba med par 'gyur ro zhes dpag bar rung na de lta bu'i ni bum pa la sogs pa la mi srid do //
translated: The phrase another cause of potency means that if, although the pot exists, the life, etc. of the pot do not occur, then the life, etc. would not exist because of the absence of another cause of the life, etc.üîΩSuch a situation is not possible for the pot, etc.

original: gal te blo la sogs pa de yang bdag med pas so zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa med ba de yang bdag med pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo la sogs pa de yang bdag med pas so zhes bya ba ni bum pa la sogs pa la blo la sogs pa med ba de yang bdag med pas so zhe na /
translated: The phrase that life, etc. of the pot, etc. is also nonexistent because of the nonexistence of self means that the nonexistence of life, etc. in the pot, etc. is also due to the nonexistence of self.

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag med pas blo la sogs ba med pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba ni bdag med pas blo la sogs ba med pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase it is not so means that the nonexistence of life, etc. is not due to the nonexistence of self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not so?

original: blo la sogs pa de la bdag las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i nus ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la sogs pa de la bdag las gzhan pa'i dngos po'i nus ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because we do not see any potency in the life, etc. other than self.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim la ltos ba ste /
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba ni rim la ltos ba ste /
translated: For a while means in dependence on a continuum.

original: shes pa dang / dbang po dang / yul rnams kyi rim pas so //
analyzed: shes pa dang / dbang po dang / yul rnams kyi rim pas so //
translated: In dependence on the continuum of consciousness, faculties, and objects.

original: rnam par shes pa snga ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa snga ma ni mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'o //
translated: The former consciousness is the equivalent immediately preceding condition.

original: gzhan dag shes pa'i rgyu yod ces bya ba rtag pa yod par 'dod de yul du ma dag nye yang shes pa yul kun cig car skye ba'i phyir yid ces bya ba gcig yod par rjes su dpag ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag shes pa'i rgyu yod ces bya ba rtag pa yod par 'dod de yul du ma dag nye yang shes pa yul kun cig car skye ba'i phyir yid ces bya ba gcig yod par rjes su dpag ste /
translated: Others assert that the cause of consciousness exists, that is, a permanent self exists because when many objects are present, consciousness of all objects arises simultaneously.

original: yid gcig po'i dbang gis shes pa rim gyis skye ba de lta ma yin na ni /
analyzed: yid gcig po'i dbang gis shes pa rim gyis skye ba de lta ma yin na ni /
translated: If it were not so, that is, if consciousness arose in sequence through the power of a single mind,

original: yul kun la dus gcig tu shes pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
analyzed: yul kun la dus gcig tu shes pa skye bar thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer te /
translated: then it would follow that consciousness of all objects would arise simultaneously.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir de yang yul gzhan spang ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir de yang yul gzhan spang ba dang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: To refute that, the root text states, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that consciousness arises from a single cause.‚Äù

original: nus pa ma yin pa'i shes pa snga ma de yul gzhan spong ba ste /
analyzed: nus pa ma yin pa'i shes pa snga ma de yul gzhan spong ba ste /
translated: The former consciousness that is not a potentiality abandons other objects.

original: yul gcig la gtod par 'dod pas yul gzhan la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dus gcig tu mi skye ba yin gyi ;
analyzed: yul gcig la gtod par 'dod pas yul gzhan la dmigs pa'i rnam par shes pa gzhan dus gcig tu mi skye ba yin gyi ;
translated: Therefore, when one wishes to direct the mind to one object, another consciousness that perceives a different object does not arise at the same time.

original: yid rtag ba nus pa med pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yid rtag ba nus pa med pas ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not because the mind is permanently incapable of functioning,

original: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car du re res don med pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa ni rim dang cig car du re res don med pa dag mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not possible for a permanent entity to function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: gnod pa can las ni rnam par shes pa phyi ma 'khrul pa skye'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gnod pa can las ni rnam par shes pa phyi ma 'khrul pa skye'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom a defective sense faculty‚Äù should be supplied to the phrase ‚Äúthe subsequent consciousness arises erroneously.‚Äù

original: stsogs pa'i sgra gnyis kyis ni mi gsal ba las ni mi gsal ba skye'o @283b zhes go rims bzhin du sbyor ro //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgra gnyis kyis ni mi gsal ba las ni mi gsal ba skye'o @283b zhes go rims bzhin du sbyor ro //
translated: The two terms ‚Äúand so on‚Äù should be supplied to the phrase ‚Äúfrom an unclear sense faculty, an unclear consciousness arises.‚Äù

original: dbang bo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni yul rnams kyang ngo //üîΩblo yang dbang bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dbang bo la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba ni yul rnams kyang ngo // blo yang dbang bo la sogs pa rnams kyi rkyen yin par brjod do //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe sense faculty and so on‚Äù means the sense objects as well.üîΩThe mind is also said to be a condition of the sense faculty and so on.

original: de yang dbang bo la sogs ba rnams kyi bdag po yin ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang dbang bo la sogs ba rnams kyi bdag po yin ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is because the mind is the dominant condition of the sense faculty and so on.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang bo la sogs pa'i rgyu dag gis so //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni dbang bo la sogs pa'i rgyu dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúTo that extent‚Äù means by the causes of the sense faculty and so on.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa 'bras bu rnams so //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la sogs pa 'bras bu rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the effects, such as cognition.

original: bdag nyid kyi dngos bo ni 'bras bur gyur pa blo la sogs pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang rjes su 'gro ba ste yod ba dang ldog pa ste med ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dngos bo ni 'bras bur gyur pa blo la sogs pa rnams rang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po dang rjes su 'gro ba ste yod ba dang ldog pa ste med ba'o //
translated: The ‚Äúown nature‚Äù of the effects, such as cognition, is their existence as their own nature, and their non-existence as their own nature.

original: can zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i chos de dag tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: can zhes bya ba ni rgyur gyur pa'i chos de dag tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba ldog pa dang ldan pa yin pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving‚Äù means that they have the existence and non-existence of only those phenomena that are causes.

original: 'di nyid rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi rjes su 'bras bu byed pa de nyid rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid rgyu yin te zhes bya ba ni gang gi rjes su 'bras bu byed pa de nyid rgyu yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThis itself is the cause‚Äù means that the cause is that which produces the effect.

original: rjes su bya ba'i chos gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su bya ba'i chos gzhan bzhin no //
translated: It is like another phenomenon that is to be produced.

original: gang gi rjes su 'bras bu byed pa de nyid rgyu yin pa de'i phyir de la yang ma mthong bar rgyu gzhan brtag na rgyu thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi rjes su 'bras bu byed pa de nyid rgyu yin pa de'i phyir de la yang ma mthong bar rgyu gzhan brtag na rgyu thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the cause is that which produces the effect, if another cause is imagined, since it would not be seen, an infinite regress of causes would ensue.

original: gang du yod na yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / drod dang gang zhig yod na rgyu yin pa la'o //
analyzed: gang du yod na yod pa nyid ces bya ba ni sa bon dang / sa dang / chu dang / drod dang gang zhig yod na rgyu yin pa la'o //
translated: Where does it exist? It exists in the seed, the earth, water, heat, and whatever else is a cause.

original: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba las sa bon la sogs pa de las gzhan ba yang ngo //
analyzed: de las gzhan du zhes bya ba las sa bon la sogs pa de las gzhan ba yang ngo //
translated: Other than that, it does not exist.

original: sngar bshad ba'i rim pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis las the tshom za ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: sngar bshad ba'i rim pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gnyis las the tshom za ba de'i phyir /
translated: The doubt arises from the two, concomitance and non-concomitance, as previously explained.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid dang / srog la sogs pa yang 'khrul ba can du mtshungs te /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid dang / srog la sogs pa yang 'khrul ba can du mtshungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is similar that listening and life-force, etc. are also mistaken.

original: srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Life-force, etc. are not the understood.

original: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya'o //
analyzed: ldog pa 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya'o //
translated: Because the non-concomitance is mistaken, it should be listened to.

original: ji ltar 'khrul zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul zhes bya ba ni grub pa'i mtha' smra ba'o //
translated: How is it mistaken? This is the proponent of the conclusion.

original: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na las ldog pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang log ba'i phyir te bum pa la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthunüîΩpa'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: de la mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na las ldog pa ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid de mi mthun pa'i phyogs las kyang log ba'i phyir te bum pa la sogs pa ni mi rtag pa nyid du bsgrub pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is the mere opposite of the discordant side, because a pot, etc. is a concordant side in the proof of impermanence.

original: de bzhin du 'di zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di zhes bya ba ni mnyan par bya ba nyid mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa de bzhin du'o //
translated: Similarly, this means that the concordant side is the opposite of the mere opposite of the discordant side.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa 'di'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa 'di'o //
translated: This means the life-force, etc.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa med pas smra ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba med par sngar smras pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩde ltar na srog la sogs pa de mthun @284a * //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa med pas smra ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba rjes su 'gro ba med par sngar smras pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'i don to // de ltar na srog la sogs pa de mthun @284a * //
translated: Isn't it said that it does not follow the concordant side? Isn't it said that it does not pervade?

original: pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid yin la mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de gzhan mnyan bar bya ba la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid yin la mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa de gzhan mnyan bar bya ba la yang mtshungs te /
translated: Thus, that life-force, etc. is not in the concordant side. That non-existence in the concordant side is the same as in the other, the concordant side.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'jug pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: because it is the very engagement with the concordant side.

original: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med pa zhes brjod pas kyang ngo ;
analyzed: gzhan yang srog la sogs pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med pa zhes brjod pas kyang ngo ;
translated: Moreover, it is also because of the expression ‚Äúnon-existence in the discordant side‚Äù in regard to life, etc.

original: / dgag pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la zhes bya ba dang med pa zhes bya ba dag gis so //
analyzed: / dgag pa gnyis kyis zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la zhes bya ba dang med pa zhes bya ba dag gis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy means of the two negations‚Äù means by means of ‚Äúin the discordant side‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-existence.‚Äù

original: rnal ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnal ma rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la yod bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRealization of the positive‚Äù means realization of existence in the concordant side.

original: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnal ma'i don mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ba mi rtogs pa'o//
analyzed: gzhan du zhes bya ba ni rnal ma'i don mthun pa'i phyogs la yod ba mi rtogs pa'o//
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means not realizing the positive object, existence in the concordant side.

original: rnam par gcad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa rnam par gcod na /
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa med pas zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa rnam par gcod na /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the absence of exclusion‚Äù means that if one excludes the non-existence in the concordant side,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med pa zhes bya ba gcig tu ldog ba can du smra ba nges par gzung ba gcad par bya ba med bas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med pa zhes bya ba gcig tu ldog ba can du smra ba nges par gzung ba gcad par bya ba med bas so //
translated: then the expression ‚Äúnon-existence in the discordant side‚Äù would be one that definitely includes, but that is not the case.

original: de ltar nges bar gzung bar 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod na ni ;
analyzed: de ltar nges bar gzung bar 'bras bu dang bcas par 'dod na ni ;
translated: If one wishes to have a definite inclusion that is fruitful,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod par bstan pas gcig du ldog pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa rnam par gcod pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba yod par bstan pas gcig du ldog pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the exclusion of the non-existence in the similar class, the existence of the forward pervasion is shown, and so there is no single instance of the two, forward and reverse pervasion.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med par nges par gzung pa med par smra na yang /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la med par nges par gzung pa med par smra na yang /
translated: Even if one were to say that the non-existence in the dissimilar class is not ascertained,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la med bar mi 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba med par ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la med bar mi 'gyur gyi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang med ba zhes bya bar 'gyur bas rjes su 'gro ba med par ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: it would not be the case that it does not exist in the dissimilar class alone, but it would be the case that it does not exist in the similar class either, and so there would be no forward pervasion.

original: de lta na ldog pa nges par mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta na ldog pa nges par mi 'grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: In that case, the reverse pervasion would not be established,

original: ldog pa nges pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa ni rjes su 'gro ba la rag las pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the establishment of the reverse pervasion depends on the forward pervasion.

original: de nyid de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: de nyid de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains that very point with ‚ÄúThat very . . . that very . . . ‚Äù and so forth.

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dpe dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gis te /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i dpe dag las gang yang rung ba gcig gis te /
translated: It is by means of either one of the similar and dissimilar examples.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dpes rjes su 'gro ba dngos su ston cing ldog pa shugs kyis ston te /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dpes rjes su 'gro ba dngos su ston cing ldog pa shugs kyis ston te /
translated: The example of the similar class directly teaches the forward pervasion and teaches the reverse pervasion implicitly.

original: de med na rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na rjes su 'gro ba nyid 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because if it did not exist, the pervasion would be established.

original: des na de gnyi ga rtags la yod pa nyid du bstan ba yin no //
analyzed: des na de gnyi ga rtags la yod pa nyid du bstan ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, both of these are taught as existing in the reason.

original: mi mthun pa'i dpe ni ston pa dngos su ston cing rjes su 'gro ba shugs kyis yin par bstan ba chos mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor bas slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i dpe ni ston pa dngos su ston cing rjes su 'gro ba shugs kyis yin par bstan ba chos mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa nyid kyi sbyor bas slob dpon gyis gsungs so //
translated: The master has stated that the concordant example is taught explicitly and the discordant example is taught implicitly by the application of concordance and discordance.

original: dgag pa bkag na zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa bkag na'o //
analyzed: dgag pa bkag na zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa bkag na'o //
translated: When the negation is negated means when the absence from the similar class is negated.

original: sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni mthun @284b ba'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur ba ste de lta ma yin na mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid rnam par gcad bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i rang bzhin ni mthun @284b ba'i phyogs la yod par 'gyur ba ste de lta ma yin na mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa nyid rnam par gcad bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The nature of the proof is to be present in the similar class; otherwise, the absence from the similar class would not be eliminated.

original: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba ma yin bas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba ma yin bas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs yod ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is said, because the similar class does not exist, the similar class of life-force, etc. does not exist.

original: srog dang ldan pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir /
analyzed: srog dang ldan pa thams cad phyogs su byas pa'i phyir /
translated: Because all that possesses life-force is taken as the class.

original: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba cung zad kyang ma grub pa de las ldog ba mi srid de yul med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs zhes bya ba cung zad kyang ma grub pa de las ldog ba mi srid de yul med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the so-called ‚Äúunfavorable‚Äù is not established in the least, and it is impossible to reverse that, because there is no object.

original: ldog pa'i ldog pa ni med ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ldog pa ni med ba med pa'o //
translated: The reversal of the reversal is the non-non.

original: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la ji ltar 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mthun pa'i phyogs med pa la ji ltar 'dod de /
translated: How is that asserted in the absence of the favorable?

original: 'di ltar med pa bkag pa ni zhes bya ba smos te ;
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa bkag pa ni zhes bya ba smos te ;
translated: Thus, he says, ‚ÄúThe negation of the non-existent . . .‚Äù

original: med pa la de yod la zhes bya ba ni de mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin te /
analyzed: med pa la de yod la zhes bya ba ni de mthun pa'i phyogs med pa yin te /
translated: The non-existent is that which exists in the absence of that. That is the absence of the favorable.

original: yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa bkag pa rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de yod la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa dgag pa med pa rang gi rang bzhin ni mi srid do zhes bya ba med pa la yod pa
analyzed: yang rjes su 'gro ba med pa bkag pa rjes su 'gro ba yod pa de yod la mthun pa'i phyogs med pa de la rjes su 'gro ba yod pa dgag pa med pa rang gi rang bzhin ni mi srid do zhes bya ba med pa la yod pa
translated: Moreover, the negation of the absence of concomitance is the existence of concomitance. The existence of concomitance in the absence of the favorable is the negation of the absence of the existence of its own nature.

original: yod la med pa med do //üîΩzhes 'gal ba ni mi srid do zhes sgo gnyi gar 'gal ba smra ba ni 'thing slad du bya ba'o //
analyzed: yod la med pa med do //üîΩzhes 'gal ba ni mi srid do zhes sgo gnyi gar 'gal ba smra ba ni 'thing slad du bya ba'o //
translated: The existence of the non-existent is impossible.üîΩThe assertion of a contradiction in the two modes, ‚ÄúThe existent is not non-existent, and the non-existent is not existent,‚Äù is meaningless.

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gang de dag dgag pa'i yul yang mi 'dod la zhes bya ba ni med pa dgag pa'i yul yang mi 'dod la /üîΩyod pa ma yin pa med do zhes bya bas yod pa yod par yang tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gang de dag dgag pa'i yul yang mi 'dod la zhes bya ba ni med pa dgag pa'i yul yang mi 'dod la / yod pa ma yin pa med do zhes bya bas yod pa yod par yang tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: Nor do we assert a non-existent object of negation.üîΩ‚Äú Non-existent‚Äù is a conventional expression for ‚Äúexistent.‚Äù

original: stsogs pas ni med pa la med pa ni mi srid par tha snyad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: stsogs pas ni med pa la med pa ni mi srid par tha snyad du byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù is a conventional expression for ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-existent.‚Äù

original: med ba la med pa nyid tsam bya ba'i skabs ni le'u gnyis par rtags kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: med ba la med pa nyid tsam bya ba'i skabs ni le'u gnyis par rtags kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: The section on ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù and ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is the teaching of the definition of the reason in the second chapter.üîΩBecause of the establishment of existence,

original: yod par bsgrub pa 'jug pa'i phyir //
analyzed: yod par bsgrub pa 'jug pa'i phyir //
translated: because of the engagement of the proof of existence,üîΩbecause of the existence of the reason that is not established as contradictory with the self, such as life-force,

original: zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang 'gal ba'i ma grub pa'i rtags yod pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang ma yin la go bar mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag dang 'gal ba'i ma grub pa'i rtags yod pa'i phyir bdag med pa yang ma yin la go bar mi byed pa yang ma yin no //
translated: selflessness is not, and it is not that it is not understood.

original: 'on kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'brel pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa las the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'brel pa yang ma grub pa'i phyir srog la sogs pa las the tshom za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: However, because the relation is not established in the way that it was explained previously, there is doubt about life-force and so on.

original: gal te ma yin te zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag la the tshom za ba ni ma yin te ldog pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te ma yin te zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa bdag la the tshom za ba ni ma yin te ldog pa nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that it is not so, then the doubt about the self of life-force, etc. is not so, because the negation is certain.

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: And how is that?

original: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa dag las log pa'i phyir de dag bdag med pa nyid du ni sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa dag las log pa'i phyir de dag bdag med pa nyid du ni sangs rgyas pas khas blangs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because of the negation of such things as pots, which are without self, they are accepted by the Buddhist as being without self.

original: tshad ma ma yin pa khas blangs pa zhes @285a * //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin pa khas blangs pa zhes @285a * //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIt is an acceptance of what is not a valid means of knowledge‚Äù means that it is an acceptance that is not reasonable.

original: bya ba ni rigs par byas pa ma yin par khas blangs pa las de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bas khas blangs bas bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par gyur na ni gson po'i lus kyang med pa nyid du ha cang yang thalüîΩbar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bya ba ni rigs par byas pa ma yin par khas blangs pa las de ltar gyur na zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bas khas blangs bas bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par gyur na ni gson po'i lus kyang med pa nyid du ha cang yang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúIf that is so‚Äù means that if, because of the acceptance by the Buddhist, such things as pots are without self, then the living body would absurdly become nonexistent.

original: de ltar pha rol khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar pha rol khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the acceptance of the opponent.

original: gal te gson po'i lus ni kho bo cag gis bdag dang bcas bar khas blangs pa'i phyir la bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par khas blangs ba'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gson po'i lus ni kho bo cag gis bdag dang bcas bar khas blangs pa'i phyir la bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par khas blangs ba'i phyir khyad par yod do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a difference because we accept that the living body has a self, but we accept that a pot, etc. does not have a self,

original: lung gis bdag 'grub par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: lung gis bdag 'grub par 'gyur gyi zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that the self would be established by scripture.

original: bdag yod par rang gis khas blangs pas 'grub pa bdag med par yang gnyi ga'i khas blangs pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag yod par rang gis khas blangs pas 'grub pa bdag med par yang gnyi ga'i khas blangs pas 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the self is established by one‚Äôs own acceptance, and the nonexistence of the self is established by the acceptance of both.

original: srog la sogs pa bdag la the tshom za ba de'i phyir gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ma log kyang de log pa ma mthong na yang srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur te de las
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag la the tshom za ba de'i phyir gal te mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir de las ma log kyang de log pa ma mthong na yang srog la sogs pa mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur te de las
translated: Since there is doubt about the self in life, etc., if the absence of a counterexample is not reversed, then even if the reversal of that is not seen, there is doubt about the reversal of life, etc. from the counterexample.

original: ldog par 'gyur ro de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bdag the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ldog par 'gyur ro de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bdag the tshom za ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúbecause of doubt about the self,‚Äù in order to demonstrate that.

original: bdag nyid thams cad du bltar mi rung ba'i phyir gang na yod pa dang med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa las srog la sogs pa yang mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad du bltar mi rung ba'i phyir gang na yod pa dang med pa nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir bum pa la sogs pa las srog la sogs pa yang mthun pa'i phyogs las log pa yin par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since it is not seen in its entirety, it is not established as existent or nonexistent anywhere. Therefore, life force and so on are suspected to be absent in the similar class of pots and so on.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la nges ba med pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la nges par 'grub na gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug par nges par 'grub ste /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la nges ba med pa de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang mthun pa'i phyogs gcig la nges par 'grub na gzhan gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs la mi 'jug par nges par 'grub ste /
translated: If it is ascertained in one member of the similar class, then it is ascertained to be absent in the dissimilar class.

original: de lta na gdod mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod par nges par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na gdod mthun pa'i phyogs nyid la yod par nges par 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in that case, it is ascertained to exist only in the similar class.

original: de las gzhan du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gzhan la mthun pa 'ga' zhig la rtags med par grub kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid ma mthong ba dag la ni ldog pa ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la gzhan la mthun pa 'ga' zhig la rtags med par grub kyang mi mthun pa'i phyogs de nyid ma mthong ba dag la ni ldog pa ste /
translated: Otherwise, even if it is established that it does not exist in some other dissimilar class, it is not ascertained to be absent in that very dissimilar class that is not seen.

original: the tshom za ba yin te /
analyzed: the tshom za ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is doubt.

original: rdzas kyi bye brag mtha' dag ma yin pa la khyab pa zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i don kha cig go //
analyzed: rdzas kyi bye brag mtha' dag ma yin pa la khyab pa zhes bya ba ni de 'dra ba thams cad la yod pa ma yin pa'i don kha cig go //
translated: The meaning of the expression ‚Äúpervasion of all‚Äù is that the pervasion of all is not the same as the pervasion of all substances.

original: de dag mthong ba'i rdzas kha cig la med par grub kyang yang rdzas de dang rigs 'dra ba gzhan la yang srid pa mthong ba ste /
analyzed: de dag mthong ba'i rdzas kha cig la med par grub kyang yang rdzas de dang rigs 'dra ba gzhan la yang srid pa mthong ba ste /
translated: Even though the absence of pervasion is established in some substances, it is seen that it is possible in other substances of the same class.

original: sa'i rang bzhin can shing dang rus pa dang / rdo la sogs pa phal che ba kha cig lcags kyis @285b 'joms te /
analyzed: sa'i rang bzhin can shing dang rus pa dang / rdo la sogs pa phal che ba kha cig lcags kyis @285b 'joms te /
translated: For example, iron destroys some substances of the nature of earth, such as wood, bone, stone, etc.,

original: gcod pa dang / 'bigs ba dang / gcod pa dag mthong yang /
analyzed: gcod pa dang / 'bigs ba dang / gcod pa dag mthong yang /
translated: but it is seen that iron is destroyed by water.
