original: yang sa'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje dag la lcags kyis 'joms pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: yang sa'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba'i rdo rje dag la lcags kyis 'joms pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: And even though iron destroys some substances of the nature of earth, such as wood, bone, stone, etc., it is seen that iron is not destroyed by a diamond, which is of the same class as earth.

original: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par nges na de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par nges pa yin gyi de mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la nges pa de ma grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba 'gal zhig la med pa'i yod kyangüîΩde ma mthong ba dag la med ba nyid la the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod par nges na de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med par nges pa yin gyi de mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la nges pa de ma grub na mi mthun pa'i phyogs mthong ba 'gal zhig la med pa'i yod kyang de ma mthong ba dag la med ba nyid la the tshom za bar 'gyur te /
translated: But if it is not ascertained that it exists only in the concordant class, then it is contradictory to see it in the discordant class.

original: mthun ba'i phyogs kho na la yod bar nges na de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod bar dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun ba'i phyogs kho na la yod bar nges na de nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang yod bar dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is ascertained that it exists only in the concordant class, then it is doubted that it does not exist in the discordant class.

original: 'gal pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis sngar bstan pa dag kyang bdag ltar mi rung ba dang lhan cig ma grub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gal pa'i mtshan nyid bstan pa dag kyang ma grub pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i mtshan nyid gnyis sngar bstan pa dag kyang bdag ltar mi rung ba dang lhan cig ma grub pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the two characteristics of contradiction that were previously taught are not established as being incompatible with the self.

original: bdag med ba la srog la sogs pa ldog ba la the tshom za'o //
analyzed: bdag med ba la srog la sogs pa ldog ba la the tshom za'o //
translated: Therefore, one doubts that life and so on is stopped in the absence of self.

original: gal te 'gal ba gnyis po dag ma grub kyang tshad mas gnod pa'i 'gal ba yod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba gnyis po dag ma grub kyang tshad mas gnod pa'i 'gal ba yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that although the two contradictions are not established, there is a contradiction that is undermined by valid cognition,

original: srog la sogs ba rnams nges par bdag de'i 'bras bu yin na ni bdag med pa dang / srog la sogs pa 'gal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog la sogs ba rnams nges par bdag de'i 'bras bu yin na ni bdag med pa dang / srog la sogs pa 'gal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then if life and so on are definitely the effect of that self, there would be a contradiction between the nonexistence of the self and life and so on.

original: srog la sogs ba dang de med ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs ba dang de med ba ni phan tshun spangs pas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because life and so on and the nonexistence of that self are mutually exclusive and incompatible.

original: 'gal ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'gal ba nyid yin la /
translated: There is a contradiction.

original: de dang 'gal ba srog la sogs pa med pa de khyab pa dag med pa yod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba srog la sogs pa de dang 'gal ba srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa bdag med pa dmigs pa rtags kyi tshad mas gnod pa'i 'gal
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba srog la sogs pa med pa de khyab pa dag med pa yod pa'i phyir dgag par bya ba srog la sogs pa de dang 'gal ba srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa bdag med pa dmigs pa rtags kyi tshad mas gnod pa'i 'gal
translated: But since the nonexistence of life and so on, which is contradictory to that, exists, the existence of the self, which is pervaded by the nonexistence of life and so on, which is contradictory to that object of negation, is undermined by the evidence of perception.

original: bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: bar 'gyur na /
translated: This is a contradiction.

original: 'gal ba 'di'i rtsa bar gyur ba srog la sogs pa dang bdag tu 'brel ba 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa rtags mi srid do //
analyzed: 'gal ba 'di'i rtsa bar gyur ba srog la sogs pa dang bdag tu 'brel ba 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa rtags mi srid do //
translated: But since the root of this contradiction, the relation between the self and life and so on, is not established at all, it is impossible for the evidence of perception to pervade the contradiction.

original: 'bras bu smos pa ni mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir de bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yang ma grub ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu smos pa ni mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir de bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa yang ma grub ste /
translated: The mention of the effect is an illustration, so the relation of identity is not established.

original: bdag rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag rang gi ngo bo grub pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the self does not exist inherently.

original: de nyid de yang ma grub po zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma grub po zhes bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been demonstrated that that is not established.

original: zhes bya ba bdag ltar mi rung ba la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gnyis kyis rang bzhin la mngon sum la rag las ba'i 'brel ba'i mi 'grub po zhes 'das ma thag tu bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba bdag ltar mi rung ba la mthong ba dang ma mthong ba gnyis kyis rang bzhin la mngon sum la rag las ba'i 'brel ba'i mi 'grub po zhes 'das ma thag tu bstan zin to //
translated: It has just been explained that the relation of the self to the seen and unseen is not established in terms of the nature of the self, which is dependent on perception.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa de bdag med pa las log pa yod na yang /
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa de bdag med pa las log pa yod na yang /
translated: If life and so on were to exist in the absence of the self,

original: @286a * // de ltar na srog la sogs pa de yod pas gson po'i lus la bdag med pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: @286a * // de ltar na srog la sogs pa de yod pas gson po'i lus la bdag med pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: then, since life and so on would exist, the living body would not be without the self.

original: bdag med pa yod na srog la sogs pa med par 'gyur te de las log ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa yod na srog la sogs pa med par 'gyur te de las log ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the self did not exist, life and so on would not exist, because they would be absent in the absence of the self.

original: des bdag med pa med par 'grub kyang bdag ni mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des bdag med pa med par 'grub kyang bdag ni mi 'grub po //
translated: Although the nonexistence of the self is established, the self is not established.

original: ci'i phyir bdag med pa log na bdag mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bdag med pa log na bdag mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it that if selflessness is refuted, the self is not established?

original: gang gi khyod kyi lugs ltar na ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba med ba med na yang ngo //
analyzed: gang gi khyod kyi lugs ltar na ldog pa med na yang zhes bya ba med ba med na yang ngo //
translated: In your system, if there is no non-occurrence, there is no non-existence.

original: med pa med pa de la yod ba grub par ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: med pa med pa de la yod ba grub par ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But you do not accept that non-existence is established as existent.

original: ji ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang de srog la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar mthun pa'i phyogs la srog la sogs pa ldog pa med kyang de srog la sogs pa yod par mi 'dod pas so //
translated: Just as in the case of a concordant example, even though life force, etc., do not occur, you do not accept that life force, etc., exist.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin bsam pa la ni mthun pa'i phyogs la mi ldog na zhes bya ba rtags ldog pa med na mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs su 'gro ba dang ldan de med pa med pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin bsam pa la ni mthun pa'i phyogs la mi ldog na zhes bya ba rtags ldog pa med na mthun pa'i phyogs la gtan tshigs su 'gro ba dang ldan de med pa med pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: In the case of the nature of things, if there is no non-occurrence in the concordant example, then the reason does not pervade the concordant example.

original: dgag ba bkag pa ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgag ba bkag pa ni bsgrub pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-existence of non-existence is existence, because the negation of the object of negation is the nature of the affirmation.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog ba med rjes su 'gro ba med na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ldog pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog ba med rjes su 'gro ba med na ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ldog pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is no non-occurrence in the concordant example, if there is no pervasion, then even though there is no pervasion in the discordant example, there is occurrence.

original: de ltar na ni srog la sogs pa rtags kyis bdag yod ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na ni srog la sogs pa rtags kyis bdag yod ma yin /
translated: Thus, the self does not exist because of the evidence of life, etc.

original: bdag med min de gang yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med min de gang yang rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Nor does the self not exist, because it is not understood to be nonexistent.

original: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa gson po'i lus la yod pas bdag med pa ldog pa des na bdag yod par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa gson po'i lus la yod pas bdag med pa ldog pa des na bdag yod par rtogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If the self does not exist, but is not nonexistent because of the evidence of life, etc., then the self is understood to exist.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa nges ba bsam pa'i skyon gyis gos pa med do snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa nges ba bsam pa'i skyon gyis gos pa med do snyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the fault of the uncertainty of the evidence does not apply.

original: bsgrub pa'i sgo kho na nas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa la mi ltos par bdag grub na'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'i sgo kho na nas zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa yod pa tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dran pa la mi ltos par bdag grub na'o //
translated: If the self were established by the evidence of life, etc., without regard to the memory of the concomitance and the reverse concomitance of the mere existence of life, etc.,

original: da ni zhes bya ba ldog ba las mi ltos na'o //
analyzed: da ni zhes bya ba ldog ba las mi ltos na'o //
translated: then,

original: bdag med pa las ldog pa'i zhes bya bas ldog pa can gyi rtags kyi'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa las ldog pa'i zhes bya bas ldog pa can gyi rtags kyi'o //
translated: the self would not be nonexistent because of the evidence of life, etc.

original: 'di ni zhes bya ba ldog ba can gyi rtags de ni'o //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes bya ba ldog ba can gyi rtags de ni'o //
translated: This evidence of life, etc.,

original: de la mi srid ba zhes bya bas bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa mi srid pa ste /
analyzed: de la mi srid ba zhes bya bas bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa mi srid pa ste /
translated: Since it is impossible means that the life principle and so on are impossible in the absence of self,

original: ldog pa can yin pa'i phyir ldog ba can srog la sogs pa gson po'i lus la yod na rtags de rang de la yod bas gson po'i lus de la bdag med bar mi srid par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir bdag med pa de srid na bdag @286b yod
analyzed: ldog pa can yin pa'i phyir ldog ba can srog la sogs pa gson po'i lus la yod na rtags de rang de la yod bas gson po'i lus de la bdag med bar mi srid par sgrub par byed pa'i phyir bdag med pa de srid na bdag @286b yod
translated: because it is a contradictory reason, if the life principle and so on, which are the contradictories, existed in the living body, then that reason would exist in that body. Therefore, it proves that the absence of self is impossible in that living body.

original: par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: par bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: So, in order to prove the existence of self,

original: de la ldog pa can gyi rtags yin par khyod brjod na /üîΩda ni ldog pa'i thabs las gzhan ba bsgrub pa 'ga' zhig gis bdag nye bar grub na'o //
analyzed: de la ldog pa can gyi rtags yin par khyod brjod na / da ni ldog pa'i thabs las gzhan ba bsgrub pa 'ga' zhig gis bdag nye bar grub na'o //
translated: you have said that it is a contradictory reason.üîΩNow, if you prove the existence of self by some other means than the contradictory reason, then self is established.

original: yang na ni zhes bya ba skyon gzhan ston pa ste 'di ltar bsgrub ba'i sgo kho na nas grub na yang srog la sogs pa de bdag kho na la yod par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ci zhig grub pas srog la sogs pas grub ba'i sgo nas bdag gson
analyzed: yang na ni zhes bya ba skyon gzhan ston pa ste 'di ltar bsgrub ba'i sgo kho na nas grub na yang srog la sogs pa de bdag kho na la yod par nges pa'i rgyu mtshan ci zhig grub pas srog la sogs pas grub ba'i sgo nas bdag gson
translated: Or, if you prove it only by the means of proof, then what is the reason for ascertaining that the life principle and so on exist only in self?

original: po'i lus la go bar byed do zhes brjod par bya /
analyzed: po'i lus la go bar byed do zhes brjod par bya /
translated: It is said that the body of the reason is understood.üîΩIf it were established in that way,

original: de ltar grub na zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu cung zad med par grub pa'i sgo nas nges pa de ltar gyur na bum pas snam bu sgrub ba'i sgo khon nas nges pa la sogs pa ha cang thal 'gyur ro //üîΩthun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya bar nges pa ni med la phyogs ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar grub na zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i rgyu cung zad med par grub pa'i sgo nas nges pa de ltar gyur na bum pas snam bu sgrub ba'i sgo khon nas nges pa la sogs pa ha cang thal 'gyur ro // thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges pa zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs sam mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'ga' yang ma grub pa'i phyir de dag la yod pa dang / med pa zhes bya bar nges pa ni med la phyogs ni yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: if ascertainment were to occur in that way, without the slightest cause for certainty, then it would follow, absurdly, that the pot would ascertain the cloth, simply by virtue of its being established.üîΩAs for the uncommon inconclusive reason, because there is no establishment of any similar or dissimilar instances, it is not ascertained that it exists or does not exist in those, but it is ascertained that it exists in some other position.

original: thun mong ba zhes brjod pa ni gzhal bar bya ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa grub pa la mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi gas yod pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thun mong ba zhes brjod pa ni gzhal bar bya ba nyid de zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa grub pa la mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs gnyi gas yod pa'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As for the common reason, it is said to be the probandum itself, because impermanence is found in both the similar and dissimilar instances.

original: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rtag pa dag gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid mi rtag ba la ma nges pa yin nam zhe na 'dus ma byas la skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gal te nam mkha' la sogs pa 'dus ma byas rtag pa dag gzhal bar bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid mi rtag ba la ma nges pa yin nam zhe na 'dus ma byas la skur ba 'debs pa zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say that since permanent unconditioned states such as space are objects of comprehension, the reason is not established with respect to impermanent objects of comprehension, then the text says, ‚ÄúThose who deny unconditioned states.‚Äù

original: gang dag 'dus ma byas brtags pa yin gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin par 'dod pa dag la yang 'dus ma byas med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag 'dus ma byas brtags pa yin gyi dngos po yod pa ma yin par 'dod pa dag la yang 'dus ma byas med pa'i phyir /
translated: Even for those who assert that unconditioned states are imputed and do not exist as things, unconditioned states do not exist.

original: yul med pa la 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir de la gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ma nges pa med la /
analyzed: yul med pa la 'jug pa mi rigs pa'i phyir de la gtan tshigs rjes su 'gro ba mi rigs pa'i phyir ma nges pa med la /
translated: Because it is illogical to engage in that which does not exist, it is illogical for the reason to be concomitant with that.üîΩTherefore, because the reason is concomitant with the similar class, which is impermanent alone, there is no error of concomitance.

original: de nyid kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa kho na la yod pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid rigs ba can dag smra ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir mthun pa'i phyogs mi rtag pa kho na la yod pa'i phyir rjes su 'gro ba mi 'khrul pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid ni rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs nyid rigs ba can dag smra ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the NyƒÅya say that the reason is established as the property of the subject.

original: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa can ldog pa nyi tsher mi rigs bar ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: 'di la yang zhes bya ba ni ldog pa can ldog pa nyi tsher mi rigs bar ma zad do zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: The word also means that not only is it not possible to have a mere partial counter-correlate of the universal, but also...

original: 'di pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can 'di la ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med de rjes su 'gro ba yod na ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba can 'di la ji ltar mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa med de rjes su 'gro ba yod na ldog pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word here means that, in the case of a universal, how could there be no counter-correlate of the discordant side, since if there is a universal, there is a counter-correlate.üîΩWhy?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩ'di ltar @287a * //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di ltar @287a * //
translated: Because...

original: rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ni mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa yin la /
translated: The word universal means that it exists only in the concordant side.

original: de ltar ci mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par mi gcod na ni de na srid par ston pa yin la de lta na ni /
analyzed: de ltar ci mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pas mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid rnam par mi gcod na ni de na srid par ston pa yin la de lta na ni /
translated: If it were so, that is, if it were the case that it exists only in the concordant side and does not eliminate existence in the discordant side, then it would be shown to be possible there. In that case,

original: mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba'i nges bar bzung ba'i 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs kho na la yod pa zhes bya ba'i nges bar bzung ba'i 'bras bu yang ci'i phyir ro //
translated: why would the result of the restriction it exists only in the concordant side be necessary?

original: de ma yin pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma yin pa yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would exist in what is not that, that is, in the discordant side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa rnam par gcod na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ji ltar ldog pa med ba yin /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa rnam par gcod na yang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa'i phyir ji ltar ldog pa med ba yin /
translated: If it excludes what is discordant, then since it is not discordant, how can it be an exclusion?

original: gal te yod pa rnam par gcod pa med de ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yod pa rnam par gcod pa med de ldog par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it does not exclude what is existent, then how can it be an exclusion?

original: yod pa rnam par gcad ba las gzhan pa ni ldog pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: yod pa rnam par gcad ba las gzhan pa ni ldog pa ni med do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúThere is no exclusion other than the exclusion of what is existent.‚Äù

original: yod pa rnam par gcad pa nyid ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa rnam par gcad pa nyid ldog pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the exclusion of what is existent is the nature of exclusion.

original: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gzhi med pa las ldog pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba gnyi gal med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi mthun pa'i phyogs med pa'i phyir gzhi med pa las ldog pa dang / rjes su 'gro ba gnyi gal med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that because the discordant class does not exist, there is no exclusion and no pervasion in the absence of a basis,

original: gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgal te med pa ni gzhir mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gang kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te med pa ni gzhir mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúIt is just that which is the basis.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that because the nonexistent is not suitable as a basis,

original: des na med pa la ldog pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di yang 'ongs pa yin te /
analyzed: des na med pa la ldog pa mi rigs so zhes bya ba 'di yang 'ongs pa yin te /
translated: then it is also the case that exclusion is not tenable in the nonexistent.

original: de la yang kho bos yang ji ltar na med pa la rjes su 'gro ba 'gog cing smras te zhes bya ba 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rim pas 'gog par byed do //
analyzed: de la yang kho bos yang ji ltar na med pa la rjes su 'gro ba 'gog cing smras te zhes bya ba 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i rim pas 'gog par byed do //
translated: In response to that, we ask: How could we refute the non-existent?

original: gal te med pas kyang des stong pa'i dngos po 'dren par byed pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid med pa la zhugs bas kyang mi rtag pa kho na la zhugs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pas kyang des stong pa'i dngos po 'dren par byed pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya ba nyid med pa la zhugs bas kyang mi rtag pa kho na la zhugs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that because the non-existent also induces the entity that is empty of that, then even though one engages the non-existent, one still engages impermanence.

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'dren pa ni med par bkag pas mi srid pa'i phyir te mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'dren pa ni med par bkag pas mi srid pa'i phyir te mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible to induce the characteristics of an entity by negating the non-existent, because it is not possible.

original: de 'dren na ni de med pas bkag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dren na ni de med pas bkag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were induced, then it would not be a negation of the non-existent.

original: gal te med ces bya ba ni sgra'i yul ni med par bkag pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med ces bya ba ni sgra'i yul ni med par bkag pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the term ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is not a negation of the object,

original: med ces bya ba'i yul ni ma yin par bkag pa dngos po 'dren pa gcig pu ma yin gyi /
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i yul ni ma yin par bkag pa dngos po 'dren pa gcig pu ma yin gyi /
translated: then the object of the term ‚Äúnon-existent‚Äù is not only an induction of an entity,

original: 'on kyang bkag pa yang yin te gtan med pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang bkag pa yang yin te gtan med pa lta bu'o //
translated: but also a negation, like utter non-existence.

original: de'i phyir med par bkag pa de dang med pa'i sgra mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir med par bkag pa de dang med pa'i sgra mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, the negation of existence and the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù are not contradictory.

original: de ltar na gzhal bar bya ba ni med par bkag pa yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: de ltar na gzhal bar bya ba ni med par bkag pa yang 'jug ste /
translated: Thus, the object of comprehension is engaged by the negation of existence,

original: med ces bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i sgra dang shes pa yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù and the cognition that takes it as its object are engaged.

original: de lta na med pa la ni mi rtag pa nyid med de mi rtag pa nyid ni 'dir @287b dngos po g-yo ba don byed pa'i rang bzhin la brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na med pa la ni mi rtag pa nyid med de mi rtag pa nyid ni 'dir @287b dngos po g-yo ba don byed pa'i rang bzhin la brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In that case, impermanence does not exist in the nonexistent, because impermanence is said to be the nature of a thing that is unstable and functions.

original: de la med par bkag pa'i med pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la med par bkag pa'i med pa la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not exist in the nonexistent that is the negation of existence.

original: gzhal bar bya ba nyid de la zhugs ba mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba nyid de la zhugs ba mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: The existence of the object of comprehension in the concordant class is established.

original: gal te yang mi srid do zhes zer ba ni gsal byed de /
analyzed: gal te yang mi srid do zhes zer ba ni gsal byed de /
translated: If one says that it is impossible, that is a mere assertion.

original: 'di ltar gtan med pa de la med pa'i sgra 'jug pa mi srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan med pa de la med pa'i sgra 'jug pa mi srid de /
translated: Thus, it is impossible for the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù to be engaged in that which is utterly nonexistent.

original: 'di ltar gzhi la sogs pa zhes bya ba med pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba bdun pa'i don la sogs pas med pa las mi ldog ces bya ba la dngang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i don rnams med pa'i yul la nye bar dran parüîΩmi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhi la sogs pa zhes bya ba med pa la 'jug go zhes bya ba bdun pa'i don la sogs pas med pa las mi ldog ces bya ba la dngang ba la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba'i don rnams med pa'i yul la nye bar dran par mi rigs te /
translated: Thus, one should not be afraid of the meaning of the seven terms, ‚Äúnon-existence of the basis, etc.,‚Äù in the sense of non-reversal from non-existence, because the meanings of the distinctions of fear, etc., are not recalled in the domain of non-existence.

original: yul med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: yul med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Why? Because the domain does not exist.

original: 'di'i lan brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis pa'i med ces bya ba la sogs par yang dang yang du bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'di'i lan brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis pa'i med ces bya ba la sogs par yang dang yang du bstan zin to //
translated: The reply to this has already been given, i.e., it has been taught again and again in the second chapter, in the passage beginning: ‚ÄúNon-existence, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pa na rjes su 'gro ba med cing rjes su 'gro ba yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med pa na rjes su 'gro ba med cing rjes su 'gro ba yod na /
translated: Therefore, when there is no reversal, there is no forward movement, and when there is forward movement,

original: de nyid kyis ldog pa yang yod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ldog pa yang yod de /
translated: by that very fact there is also reversal.

original: nges ba ni sgra gnyis pa can yin pa'i phyir rdzas su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ldog pa dang mi ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i rtags ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: nges ba ni sgra gnyis pa can yin pa'i phyir rdzas su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba ldog pa dang mi ldan pa'i rjes su 'gro ba can zhes bya ba'i rtags ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Since the certainty is expressed by a double negative, there is no reason at all for the forward movement called ‚Äúnon-reversal‚Äù and the reason called ‚Äúnon-possession of reversal.‚Äù

original: gzhan yang gzhal bar bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba nyi tshe ma yin par zad kyi thun mong gi ma nges pa nyid kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan yang gzhal bar bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba nyid ces bya ba nyi tshe ma yin par zad kyi thun mong gi ma nges pa nyid kyang yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to show that the property to be proven is not only the pervasion, but also the common inconclusive,

original: gzhal bar bya ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'dir yod pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba nyid mi mthun pa'i phyogs la rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba 'dir yod pa'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe property to be proven is the pervasion of the dissimilar class.‚Äù

original: de ni mi rigs pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThis is not unreasonable,‚Äù

original: gsum du brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro //
analyzed: gsum du brjod zin to zhes bya ba ni le'u gnyis par ro //
translated: and ‚ÄúThe three have already been stated‚Äù in Chapter Two.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med ba nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par rnam par gcod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med ba nyid kyi chos kyis stong pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba med par rnam par gcod pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe property to be proven is the emptiness of the property of non-pervasion‚Äù eliminates non-pervasion.

original: gal te rnam par gcod pa ni rnam par rtog pas byas ba ste /
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod pa ni rnam par rtog pas byas ba ste /
translated: If it is said that elimination is done by conceptualization,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: and not by the nature of things,

original: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kho na chos yin pa ni ma yin te 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos nyid yin na ni dngos po yang yin na ;
analyzed: dngos po'i mtshan nyid kho na chos yin pa ni ma yin te 'di ltar rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i don gyis chos nyid yin na ni dngos po yang yin na ;
translated: It is not that only the characteristics of things are phenomena, because in that case, if phenomena were things that hold their own characteristics,üîΩthen even mental imputations that depend on other things would be phenomena.

original: yid kyis gzhan la brten te brtags pa yang chos nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par gcad pa dag kyang chos zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid kyis gzhan la brten te brtags pa yang chos nyid yin pa'i phyir rnam par gcad pa dag kyang chos zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, even eliminations are called phenomena.

original: ldog pa'i bye brag gi chos rnams de lta bu de'i phyir yod pa la brten nas /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bye brag gi chos rnams de lta bu de'i phyir yod pa la brten nas /
translated: Since phenomena are the particularities of exclusions, therefore, based on existence,

original: de la ltos te rnam par gcad pa tsam mang yin la rang gi mtshan nyid @288a * //
analyzed: de la ltos te rnam par gcad pa tsam mang yin la rang gi mtshan nyid @288a * //
translated: in dependence on that, eliminations are merely many.

original: 'dzin pa'am / gzhan la brtan par snang ba'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'am / gzhan la brtan par snang ba'i phyir chos zhes bya'o //
translated: They are called phenomena because they hold their own characteristics or because they appear to depend on other things.

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir med pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad kyi lam du sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir med pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig gi tha snyad kyi lam du sbyor ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, ‚Äúbecause non-existence is also applied as a path of convention in some way.‚Äù

original: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gcad pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / yid la snang bas tha snyad du nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par gcad pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa dang / yid la snang bas tha snyad du nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, as previously explained, the exclusion is apprehended by the mind, and because the exclusion is ascertained conventionally by the appearance to the mind.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba med pa la sgra'i yul chos su mi sbyor na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba med pa la sgra'i yul chos su mi sbyor na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if one does not apply the term to the non-existent as the property of the word,

original: de la tha snyad du mi bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni med pa la med par rtogs pa'i sgra dang shes pas mi gcod par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: de la tha snyad du mi bya bar yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni med pa la med par rtogs pa'i sgra dang shes pas mi gcod par 'gyur ro /
translated: then it would not be the case that one does not make the convention. The word and the cognition that understands the non-existent as non-existent would not exclude it.

original: de ltar na yod pa'i chos kyi tha snyad kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na yod pa'i chos kyi tha snyad kyang yod par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the convention of the existent property would not exist,

original: de'i dngos po med bar ma bsal bar de'i ngo bo nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i dngos po med bar ma bsal bar de'i ngo bo nges par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because without the negation of its non-existence, one cannot ascertain its nature.

original: gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni med pa la med par gnyi ga dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dag grub bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga dang gnyi ga ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba ni med pa la med par gnyi ga dang / de gnyi ga ma yin pa'i rnam par gzhag pa dag grub bar byed pa ste /
translated: Both and neither, etc. means that both the existent and the non-existent are established as the arrangement of both and neither.

original: tshad mas ma nges na'o //
analyzed: tshad mas ma nges na'o //
translated: If one does not ascertain by means of a valid cognition.

original: yod par 'dod pa'i grub mtha' la sogs pa'i so sor mi mthun par smra ba dang ldan pa dag de'i grub mtha' dang ldan pa dang ldan pa de ma yin pa dag gcig tu bye brag byed par nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod par 'dod pa'i grub mtha' la sogs pa'i so sor mi mthun par smra ba dang ldan pa dag de'i grub mtha' dang ldan pa dang ldan pa de ma yin pa dag gcig tu bye brag byed par nges par gzung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Those who have different assertions about tenets that are asserted to exist would not be ascertained as being the same in terms of having or not having those tenets.

original: 'di ltar med pa shes pas yul du ma byas na yod pa yang mi nges pa'i phyir dang / de grub pa'i mtha' med par ma nges na de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang ldan pa yang nges par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar med pa shes pas yul du ma byas na yod pa yang mi nges pa'i phyir dang / de grub pa'i mtha' med par ma nges na de'i grub pa'i mtha' dang ldan pa yang nges par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because if nonexistence is not taken as an object by consciousness, existence is not ascertained, and if the nonexistence of tenets is not ascertained, having tenets is also not ascertained.

original: grub pa'i mtha'i dbye ba dag nges par bzung ba ste /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha'i dbye ba dag nges par bzung ba ste /
translated: The divisions of tenets would not be ascertained.

original: tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha snyad du byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They would not be conventionally posited.

original: gzhung lugs tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyang med par nus pa de'i phyir gang ltar ji ltar yang rung zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa 'am med par yang rung /
analyzed: gzhung lugs tha dad pa'i tha snyad kyang med par nus pa de'i phyir gang ltar ji ltar yang rung zhes bya ba ni ma yin par dgag pa 'am med par yang rung /
translated: Since it is possible that even the conventions of different textual systems would not exist, it is said that ‚Äúit would not matter how it is.‚Äù

original: yod pa las bzlog pa tsam yod pa'i chos kyi bye brag rtogs kyang rung /
analyzed: yod pa las bzlog pa tsam yod pa'i chos kyi bye brag rtogs kyang rung /
translated: It is also possible to understand the particular of an existent entity that is merely the opposite of existence.

original: sgra dang nges pa'i shes pa 'dis med par byed pa na'o //
analyzed: sgra dang nges pa'i shes pa 'dis med par byed pa na'o //
translated: When this sound and the ascertaining consciousness make it non-existent.

original: med pa de nyid gzhal bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: med pa de nyid gzhal bar bya ba zhes bya'o //
translated: That non-existence is called the object of comprehension.

original: de'i phyir gtan med pa la yang gzhal par bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtan med pa la yang gzhal par bya ba nyid rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension is necessarily non-existent.

original: gal te sgra dang rtogs bar rang dga'i yul ni dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sgra dang rtogs bar rang dga'i yul ni dngos po med pa'i phyir gzhal bar bya bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the object of sound and understanding is a non-entity, it would not be the object of comprehension.

original: de'i phyir gzhal ba ni med pa la mi 'jug gi tshad ma'i yul kho na la gzhal bar bya ba yin la de ni dngos bor yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhal ba ni med pa la mi 'jug gi tshad ma'i yul kho na la gzhal bar bya ba yin la de ni dngos bor yod pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the object of comprehension does not apply to non-existence, but is only the object of valid cognition, and that exists as an entity.

original: mi slu ba can yin @288b pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: mi slu ba can yin @288b pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is non-deceptive.

original: tshad ma'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: tshad ma'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe object of valid cognition,‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te med pa tshad ma'i yul yin na de ni cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te med pa tshad ma'i yul yin na de ni cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir mi slu bar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If non-existence is the object of valid cognition, it would not be non-deceptive because it does not exist in the least.

original: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩrang gi yul la gzhan gyis mi gnod pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rang gi yod pa'am /üîΩmed par gnyi ga'am /
analyzed: tshad ma'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // rang gi yul la gzhan gyis mi gnod pa ste zhes bya ba ni tshad ma rang gi yod pa'am / med par gnyi ga'am /
translated: The definition of a valid cognition is as follows.üîΩIt is not invalidated by another with regard to its own object.

original: gnyi ga ma yin par gzhag pa la tshad mas gzhan gyis mi gnod pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin par gzhag pa la tshad mas gzhan gyis mi gnod pa ste /
translated: It is not invalidated by another with regard to its own object, whether it posits existence or nonexistence, both, or neither.

original: de dang tshad ma slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang tshad ma slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: It does not deceive with regard to that.

original: slu bar mi byed pa de ni med par 'jog pa 'di'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la yod pa'i phyir med pa gzhal bar bya ba nyid du grub po //
analyzed: slu bar mi byed pa de ni med par 'jog pa 'di'i tshad ma'i mtshan nyid la yod pa'i phyir med pa gzhal bar bya ba nyid du grub po //
translated: Since that nondeception is the definition of a valid cognition, it is established that nonexistence is an object of comprehension.üîΩIf you say that nothing is nonexistent,

original: gal te med pa 'ga' yang med de zhes bya ba thams cad kyang rtag par yod pa nyid de zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag kyang ngo bo'i rang bzhin du mi gsal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te med pa 'ga' yang med de zhes bya ba thams cad kyang rtag par yod pa nyid de zhig pa dang ma skyes pa dag kyang ngo bo'i rang bzhin du mi gsal bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then everything exists permanently, because even that which has disintegrated and that which has not yet arisen exist, since they exist as the nature of entities, which is not manifest.üîΩSince all of the world exists in some way,

original: 'gro ba thams cad ji ltar yang ste gsal ba'am mi gsal ba ji ltar yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'gro ba thams cad ji ltar yang ste gsal ba'am mi gsal ba ji ltar yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: whether manifest or unmanifest,

original: gzhal bar bya ba'i yod pa kho na la 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba'i yod pa kho na la 'jug go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it engages only the existence of the object of comprehension,

original: gang ltar de yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa ste /üîΩgsal ba na sngar mi gsal ba yod pa'i rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de nyid la mi gsal ba med pa zhes bya zhing /
analyzed: gang ltar de yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam pa ste / gsal ba na sngar mi gsal ba yod pa'i rnam pa de ltar yod pa ma yin pa de nyid la mi gsal ba med pa zhes bya zhing /
translated: then it is a mode of nonexistence,üîΩbecause when it is manifest, it is not the mode of existence of the previously nonmanifest object.

original: zhig pa na yang mi gsal bar grub pas gsal ba'i rnam pa de med pa nyid la med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhig pa na yang mi gsal bar grub pas gsal ba'i rnam pa de med pa nyid la med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: And when it is destroyed, it is not the mode of existence of the nonmanifest object. Therefore, the nonexistence of that manifest mode is called nonexistence.

original: yang gang dag ri bong rva med ces smra ba la /
analyzed: yang gang dag ri bong rva med ces smra ba la /
translated: Moreover, when someone says that the rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist,

original: ri bong yang yod pa lang la sogs pa'i rva dag kyang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ri bong yang yod pa lang la sogs pa'i rva dag kyang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: because the rabbit exists and the horns of oxen and so on exist,üîΩthe statement ‚ÄúThe rabbit‚Äôs horns do not exist‚Äù is laughable.

original: ri bong rva med ces smra ba ni bzhad gang du byed pa de ni bdag nyid la bzhad gad du byed pa yin ste /
analyzed: ri bong rva med ces smra ba ni bzhad gang du byed pa de ni bdag nyid la bzhad gad du byed pa yin ste /
translated: That is a joke at one‚Äôs own expense,

original: de ltar ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'dir ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur ba'i rva 'gog gi ba lang la sogs pa'i rva tsam thams cad med par ni mi smra ba la'o //
analyzed: de ltar ri bong gi rva zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te 'dir ri bong gi yan lag tu gyur ba'i rva 'gog gi ba lang la sogs pa'i rva tsam thams cad med par ni mi smra ba la'o //
translated: because the statement ‚ÄúThe rabbit‚Äôs horns‚Äù and so on refers to the refutation of horns that are members of a rabbit, but it does not say that all horns of oxen and so on do not exist.

original: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba ste /
analyzed: ci zhes bya ba ni dri ba ste /
translated: is a question.üîΩWithout any connection, the word ‚Äúhaving horns‚Äù is distinguished.üîΩAnd in ‚Äúhaving horns,‚Äù the connection is distinguished as ‚Äúhaving horns‚Äù

original: 'brel ba khon med par bye brag tu byed la rva can zhes bya ba la yang rva dang ba lang la sogs pa'i rdzas bor nas 'brel ba zhig yod do zhes 'brel pa tsam yod par bye brag tu byed kyi rva la sogs pa la mi ltos samüîΩzhes bya ba'o //üîΩrva dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin yang rgyu ba lang gi rdzas dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin @289a * //
analyzed: 'brel ba khon med par bye brag tu byed la rva can zhes bya ba la yang rva dang ba lang la sogs pa'i rdzas bor nas 'brel ba zhig yod do zhes 'brel pa tsam yod par bye brag tu byed kyi rva la sogs pa la mi ltos sam zhes bya ba'o // rva dang rdzas kyi rang bzhin yang rgyu ba lang gi rdzas dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin @289a * //
translated: after discarding the substance of horns, cows, etc., but the mere connection exists.üîΩThe nature of horns and substance is established as separate,üîΩthe cause being the substance of the cow and the result being the nature of the horns.

original: so sor tha dad pa grub pa'i phyir tha dad pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gnas pa de nyid 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: so sor tha dad pa grub pa'i phyir tha dad pa rgyu dang 'bras bur gnas pa de nyid 'brel pa yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the mere connection is the cause and result of the horns and substance.üîΩFor that reason, why is it said, ‚ÄúThe horns of a rabbit do not exist‚Äù?

original: cis na ri bong gi rva med ces bya ba 'di la ri bong gi rdzas rva dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med do zhes smras pa yin /
analyzed: cis na ri bong gi rva med ces bya ba 'di la ri bong gi rdzas rva dag la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin med do zhes smras pa yin /
translated: In this case, it is said that the substance of a rabbit and the horns do not exist as cause and result.

original: rgyu cis na rdzas rva dag bor te 'brel pa nyi tshe med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la brten te gal te rva can ba lang dag dang de'i rva dang rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i bye brag yod la /
analyzed: rgyu cis na rdzas rva dag bor te 'brel pa nyi tshe med ces brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba la brten te gal te rva can ba lang dag dang de'i rva dang rang bzhin mi 'dra ba'i bye brag yod la /
translated: If it is said that the cow and its horn have different natures,üîΩthen the rabbit‚Äôs horn does not have the slightest nature that is different from the cow and its horn. The rabbit does not exist as a substance that is different from the cow.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,

original: ri bong rva la ni ba lang dang rva'i bye brag de lta bu rang bzhin cung zad kyang med de ri bong ni rdzas las gzhan ba lang ltar med do zhe na ;
analyzed: ri bong rva la ni ba lang dang rva'i bye brag de lta bu rang bzhin cung zad kyang med de ri bong ni rdzas las gzhan ba lang ltar med do zhe na ;
translated: then it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.

analyzed: gang zhig 'brel pa med do zhes bya bar 'dod pa yang /
translated: If it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,

analyzed: rang bzhin bye brag can rgyu dang 'bras bus 'brel pa de nyid med par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: then it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.

original: gal te 'brel pa med do zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa med do zhes brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: If it is said that they are not connected,üîΩthen it is asserted that the very connection of cause and effect that has a specific nature does not exist.üîΩIf it is said that they are

original: 'di ltar 'brel pa can ri bong gi rdzas nyid yod kyi 'brel pa can rva ni med pa'i phyir gnyis mi srid pa la 'brel zhes bya ba dgag par bya ba mi srid bas dgag pa 'brel med ces kyang mi brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'brel pa can ri bong gi rdzas nyid yod kyi 'brel pa can rva ni med pa'i phyir gnyis mi srid pa la 'brel zhes bya ba dgag par bya ba mi srid bas dgag pa 'brel med ces kyang mi brjod do zhe na /
translated: Thus, since the substance of the rabbit, which is the related object, exists, but the related object, the horn, does not exist, the two are impossible. Since the negation of a nonexistent object is impossible, one cannot say that the negation is unrelated.üîΩThe statement of the learned is reasonable.üîΩSince the two substances do not exist, that is the relation, and it is not suitable to say that it is unrelated.

original: mkhas pa'i tshig rigs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rdzas gnyis med pa de nyid 'brel pa yin la de la 'brel pa med ces brjod du mi rung bar yang smra bas bsgrub pas 'brel pa med pa yang yin la 'brel pa med pa nyid duüîΩgzhag par 'dod pas so //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i tshig rigs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba ni rdzas gnyis med pa de nyid 'brel pa yin la de la 'brel pa med ces brjod du mi rung bar yang smra bas bsgrub pas 'brel pa med pa yang yin la 'brel pa med pa nyid du gzhag par 'dod pas so //
translated: Since it is established by proof, it is also unrelated, and since it is asserted to be posited as unrelated,

original: 'o na ni med pa la ci zhig dgag ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ni med pa la ci zhig dgag ce na /
translated: what is the point of negating a nonexistent object?

original: 'brel pa brtags pas khas blangs pa de bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa brtags pas khas blangs pa de bkag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the relation is imagined, the negation of the assertion is nonexistent.

original: gal te khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa dang / 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyang med de ma 'brel pa'i ri bong gi rdzas gzhan 'ga' zhig go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khas blangs pa'i 'brel pa dang / 'brel pa can gyi rdzas kyang med de ma 'brel pa'i ri bong gi rdzas gzhan 'ga' zhig go zhe na /
translated: If the related object and the substance of the relation do not exist, but some other unrelated substance of the rabbit exists,

original: kho bo 'dod pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: kho bo 'dod pa nye bar gzhag pa yin te /
translated: I am the one who asserts this,

original: 'di ltar rva dang 'brel pa'i ri bong med ces pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rva dang 'brel pa'i ri bong med ces pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no rabbit connected to horns.

original: pha rol zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i mtha' mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i mtha' mdzad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe other‚Äù is the one who composes the treatise.

original: phan tshun 'gal bar 'grub cing rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa can gyi rtags gnyis chos can gcig la dus gcig tu 'jug pa'i 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can no //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal bar 'grub cing rang gi bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul pa can gyi rtags gnyis chos can gcig la dus gcig tu 'jug pa'i 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can no //
translated: The two reasons that establish mutually contradictory properties in one subject at one time are contradictory and nonerroneone.

original: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba nyid srid pa med pa la zhes bya ba ni med na mi @289b 'byung ba dang 'gal ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis zla dag tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba nyid srid pa med pa la zhes bya ba ni med na mi @289b 'byung ba dang 'gal ba sgrub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis zla dag tu 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThe possibility of contradictory nonerroneone‚Äù means that the reason that proves the absence of a relation of invariable concomitance is contradictory, because it is contradictory to the other.

original: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa srid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang rang bzhin dang mi dmigs pa las gzhan pa srid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is a possibility other than effect, nature, and nonapprehension,

original: mi 'khrul ba can gzhan ni mi srid do zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: mi 'khrul ba can gzhan ni mi srid do zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúanother nonerroneone is impossible.‚Äù

original: 'dir rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba can ni 'dod pa de ni rtags gsum pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dngos pos zhugs pa'i rtags la 'dir mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la mi 'khrul ba can ni 'dod pa de ni rtags gsum pa gzhan 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir dngos pos zhugs pa'i rtags la 'dir mi srid do //
translated: Here, the nonerroneous with respect to what is to be established is not any of the other three reasons, and therefore it is impossible for a reason based on fact to be present here.

original: 'o na gang la 'di srid ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang la 'di srid ce na /
translated: Well, then, where is it possible?

original: rang bzhin phyin ci log tu nye bar ston pa'i phyir de phan tshun 'gal bas khyab pa'i chos gnyis nye bar sbyor bar byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin phyin ci log tu nye bar ston pa'i phyir de phan tshun 'gal bas khyab pa'i chos gnyis nye bar sbyor bar byed pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is possible because it is the application of two properties that pervade each other, since that which teaches the opposite of the nature of something is contradictory with it.

original: de ltar na lung la brten te lung gi don de dpyad pa dag la 'gal ba dang / rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la yang mi 'khrul te lung gis tshul gsum sgrub pa nyid du stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na lung la brten te lung gi don de dpyad pa dag la 'gal ba dang / rang gis bsgrub par bya ba la yang mi 'khrul te lung gis tshul gsum sgrub pa nyid du stobs mtshungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, in dependence on scripture, the meaning of scripture is analyzed, and it is nonerroneous with respect to what is to be established, because scripture is just as powerful in establishing the three modes.

original: gang gis kyang sun dbyung bas gnod pa ni mi nus kyi 'on kyang phan tshun the tshom du byed pa'i phyir gags dag byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis kyang sun dbyung bas gnod pa ni mi nus kyi 'on kyang phan tshun the tshom du byed pa'i phyir gags dag byed pa'o //
translated: It cannot be refuted by anyone, but it is a hindrance because it creates mutual doubt.

original: thams cad du song ba zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid kyi ming ni rang gi rten ba lang dag dang des stong pa'i yul nam mkha'i phyogs la sogs pa thams cad du yod pa'o zhes bya bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du song ba zhes bya ba ni ba lang nyid kyi ming ni rang gi rten ba lang dag dang des stong pa'i yul nam mkha'i phyogs la sogs pa thams cad du yod pa'o zhes bya bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is present everywhere‚Äù means that the name ‚Äúox‚Äù exists in all places, such as the body of the ox itself, its support, and in the space that is empty of that.

original: gtan tshigs ni rang dang 'brel ba can yul thams cad na gnas pa dag dang cig car du mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni rang dang 'brel ba can yul thams cad na gnas pa dag dang cig car du mngon par 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The reason is ‚Äúbecause it is simultaneously related to all the places where it is present and to that which is related to it.‚Äù

original: spyi ba lang nyid dang 'brel pa can ba lang gi gsal ba khra bo dang 'phel rgyud phyogs thams cad na yod pa dag dang / cig car du mngon bar 'brel pa zhes pa ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la yod pa'i ba lang gi gsal ba dag kyang spyi ma bcad par 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: spyi ba lang nyid dang 'brel pa can ba lang gi gsal ba khra bo dang 'phel rgyud phyogs thams cad na yod pa dag dang / cig car du mngon bar 'brel pa zhes pa ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la yod pa'i ba lang gi gsal ba dag kyang spyi ma bcad par 'brel pa ste /
translated: The universal ‚Äúox‚Äù is simultaneously related to all the individual oxen that exist in all directions, and it is also related to the individual ox that exists in one place, without the universal being divided.

original: spyi ba lang nyid ni gcig pa cha shas gzhan dang phan tshun g-yo ba dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi ba lang nyid ni gcig pa cha shas gzhan dang phan tshun g-yo ba dang bral ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal ‚Äúox‚Äù is one and is free from parts and mutual movement.

original: de'i phyir gsal bas stong ba dag na yang spyi yod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gsal bas stong ba dag na yang spyi yod do //
translated: Therefore, even when the particulars are destroyed, the universal exists.

original: de ltar na ma yin na dum bur gyur pas gcig nyid nyams la gal te gcig po 'gro bas rim gyis gsal ba rnams dang 'brel pa ni g-yo ba'i bya ba can du yang 'gyur la cig car 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na ma yin na dum bur gyur pas gcig nyid nyams la gal te gcig po 'gro bas rim gyis gsal ba rnams dang 'brel pa ni g-yo ba'i bya ba can du yang 'gyur la cig car 'brel par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then because of being divided into parts, the universal would lose its oneness. If the one universal were to be related to the particulars gradually, then it would have the activity of movement, and it would not be related to all at once.

original: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin tsam @290a * //üîΩdang zhes bya ba smos te /üîΩba lang gi gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa can rang bzhin tsam ste /
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa can gyi rang bzhin tsam @290a * // dang zhes bya ba smos te / ba lang gi gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa can rang bzhin tsam ste /
translated: In order to explain that, he says, ‚Äúthe mere nature that is related to that . . .‚Äù

original: de la tha dad med de gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tha dad med de gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mere nature that is related to one particular cow is not different from that, because it is one.

original: rang bzhin de kha na dang yul dang rdzas so sor nges ba'i gsal ba thams cad rjes su 'brel pa'i gsal ba de thams cad kyi yul na spyi de nyid gnas pa yang yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin de kha na dang yul dang rdzas so sor nges ba'i gsal ba thams cad rjes su 'brel pa'i gsal ba de thams cad kyi yul na spyi de nyid gnas pa yang yin te /
translated: That nature is related to all particulars that are restricted to place, time, and substance. That universal exists in the place of all those particulars.

original: de'i phyir bar dag na yod par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bar dag na yod par 'dod pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is asserted to exist in between.

original: de las zlog na ni gang zhig gang na med pa de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de las zlog na ni gang zhig gang na med pa de ni zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you reverse that, then it is as you say, ‚Äúthat which does not exist in a certain place does not exist there.‚Äù

original: de gsal ba'i bar rnams na med na ni gsal ba ltar yul dang rdzas dang nges pa'i phyir gsal ba de'i yul na gsal ba gcig la yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gsal ba'i bar rnams na med na ni gsal ba ltar yul dang rdzas dang nges pa'i phyir gsal ba de'i yul na gsal ba gcig la yod pa'i bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin te /
translated: If it does not exist in the place of manifestation, then like the manifestation, it would not be the object, substance, or definition of that manifestation, and therefore it would not be pervaded by the nature of existing in the place of that manifestation, just as it is not pervaded by the nature of existing in the place of another manifestation.

original: dper na gsal ba dag bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: dper na gsal ba dag bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: For example, it is like the manifestations.

original: cig shos na re gal te nam mkha'i yul de bar snang na bum ba'i gzugs nyid kyi spyi bo yod pa ma yin yang bum pa'i gsal ba yul thams cad na gnas pa dag gi yul na gzugs nyid kyis khyab pa can ma yin nam /
analyzed: cig shos na re gal te nam mkha'i yul de bar snang na bum ba'i gzugs nyid kyi spyi bo yod pa ma yin yang bum pa'i gsal ba yul thams cad na gnas pa dag gi yul na gzugs nyid kyis khyab pa can ma yin nam /
translated: The other says: If the place of space is the interval, then the summit of form does not exist in the place of the vase, but is not the form that pervades the place of all the manifestations of the vase?

original: sogs pas ni autpala sngon po dri nyid kyi spyi yang bar na yod pa min yang autpala sngon po'i gsal ba yul thams cad la gnas pa dag gi yul na bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin nam zhes bya bas de'i yul na bdag nyid kyis khyab par
analyzed: sogs pas ni autpala sngon po dri nyid kyi spyi yang bar na yod pa min yang autpala sngon po'i gsal ba yul thams cad la gnas pa dag gi yul na bdag nyid kyis khyab pa ma yin nam zhes bya bas de'i yul na bdag nyid kyis khyab par
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù indicates that even though the universal of the mere smell of a blue lotus is not present in between, is it not the case that the particular blue lotus that is present in all places pervades those places with its own nature?

original: byed pa nyid bar na med pa nyid la 'jug pas ma nges pa smra'o //
analyzed: byed pa nyid bar na med pa nyid la 'jug pas ma nges pa smra'o //
translated: Thus, he claims that the response is indefinite because it is applied to the absence of something in between.

original: cig shos lan sbyin pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'du ba'i dag las zhes bya ba smra ste /
analyzed: cig shos lan sbyin pa ni yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'du ba'i dag las zhes bya ba smra ste /
translated: The other party‚Äôs response is ‚Äúfrom correct application and conjunction.‚Äù

original: de la yang dag par sbyor ba ni nam mkha'i zhes bya ba phyogs can dang phyogs bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa dag 'brel par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la yang dag par sbyor ba ni nam mkha'i zhes bya ba phyogs can dang phyogs bum pa la sogs pa tha dad pa dag 'brel par 'dod pa'o //
translated: In that, correct application is the desire for the connection of the different directions and the different vases, etc., that are called ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: 'du bas ni bum pa dang bum pa nyid bdag nyid cig car 'brel ba'o //
analyzed: 'du bas ni bum pa dang bum pa nyid bdag nyid cig car 'brel ba'o //
translated: Conjunction is the simultaneous connection of the vase and the vase itself.

original: des na bum pa'i gzugs nyid dang autpala'i dri nyid gcig yin yang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba thams cad 'brel pa dag smra ba ni bstan bcos te /
analyzed: des na bum pa'i gzugs nyid dang autpala'i dri nyid gcig yin yang 'brel pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba thams cad 'brel pa dag smra ba ni bstan bcos te /
translated: Therefore, although the form of a pot and the smell of an utpala flower are the same, it is the treatise that speaks of the clarity of all things in terms of their relationship, by the power of their connection.

original: drang srong gzegs can gyis bshad pa'i lung yin no //
analyzed: drang srong gzegs can gyis bshad pa'i lung yin no //
translated: This is the scripture explained by the sage Kanada.üîΩIn that case, although the form itself is not between the clarifications, it is related to all clarifications by the power of their connection.

original: de lta na ni gzugs nyid gcig gis gsal ba'i bar na med kyang 'du ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba mtha' dag dang 'brel par 'gyur mod kyi bstan bcos las blangs pa bzhag ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni gzugs nyid gcig gis gsal ba'i bar na med kyang 'du ba'i stobs kyis gsal ba mtha' dag dang 'brel par 'gyur mod kyi bstan bcos las blangs pa bzhag ste /
translated: But setting aside what is accepted in the treatises,

original: 'jig rten pa'i phyogs la bstan nas zhes bya ba mthong ba'i tshad ma la brten te @290b dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phyogs la bstan nas zhes bya ba mthong ba'i tshad ma la brten te @290b dpyod pa'o //
translated: it is seen that analysis is based on the worldly perspective.

original: gal te 'jig rten pa'i phyogs la brten na ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'jig rten pa'i phyogs la brten na ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If it is based on the worldly perspective, what is it like?

original: rnam par bcad pa dang rnam par ma bcad pa sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid du smras te zhes bya ba smra ste 'brel pa can dang 'brel bdag chad par snang ba dang ma chad par snang ba dag gis tha dad pa dang tha miüîΩdad pa'i 'brel par brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa dang rnam par ma bcad pa sna'i rnam par shes pa skye ba'i mtshan nyid du smras te zhes bya ba smra ste 'brel pa can dang 'brel bdag chad par snang ba dang ma chad par snang ba dag gis tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa'i 'brel par brjod do //
translated: The relation of difference and non-difference is expressed by the appearance of the cutting off of the related and the appearance of the non-cutting off of the unrelated.

original: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par 'brel ba grub ba dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'du ba dag gis 'brel par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par 'brel ba grub ba dag la go rims bzhin du yang dag par sbyor ba dang 'du ba dag gis 'brel par brjod pa'o //
translated: The relation of difference and non-difference being established, the relation is expressed by the correct application and the combination of the two, respectively.

original: de ltar lung las bstan ba bzhag ste /
analyzed: de ltar lung las bstan ba bzhag ste /
translated: Thus, the establishment of the universal is taught by scripture.

original: rigs pas 'ongs pa bcad pa des na spyi 'di rang gsal ba gcig la yod pa tsam de dang gsal ba gzhan mtha' dag dang 'brel ba can yin pa'i phyir bar rnams la yang gnas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pas 'ongs pa bcad pa des na spyi 'di rang gsal ba gcig la yod pa tsam de dang gsal ba gzhan mtha' dag dang 'brel ba can yin pa'i phyir bar rnams la yang gnas pa ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The proof is that this universal exists only in one manifest thing and is related to all other manifest things, and therefore it exists in the others as well.

original: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don tsam ste /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni don tsam ste /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it is related to that‚Äù is just a statement of fact.

original: cig car cha shas med par 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cig car cha shas med par 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are related without any intervening parts.

original: gal te zhes bya ba gang dag kha cig ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba gang dag kha cig ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: ‚Äú If‚Äù means ‚Äúif some‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúsome.‚Äù

original: gang gi rten la khyab par grub na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bar na med par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi rten la khyab par grub na zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bar na med par 'dod pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú If it is established as pervading its basis‚Äù means that it is asserted that there is nothing in between the manifestations.

original: des kyang de'i yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba gsal ba gcig gi yul na gnas pa'i spyi de nyid gzhan de dag gi yul na yang gnas par ce ste mi 'dod de /
analyzed: des kyang de'i yul na gnas pa zhes bya ba gsal ba gcig gi yul na gnas pa'i spyi de nyid gzhan de dag gi yul na yang gnas par ce ste mi 'dod de /
translated: Why not assert that the universal that exists in the domain of one manifestation also exists in the domain of the others?

original: de de ltar 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: de de ltar 'dod pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt that exactly what you assert?

original: de ltar 'dod na ni gsal ba'i bar na yang yod par khas blangs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dod na ni gsal ba'i bar na yang yod par khas blangs pa yin te /
translated: If you assert that, then you are accepting that it exists in between the manifestations,

original: spyi gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang g-yo ba yang med pas so //
analyzed: spyi gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir dang g-yo ba yang med pas so //
translated: because it is a single universal and because it does not move.

original: gal te spyi gsal ba gcig la 'brel nas yang yul gzhan na gnas pa dag dang rim gyis 'brel to zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi gsal ba gcig la 'brel nas yang yul gzhan na gnas pa dag dang rim gyis 'brel to zhe na /
translated: If the universal is related to one manifestation and then is related to those that exist in other domains in sequence,

original: bya ba med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bya ba med pas zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúBecause it is devoid of activity.‚Äù

original: phan tshun g-yo ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir rim gyis mi srid do //
analyzed: phan tshun g-yo ba'i bya ba med pa'i phyir rim gyis mi srid do //
translated: because there is no action of mutual movement.

original: gal ta gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa de g-yo ba med na ni gsal ba nyid la 'brel gyi bar na med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal ta gsal ba gcig dang 'brel pa de g-yo ba med na ni gsal ba nyid la 'brel gyi bar na med pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is related to one particular, and is not moving, then it is related to the particular itself, not to the universal.

original: gsal ba med pa'i yul gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i ba lang gi gsal ba'i dngos po skyes pa na spyi de sngar de na med pa'i phyir dang der 'gro ba yang smed pa'i phyir gsal ba de dang spyir 'brel par mi rigs pa'i phyir de ba lang
analyzed: gsal ba med pa'i yul gzhan du sngon ma byung ba'i ba lang gi gsal ba'i dngos po skyes pa na spyi de sngar de na med pa'i phyir dang der 'gro ba yang smed pa'i phyir gsal ba de dang spyir 'brel par mi rigs pa'i phyir de ba lang
translated: When a particular cow arises in a place where it did not exist before, because the universal did not exist there previously, and because it does not move there, it is not reasonable that it be related to that particular, and therefore

original: nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyid du mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it would not be established as a cow.

original: spyi rang gi rang bzhin gcig dang gsal ba thams cad 'brel pa ni bar na yod pa med na mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: spyi rang gi rang bzhin gcig dang gsal ba thams cad 'brel pa ni bar na yod pa med na mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: The universal, which has a single intrinsic nature related to all particulars, is not dependent on an intervening space.

original: nyi ma'i 'od kyi @291a * //
analyzed: nyi ma'i 'od kyi @291a * //
translated: The light of the sun

original: zhes bya ba gcig gis mang po dang 'brel pa ni bar stong pa dag na yang yod pas khyab pa'i yul bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gcig gis mang po dang 'brel pa ni bar stong pa dag na yang yod pas khyab pa'i yul bstan pa'o //
translated: is related to many things, even though there is empty space in between. This shows that the universal pervades its object.

original: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni spyi ni dbang pos gzung bar 'dod pas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa'i rig byar gyur ba la zhes bya ba ni spyi ni dbang pos gzung bar 'dod pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe object that is the basis of the perception‚Äù is the universal, because the sense faculty is held to apprehend the universal.

original: mngon par gsal ba'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par gsal ba'o zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe manifestation‚Äù is the direct perception.

original: gal te gsal ba yod pa'i yul na ni gsal ba de'i bar na ni mi gsal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba yod pa'i yul na ni gsal ba de'i bar na ni mi gsal lo zhe na /
translated: If the object that exists in the manifestation is in the manifestation, then it is not manifested in between.

original: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te spyi de ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te spyi de ni gcig nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause there is no difference,‚Äù because that universal is one.

original: gcig la gsal ba ltar zhes bya ba ba lang la gsal ba ltar ba lang de'i bar dag na yang gsal bar 'gyur te mi gsal bas stong pa ste ;
analyzed: gcig la gsal ba ltar zhes bya ba ba lang la gsal ba ltar ba lang de'i bar dag na yang gsal bar 'gyur te mi gsal bas stong pa ste ;
translated: ‚ÄúJust as it is manifested in one,‚Äù just as it is manifested in the cow, it would be manifested in between the cows, because it is empty of nonmanifestation.

original: gsal ba gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gcig pu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is one manifestation.

original: gal te bsgribs pa 'am gnas thag ring ba'i phyir mi gsal lo zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bsgribs pa 'am gnas thag ring ba'i phyir mi gsal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not manifested because it is obstructed or because the location is distant,

original: gcig nyid yin pa de'i phyir bsgribs pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pas kyang mi gsal bar mi rung ste /
analyzed: gcig nyid yin pa de'i phyir bsgribs pa yang ma yin la zhes bya ba ni bsgribs pas kyang mi gsal bar mi rung ste /
translated: then because it is one, it is not obstructed.

original: mi gsal ba stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gsal ba stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is empty of nonmanifestation.

original: gnas thag ring ba bas kyang bar du mi gsal bar mi rigs te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gnas thag ring ba bas kyang bar du mi gsal bar mi rigs te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is unreasonable for the universal to be less clear than the particulars, even if they are far away, as was explained earlier.

original: gal te bar na yod pa la mthong ba'i rgyu med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bar na yod pa la mthong ba'i rgyu med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the universal is not seen because it is obstructed,

original: mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyang dbang po dang rang gi rten gsal bar 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bdag nyid kyang dbang po dang rang gi rten gsal bar 'brel pa ste /
translated: the nature of the visible is that it is connected to the sense faculty and its support.

original: des spyi gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: des spyi gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: That makes the universal visible.

original: de ni spyi gcig pa nyid yin pa na yod pa 'di la yang yod de spyi tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rten 'du ba can te /
analyzed: de ni spyi gcig pa nyid yin pa na yod pa 'di la yang yod de spyi tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi phyir rten 'du ba can te /
translated: If the universal is one, then it exists in this one that exists, because there is no difference in the universal.

original: 'du ba ma 'brel pa yang ma yin pa ste bar na gnas pa ma 'brel la gsal ba gnas pa 'brel pa ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du ba ma 'brel pa yang ma yin pa ste bar na gnas pa ma 'brel la gsal ba gnas pa 'brel pa ni gcig nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not that the connection of the support is not connected, because the obstruction of the one that exists in between is not connected, and the connection of the one that exists without obstruction is not one.üîΩIf the particulars that exist in the universal are not connected to the sense faculty,

original: gal te spyi'i yul na gnas pa'i gsal ba dang / dbang po'i sbyor ba la mi gsal ba ltos na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i yul na gnas pa'i gsal ba dang / dbang po'i sbyor ba la mi gsal ba ltos na /
translated: and the connection of the sense faculty is not connected to the universal,üîΩthen the universal is not seen.

original: spyi de rten dang yul mtshungs pa ni mthong ba bar na gnas pa yul mi mtshungs pa ni mi mthong bas na rten dang mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi de rten dang yul mtshungs pa ni mthong ba bar na gnas pa yul mi mtshungs pa ni mi mthong bas na rten dang mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The universal is seen to be the same as its basis when the object is the same, but it is not seen when the object is not the same. Thus, it is the same as its basis and not the same as its basis.üîΩIt is also said to be contradictory.

original: 'gal ba yang brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yul mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa spyi gcig la 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa gcig la the tshom skyed par byed do zhes bya bar spyi gcig par na gnas pa dang / mi gnas par the tshom skyed par byed do //
analyzed: 'gal ba yang brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba ni yul mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa spyi gcig la 'gal ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa gcig la the tshom skyed par byed do zhes bya bar spyi gcig par na gnas pa dang / mi gnas par the tshom skyed par byed do //
translated: It is not only the same object and not the same object that are contradictory in one universal, but also one universal that is both the same and not the same object generates doubt.

original: 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa can nyid gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa nges pa'i chos gnyis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos dang 'brel pa can nyid gnyis zhes bya ba ni 'gal bas khyab pa nges pa'i chos gnyis so //
translated: The two that are related to contradictory properties are the two properties that are ascertained to be pervaded by contradiction.

original: de yang 'dir ni rang gi ngo bo tsam dang cig car mtha' dag 'brel pa dang dbang pos gzung bar bya ba dag go //
