analyzed: de yang 'dir ni rang gi ngo bo tsam dang cig car mtha' dag 'brel pa dang dbang pos gzung bar bya ba dag go //
translated: And here, it is the mere intrinsic nature, the simultaneous relation of all, and the apprehension by the sense faculties.

original: gcig la @291b de dag med do zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba'i rtags kyi dngos pos 'jug pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la @291b de dag med do zhes bya ba ni chos can gcig la 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba'i rtags kyi dngos pos 'jug pa med pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúone does not have those‚Äù means that there is no engagement by means of a reason that is nonerronetically contradictory with respect to one subject.

original: gal te de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa las 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos byas pa'i phyir zhes bya ba dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa las 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can bstan pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then how is it that DignƒÅga, the master, taught a nonerroneous contradiction in the case of the engagement by the power of the fact in ‚Äúbecause of being produced‚Äù?

original: slob dpon gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says ‚ÄúThe master said . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar ma byas par gnyi ga yang lung las grags par mtshungs pa tsam du dgongs nas gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs tsam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i stobs kyis zhugs pa'o zhes bya bar ma byas par gnyi ga yang lung las grags par mtshungs pa tsam du dgongs nas gsungs pa'o //
translated: He said this thinking that the mere similarity of both being renowned from scripture is not the engagement by the power of the fact.

original: 'dir gzhan dag ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos dgongs pa 'di ltar 'dren te slob dpon gyis dper brjod pa ni legs par rdzogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhan dag ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos dgongs pa 'di ltar 'dren te slob dpon gyis dper brjod pa ni legs par rdzogs pa yin te /
translated: Here others draw out the thought of DignƒÅga, the master, in the following way: The master‚Äôs example is complete.

original: bya ba nyid gtan tshigs yin la sgra nyid 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid yin par ston par bzhed pas so zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bya ba nyid gtan tshigs yin la sgra nyid 'gal ba mi 'khrul ba can zhes bya ba gtan tshigs ltar snang ba nyid yin par ston par bzhed pas so zhes zer ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúitself‚Äù is the reason, and the word ‚Äúcontradictory‚Äù is a pseudo-reason.üîΩThe word ‚Äúitself‚Äù indicates that sound is a particular that is differentiated from the universal sound, that this universal is perceptible by the sense faculties, and that this very universal is the reason.

original: sgra nyid ces bya ba sgra spyi'i gsal ba las ldog pa can de tha dad pa dang / spyi de nyid dbang pos rtogs par bya ba dang / de nyid rtags de gsum po 'di dag ni bye brag pa dang dpyod pa 'di'i tshad ma ma yin pas 'jug ste khas len pa'o //
analyzed: sgra nyid ces bya ba sgra spyi'i gsal ba las ldog pa can de tha dad pa dang / spyi de nyid dbang pos rtogs par bya ba dang / de nyid rtags de gsum po 'di dag ni bye brag pa dang dpyod pa 'di'i tshad ma ma yin pas 'jug ste khas len pa'o //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika and NaiyƒÅyika accept these three as valid means of knowledge.

original: gal te byas pa nyid bye brag pa'i lung las grags pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te byas pa nyid bye brag pa'i lung las grags pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If you say that because ‚Äúbeing produced‚Äù is known from the Vai≈õe·π£ika scriptures,

original: gnyi ga mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yin no zhe na ;üîΩbyas pa'i gnas skabs kyang zhes bya ba ni byas pa'i rang bzhin ni lung la mi brten te /
analyzed: gnyi ga mtshungs pa'i phyir 'gal ba mi 'khrul pa can yin no zhe na ; byas pa'i gnas skabs kyang zhes bya ba ni byas pa'i rang bzhin ni lung la mi brten te /
translated: it is contradictory and inconclusive because both are the same,üîΩwe say that the state of being produced is not based on scripture.

original: lung med pa dag gis kyang tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir lung las bkod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: lung med pa dag gis kyang tshad mas rtogs pa'i phyir lung las bkod pa ma yin no //
translated: The nature of being produced is not based on scripture because it is understood by valid knowledge even by those who do not have scripture, and it is not established from scripture.

original: de'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not similar.

original: gal te sgra nyid kyang dngos po ste gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra nyid kyang dngos po ste gzung bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If sound itself is a thing that is apprehended,

original: bsgrub par bya ba yang 'brel pa las yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yang 'brel pa las yin na zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that the probandum is related to the reason.

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid ces bya ba sgra nyid tshad mas grub tu chug na yang rtag pa dang 'brel pa ni nam yang grub pa med de /
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid ces bya ba sgra nyid tshad mas grub tu chug na yang rtag pa dang 'brel pa ni nam yang grub pa med de /
translated: Even if it is allowed that sound itself is established by valid cognition as that which is heard, still, the relation of sound to permanence is never established.

original: de dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yang med de brtags par ldog pa med pa la ldog pa mi srid la de med na rjes su 'gro ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dmigs pa'i phyir dang / rtag pa la rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa yang med de brtags par ldog pa med pa la ldog pa mi srid la de med na rjes su 'gro ba yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And, because that is observed, there is no ascertainment of the pervasion of permanence by sound, because if there is no negation of the imagined, the negation is impossible, and if that is absent, the positive concomitance is not established.

original: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu byed pa dang / dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dag bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rab tu byed pa dang / dam bca' ba dang gtan tshigs dag bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the definition of inference for others, the thesis, and the reason,

original: da ni dpe'i rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni dpe'i rab tu byed pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to teach the example,

original: gtan tshigs mtshan nyid gsum nyid phyir//
analyzed: gtan tshigs mtshan nyid gsum nyid phyir//
translated: it is said: ‚ÄúBecause the reason has the three characteristics.‚Äù

original: @292a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: @292a * // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.üîΩ

original: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i rgyu'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa'i rgyu'o //
translated: The reason is the cause of understanding the proposition.

original: de tsam gyis rjes su dpag pa skyed nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis rjes su dpag pa skyed nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that alone is capable of generating inference.

original: dpe dag logs shig mi brjod do //
analyzed: dpe dag logs shig mi brjod do //
translated: Examples are not stated separately.

original: 'di ltar dpe ni gtan tshigs kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin gyi rtags logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'di ltar dpe ni gtan tshigs kyi khongs su 'dus pa yin gyi rtags logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: In this way, examples are included within the reason, and the evidence is not established separately.

original: / de tsam gyis don rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de rjes su dpag pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: / de tsam gyis don rtogs pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bsgrub par bya ba rtogs pa de rjes su dpag pa skye ba'o //
translated: Because the meaning is understood by that alone, the understanding of the proposition is the generation of inference.

original: gal te dpe logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ma yin pas dpe'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ci ste mi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dpe logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ma yin pas dpe'i mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i phyir ci ste mi bstan zhe na /
translated: If examples are not established separately, why are they not taught in order to understand the definition of an example?

original: don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa de nyid kyis dpe'i mtshan nyid kyang rtogs par nus pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa de nyid kyis dpe'i mtshan nyid kyang rtogs par nus pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the meaning is understood, the definition of the reason itself is capable of understanding the definition of an example.

original: 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid ni /
translated: The definition of a reason is as follows:

original: bye brag med par zhes bya ba de las byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pas ma phye bar ro //
analyzed: bye brag med par zhes bya ba de las byung ba dang de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel pas ma phye bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout distinction‚Äù means that the relation is not distinguished as being one of identity or causality.üîΩ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù means that it is not possible to teach the definition of a universal in any other way than the teaching of an example.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa las gzhan du spyi'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang / de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa 'am /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni dpe bstan pa las gzhan du spyi'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs la med pa dang / de'i 'bras bu nyid du nges pa 'am /
translated: The existence of the reason in similar instances and its nonexistence in dissimilar instances are taught as the ascertainment of its being the effect of that or

original: rang bzhin gyis khyab pa dag bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis khyab pa dag bstan par mi nus te /
translated: as the pervasion by its nature.

original: 'di ltar tshang bang la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ka dmigs na 'brel pa 'dzin pa de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro bar go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshang bang la sogs pa rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis ka dmigs na 'brel pa 'dzin pa de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro bar go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, when both the cause and effect are observed, such as a smoke and fire, the relation is apprehended and one understands their invariable concomitance.

original: 'brel pa la sogs gnyi ga med na ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: 'brel pa la sogs gnyi ga med na ldog par rtogs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: When neither is observed, one understands their invariable concomitance in the negative.

original: /'di yang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa 'di yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i don bstan pa na ste /
analyzed: /'di yang zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid bstan pa 'di yang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i don bstan pa na ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThis also‚Äù refers to the teaching of the definition of a reason.

original: tshang bar dang gzhan lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: tshang bar dang gzhan lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni dpe'i mtshan nyid bstan pa yin te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúlike a complete example‚Äù and so on teaches the definition of an example.

original: dpe'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba la tshang bar lta bu'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyi ga nges par brjod pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa la gnyi ga med par nges par bstan pa de tsam du zad pas so //
analyzed: dpe'i mtshan nyid rjes su 'gro ba la tshang bar lta bu'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang / sgrub par byed pa gnyi ga nges par brjod pa dang 'brel pa la sogs pa la gnyi ga med par nges par bstan pa de tsam du zad pas so //
translated: The definition of an example is that it is complete in that it is ascertained to have both the property of the thesis and the property of the reason, and it is incomplete in that it is ascertained to have neither of those two.üîΩThose also clarify the faults of an example.

original: de dag gis dpe'i skyon rnams kyang gsal ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dpe'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyig yod par nges shing cig shos ni gnyi ga med par nges par rjes su 'gro ba dang /
analyzed: de dag gis dpe'i skyon rnams kyang gsal ba yin te zhes bya ba ni dpe'i mtshan nyid mthun pa'i dpe ni bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa gnyig yod par nges shing cig shos ni gnyi ga med par nges par rjes su 'gro ba dang /
translated: A concordant example is one that is ascertained to have both the property of the thesis and the property of the reason. A discordant example is one that is ascertained to have neither of those two.

original: ldog pa nges pa can du bstan ba nyid kyis mthun pa'i dpe la ma tshang ngam ma nges sam /
analyzed: ldog pa nges pa can du bstan ba nyid kyis mthun pa'i dpe la ma tshang ngam ma nges sam /
translated: The mere teaching of the ascertainment of the pervasion by the forward and reverse inclusions is sufficient.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang na dpe ma yin no zhes don gyis rtogs te dpe don mi byed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩcig shos kyang gnyi ga med par ma gyur tam ma nges sam /üîΩldog pa med dam /üîΩma @292b bstan na dpe ltar snang ba'o zhes rtogs te rang gi don mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma tshang na dpe ma yin no zhes don gyis rtogs te dpe don mi byed pa'i phyir ro // cig shos kyang gnyi ga med par ma gyur tam ma nges sam / ldog pa med dam / ma @292b bstan na dpe ltar snang ba'o zhes rtogs te rang gi don mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.

original: de'i tshul la reg min nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa'o //üîΩde la ma reg pa ni de'i rang bzhin mi ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i tshul la reg min nyid 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang 'brel pa'o // de la ma reg pa ni de'i rang bzhin mi ldan pa'o //
translated: The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.

original: de lta bu'i shes par 'dod pa'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba dag dang ma 'brel phyir na don med pa'o //üîΩgal te chos can bsgrub par bya ba dag dang 'brel na ni /üîΩgtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu'i shes par 'dod pa'i chos dang bsgrub par bya ba dag dang ma 'brel phyir na don med pa'o // gal te chos can bsgrub par bya ba dag dang 'brel na ni / gtan tshigs kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.

original: dpe zhes ming tsam la dgag pa med do //
analyzed: dpe zhes ming tsam la dgag pa med do //
translated: The word like is understood implicitly in the other case as well, because the example does not function if the similarity is not present or is uncertain.üîΩ The word like is understood implicitly in the other

original: gal te rang bzhin de dag mi ldan na ni sgrub par byed pa'i don med do //
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin de dag mi ldan na ni sgrub par byed pa'i don med do //
translated: If it is not endowed with those natures, then the proof is meaningless.

original: chos can dang ma 'brel par bsgrub par bya ba dang / ma 'brel bas ni 'dod pa rtogs pa med de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can dang ma 'brel par bsgrub par bya ba dang / ma 'brel bas ni 'dod pa rtogs pa med de ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the probandum is not related to the subject, and if the reason is not related to it, then the desired understanding will not occur, because it would be absurd.

original: gal te khyod ci ltar na yang dpe'i phyogs kyi chos ston pa ni ma yin nam zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te khyod ci ltar na yang dpe'i phyogs kyi chos ston pa ni ma yin nam zhe na ;
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow is it that you do not teach the property of the example?‚Äù

original: bden te 'di phyogs dang ma 'brel //
analyzed: bden te 'di phyogs dang ma 'brel //
translated: It is true that it is not related to the subject.

original: zhes smos pa ni de'i gtan tshigs las logs shig tu sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes smos pa ni de'i gtan tshigs las logs shig tu sgrub par byed par 'gyur ba dgag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is not related to the subject‚Äù is made in order to refute the idea that it is a proof that is separate from the reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba la sgrub par byed pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid gsum dang bral ba la sgrub par byed pa mi srid do zhes bstan pa'i don du'o //
translated: The point is to show that it is impossible to prove something that lacks the three characteristics of a reason.

original: dpe gtan tshigs las logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dpe gtan tshigs las logs shig tu sgrub par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: The example is not a proof that is separate from the reason.

original: de ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
analyzed: de ni gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid shes par bya ba'i yan lag yin la /
translated: It is a part of the understanding of the characteristics of a reason.

original: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas ni bsgrub par bya ba khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas ni bsgrub par bya ba khong du chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one understands the probandum by understanding the definition of the reason.

original: gzhan du gal te gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul ba'i chos nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang / log pa dag dang 'brel pa gnyis dpe yis rab tu mi ston na /
analyzed: gzhan du gal te gtan tshigs kyi mi 'khrul ba'i chos nyid rjes su 'gro ba dang / log pa dag dang 'brel pa gnyis dpe yis rab tu mi ston na /
translated: Otherwise, if the example did not show the two relations of the reason, namely, its invariable concomitance and its absence in the absence of the probandum,

original: bsgrub par bya ba bsgrubs pas dpe des ci zhig phan bar byed de /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba bsgrubs pas dpe des ci zhig phan bar byed de /
translated: what would be the point of the example, since the probandum has already been established?

original: 'di ltar dpe de chos can dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba'i rgya mtshor me bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dpe de chos can dang ma 'brel pa'i phyir tshang bang du mthong ba'i du ba'i rgya mtshor me bzhin no //
translated: For the example would not be related to the subject, just as the smoke seen in a kitchen is not related to the subject, fire on the mountain.

original: gal te nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad ma ni dpe yin te /üîΩ'di ltar ba men ma rtogs pa la rtags sbyar ba med par ba men ba lang 'dra ba'o zhes bstan pa ni ba men gyi rnam pa rtogs pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nye bar 'jal ba'i tshad ma ni dpe yin te / 'di ltar ba men ma rtogs pa la rtags sbyar ba med par ba men ba lang 'dra ba'o zhes bstan pa ni ba men gyi rnam pa rtogs pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the example is the analogical inference,üîΩfor instance, when one infers the presence of a cow from the presence of horns,üîΩthen in the case of the inference of fire from smoke, the example would be the perception of smoke and fire together in a kitchen.

original: de la yang ba men rtogs pa ni med kyi ba lang gi rang bzhin can gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: de la yang ba men rtogs pa ni med kyi ba lang gi rang bzhin can gyi rnam pa 'ba' zhig go //
translated: But in that case, the example would not show the invariable concomitance of smoke and fire, since the kitchen is not related to the mountain.

original: gal te rva can la sogs pa rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir rtogs so zhen /üîΩ'ga' zhig gi 'dra ba tsam gyis bdag nyid gzhan ba lang las tha dad pa'i chos kyang /
analyzed: gal te rva can la sogs pa rnam pa 'dra ba'i phyir rtogs so zhen / 'ga' zhig gi 'dra ba tsam gyis bdag nyid gzhan ba lang las tha dad pa'i chos kyang /
translated: If you think that you understand the cow because of the similarity of the cow with the cow,üîΩthen you would not be able to understand the cow as a separate entity from the non-cow, because of the similarity of the cow with the non-cow.

original: so sor nges par nye bar 'jal bas bsgrub par 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: so sor nges par nye bar 'jal bas bsgrub par 'gyur ba med do //
translated: And you would not be able to establish the cow as a separate entity from the non-cow, because of the similarity of the cow with the non-cow.

original: 'di ltar don rnams la tshul gang dag kyang cung zad dam mang ba ji ltar mi 'dra ba ni med de dum pa @293a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar don rnams la tshul gang dag kyang cung zad dam mang ba ji ltar mi 'dra ba ni med de dum pa @293a * //
translated: In this way, there is no difference whatsoever in the mode of existence of things, whether they are few or many.

original: dang ; ba men du yang gzugs nyid dang // shes bya nyid la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir //
analyzed: dang ; ba men du yang gzugs nyid dang // shes bya nyid la sogs pa 'dra ba'i phyir //
translated: For example, a cow is similar to a gavaya because of the similarity of form, the similarity of being an object of knowledge, and so on.

original: des ba men nye bar 'jal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ba men nye bar 'jal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the gavaya is understood through the cow.

original: gal te cung zad 'dra bas bdag nyid thams cad mtshungs par rtogs na ni /
analyzed: gal te cung zad 'dra bas bdag nyid thams cad mtshungs par rtogs na ni /
translated: If you understand the cow as similar in all aspects because of a slight similarity,

original: sna tshogs thams cad kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sna tshogs thams cad kyi bdag nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then the cow would have the nature of all varieties,

original: cung zad mi 'dra ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cung zad mi 'dra ba ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference whatsoever.

original: gal te de lta yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that this is so,

original: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: that is also unreasonable.

original: mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pas gnod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is contradicted by perception and so on.

original: 'dra ba tsam thams cad ni sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin te /üîΩde'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba des mngon par khyab pa ste nges pa yod pa'i khyab par bya ba'i chos kyi 'brel pa ste /
analyzed: 'dra ba tsam thams cad ni sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag ma yin te / de'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba des mngon par khyab pa ste nges pa yod pa'i khyab par bya ba'i chos kyi 'brel pa ste /
translated: A mere similarity is not a part of the proof,üîΩbecause the probandum is not pervaded by that.üîΩTherefore, the possession of the property to be pervaded, which is the relation of the pervader to the pervaded,

original: khyab par byed pa la rag las pa'i dngos po de dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: khyab par byed pa la rag las pa'i dngos po de dang ldan pa ste /
translated: is the possession of the reason by the property of the nature, which is the relation of the pervader to the pervaded.

original: rang bzhin de dang gtan tshigs dang ldan par dpes rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin de dang gtan tshigs dang ldan par dpes rab tu ston pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the example illustrates the possession of the reason by the property of the nature,üîΩthe similarity that illustrates the pervasion is called the example.

original: khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i 'dra ba dpe zhes bya ba de khon sgrub pa'i yan lag ste /
analyzed: khyab pa rab tu ston pa'i 'dra ba dpe zhes bya ba de khon sgrub pa'i yan lag ste /
translated: That is a part of the proof.üîΩMoreover, it is said to be a part of the proof of the definition of the reason, because it is indirectly a part of the proof by the method of the reason.

original: de yang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag gi tshul gyis brgyud pas sgrub par byed par brjod kyi dpe dngos su bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i yan lag gi tshul gyis brgyud pas sgrub par byed par brjod kyi dpe dngos su bsgrub par bya ba'i rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: But the example is not a direct part of the proof of the probandum.

original: des na dpe 'di mngon par sgrub par byed pa rang rgyud ba ma yin te /
analyzed: des na dpe 'di mngon par sgrub par byed pa rang rgyud ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, this example is not an autonomous proof.

original: de ma 'brel pa na zhes bya ba dpe de chos can la ma 'brel na ste 'brel pa ma yin pas don med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de ma 'brel pa na zhes bya ba dpe de chos can la ma 'brel na ste 'brel pa ma yin pas don med pa can yin no //
translated: If it is not related, then that example is not related to the subject, because it is not related. Therefore, it is meaningless.

original: yang na gtan tshigs de dpes 'brel pa ma bstan dpe nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba kho na bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir don med pa can yin no //
analyzed: yang na gtan tshigs de dpes 'brel pa ma bstan dpe nyid kyis bsgrub par bya ba kho na bsgrub par mi nus pa'i phyir don med pa can yin no //
translated: Or, if the reason is not shown to be related by the example, then the example itself is not able to prove what is to be proven. Therefore, it is meaningless.

original: gal te gtan tshigs de 'brel pa bsgrub na ni /
analyzed: gal te gtan tshigs de 'brel pa bsgrub na ni /
translated: If the reason is established as related,

original: de nyid kyis phyogs rtogs pa'i phyir dpe logs shig tu don byed pa med pa can yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis phyogs rtogs pa'i phyir dpe logs shig tu don byed pa med pa can yin no //
translated: then, because the position is understood by that alone, the example is useless.

original: rtogs pa'i tshig gi don brgyad de mngon sum dang der snang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i tshig gi don brgyad de mngon sum dang der snang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of the words ‚Äúunderstood‚Äù is the eight, such as direct perception and the appearance of that.

original: de yang le'u dang pos ni mngon sum dang mngon sum ltar snang ba gnyis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang le'u dang pos ni mngon sum dang mngon sum ltar snang ba gnyis bstan to //
translated: Moreover, the first chapter teaches the two, direct perception and the appearance of direct perception.

original: gnyis pas ni rjes su dpag pa dang / der snang ba gnyis so //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni rjes su dpag pa dang / der snang ba gnyis so //
translated: The second teaches the two, inference and the appearance of that.

original: gsum pas ni sgrub pa dang / der snang ba dang / sun 'byin pa ngo bo dang / der snang ba dag bstan pa las drug bshad zin pas /
analyzed: gsum pas ni sgrub pa dang / der snang ba dang / sun 'byin pa ngo bo dang / der snang ba dag bstan pa las drug bshad zin pas /
translated: The third explains the refutation that appears there, and the sixth explains the refutation that appears there.

original: da ni sun 'byin pa der snang ba dag bshad par bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni sun 'byin pa der snang ba dag bshad par bzhed nas /
translated: Now, wishing to explain the refutation that appears there,

original: ma tshang ba la sogs pa brjod pa sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ma tshang ba la sogs pa brjod pa sun 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe expression of incompleteness and so on is called refutation.‚Äù

original: mtshang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'gal bdag gi dbye ba rgyas par bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: mtshang ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni ma grub pa dang / ma nges pa dang / 'gal bdag gi dbye ba rgyas par bstan pa rnams so //
translated: ‚Äú Incompleteness and so on‚Äù refers to the extensive explanation of the divisions of the unestablished, the indefinite, and the contradictory.

original: de dag rjod par byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni rgol ba gang sgrub pa mtshang ba la sogs pa smra ba des /
analyzed: de dag rjod par byed pa ni zhes bya ba ni rgol ba gang sgrub pa mtshang ba la sogs pa smra ba des /
translated: ‚Äú That which expresses them‚Äù refers to the opponent who states the incompleteness and so on of the proof.

original: smra @293b pan phyir rgol bas de kho na ltar phyir rjod par byed pa ste /
analyzed: smra @293b pan phyir rgol bas de kho na ltar phyir rjod par byed pa ste /
translated: The proponent of the argument repeats that exactly as it was stated.

original: mtshang ba la mchad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par brjod na /
analyzed: mtshang ba la mchad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa phyin ci ma log par brjod na /
translated: If he correctly states ‚Äúthe incompleteness‚Äù and so on,

original: phyir rgol gyis brjod pa de dag ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: phyir rgol gyis brjod pa de dag ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: the opponent‚Äôs statement is called a ‚Äúrefutation.‚Äù

original: tshig des ni pha rol de rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa la gegs byed pa'i nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig des ni pha rol de rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i don grub pa la gegs byed pa'i nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse indicates that the opponent‚Äôs desired object is established by the power of the refutation.

original: gal te skyon ma brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brjod par 'dod pa grub pa la gegs byed do zhes brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: gal te skyon ma brjod kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni brjod par 'dod pa grub pa la gegs byed do zhes brjod pa de ni mi rigs te /
translated: The opponent might say, ‚ÄúEven if you do not state a fault, you still create an obstacle to my establishing what I want to establish.‚Äù

original: don de nyid ma tshang ba la sogs par gnas pas mi nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: don de nyid ma tshang ba la sogs par gnas pas mi nus pa yin gyi /
translated: To this we reply that it is illogical to say this, because the opponent‚Äôs inability to establish what he wants to establish is due to his not having the necessary resources, such as a complete understanding of the object.

original: brjod pas mi nus par mi byed snyam pa'i klan ka'o //
analyzed: brjod pas mi nus par mi byed snyam pa'i klan ka'o //
translated: The opponent‚Äôs inability is not due to our inability to state a refutation.

original: skyes bu'i nus pa grub po zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs pa can dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa can nyid kyis skyes bu'i bye brag gis rang gi 'dod pa grub par mi nus pa dang / gzhan dgag par 'dod pa nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyes bu'i nus pa grub po zhes bya ba ni log par rtogs pa can dang / yang dag pa'i shes pa can nyid kyis skyes bu'i bye brag gis rang gi 'dod pa grub par mi nus pa dang / gzhan dgag par 'dod pa nus pa'i phyir /
translated: The opponent might say, ‚ÄúIt is established that there are two types of people, those who have a wrong understanding and those who have a correct understanding, because there are those who are unable to establish their own desired object and those who are able to refute others‚Äô desired object.‚Äù

original: rtsod pa 'phen pa dang rgyal ba'i bye brag ni brjod pas grub ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa 'phen pa dang rgyal ba'i bye brag ni brjod pas grub ste /
translated: The opponent might say, ‚ÄúThe difference between the challenger and the one challenged is established by stating it.‚Äù

original: sgrub pa sun 'byin pa dag gis pham pa dang / rgyal ba dag gi nus de yang brjod pa las gzhan gyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa sun 'byin pa dag gis pham pa dang / rgyal ba dag gi nus de yang brjod pa las gzhan gyis mi 'grub pa'i phyir brjod pa ni sun 'byin pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Refutation is the expression of the power of the refutation and proof, because it is not established by anything other than expression.

original: de yang skyon de lta bur rjod par byed pa ste /üîΩma tshang ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa smras zin pa ni phyir rgol bas kyang ma tshang ba la sogs pa nyid skyon brjod zin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang skyon de lta bur rjod par byed pa ste / ma tshang ba la sogs pa'i sgrub pa smras zin pa ni phyir rgol bas kyang ma tshang ba la sogs pa nyid skyon brjod zin pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, it is the expression of such faults.üîΩThe proponent's statement of incomplete proof and so on is refuted by the opponent's expression of the fault of incompleteness and so on.

original: yang rgol bas yongs su rdzogs par smra ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang rgol bas yongs su rdzogs par smra ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The proponent's complete statement and so on is refuted by the opponent's expression of the fault of completeness and so on.

original: gzhan du bsgrub pa la sogs pas legs par 'jog par byed na /
analyzed: gzhan du bsgrub pa la sogs pas legs par 'jog par byed na /
translated: If the proponent properly posits the proof and so on in a different way,

original: phyir rgol bas skyon brjod pas des rgol ba'i 'dod pa phyi ma'i gags mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir rgol bas skyon brjod pas des rgol ba'i 'dod pa phyi ma'i gags mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the opponent's expression of the fault does not obstruct the proponent's later assertions.

original: sgrub par byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because it is another proof.

original: snga ma'i mtshan nyid yin na de grub par byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma'i mtshan nyid yin na de grub par byed pa gzhan yin pa'i phyir /
translated: If it has the former characteristics, it is another proof because it establishes that.

original: snga ma'i gags byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snga ma'i gags byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it obstructs the former,

original: sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sun 'byin pa nyid yin no //
translated: it is a refutation.

original: phyogs snga ma smra bar 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: phyogs snga ma smra bar 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: When the opponent is ready to speak,

original: tshang bar 'dod pa la sogs pas smra ba'i bsam pa rdzogs pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur na ni /
analyzed: tshang bar 'dod pa la sogs pas smra ba'i bsam pa rdzogs pa'i phyir smra bar 'dod pa dang bcas par gyur na ni /
translated: that is, when he is ready to speak with the intention of completing what he wants to say,

original: bar der ma tshang ba la sogs pa skyon brjod kyang skabs ma yin pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bar der ma tshang ba la sogs pa skyon brjod kyang skabs ma yin pa'i phyir sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
translated: then even if you point out his faults, such as incompleteness, it is not a refutation, because it is not the appropriate occasion.üîΩWhen the opponent‚Äôs speech is complete,

original: ngag gnas par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma smra ba ni brjod par 'dod pa rdzogs par gyur na'o //
analyzed: ngag gnas par gyur pa na zhes bya ba ni phyogs snga ma smra ba ni brjod par 'dod pa rdzogs par gyur na'o //
translated: that is, when the opponent‚Äôs speech, which is what he wants to say, is finished,

original: de lta bas na khyed smra ba yongs su rdzogs sam zhes dris te /
analyzed: de lta bas na khyed smra ba yongs su rdzogs sam zhes dris te /
translated: then you should ask, ‚ÄúIs your speech complete?‚Äù

original: rdzogs so zhe na sun 'byin par brjod par bya'o //üîΩgzhan du na sun @294a * //
analyzed: rdzogs so zhe na sun 'byin par brjod par bya'o // gzhan du na sun @294a * //
translated: If he says, ‚ÄúIt is complete,‚Äù then you should state your refutation.

original: 'byin pa ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byin pa ltar snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be a pseudo-refutation.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ngag gnas par gyur pa na de la skyon brjod pa ni de grub par bya ba la sun 'byin pa nyid do zhes gsungs te //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ngag gnas par gyur pa na de la skyon brjod pa ni de grub par bya ba la sun 'byin pa nyid do zhes gsungs te //
translated: Therefore, when speech is established, the expression of faults is itself a refutation in order to establish it.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: But not otherwise,

original: de nyid der snang ba ste sun 'byin pa'i gnas su sbyar la sun mi phyin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid der snang ba ste sun 'byin pa'i gnas su sbyar la sun mi phyin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that appears there, i.e., as a refutation, but is not a refutation.

original: der snang ba ni ltag chod de sun 'byin pa'i gnas su smra ba sun 'byin par mi nus pa ste nyes pa ma yin pa brjod pa'o //üîΩde'i phyir / nyes pa nye bar brjod min pa //
analyzed: der snang ba ni ltag chod de sun 'byin pa'i gnas su smra ba sun 'byin par mi nus pa ste nyes pa ma yin pa brjod pa'o // de'i phyir / nyes pa nye bar brjod min pa //
translated: That appearance is a quibble, i.e., one who speaks as if it were a refutation, but is unable to refute, i.e., is not a fault-finder.üîΩTherefore, he says,

original: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba gsungs so //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not the expression of a fault.‚Äù

original: gal te ltag chod kyi rab tu byed pa ni grangs nges par thub pa rkang mig la sogs pas bstan na de 'dir ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltag chod kyi rab tu byed pa ni grangs nges par thub pa rkang mig la sogs pas bstan na de 'dir ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
translated: If the quibble is taught by the Conqueror, e.g., PƒÅ·πáini, etc., as a definite number, why is it not taught here?üîΩHe says,

original: log pa'i lam la mtha' med nyid //
analyzed: log pa'i lam la mtha' med nyid //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause the wrong path is limitless,

original: phyir na de 'dir spros mi bya //üîΩzhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: phyir na de 'dir spros mi bya // zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: one should not elaborate it here.‚Äù

original: mtha' med yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: mtha' med yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it limitless?

original: log pa'i lam gyi rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la mtha' med de 'dod rgyal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa'i lam gyi rgyu tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag la mtha' med de 'dod rgyal du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The causes of the wrong path are incorrect thoughts, which are limitless because they are engaged in randomly.

original: ji skad smra ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni thub pa rkang mig gis smras pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad smra ba'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba ni thub pa rkang mig gis smras pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The characteristic of what is said is the characteristic spoken of by the sage PƒÅ·πáini.

original: ltag chod de dag gi nang du yang mi 'du bas na gzhan yin no //
analyzed: ltag chod de dag gi nang du yang mi 'du bas na gzhan yin no //
translated: Since it is not included among those refutations, it is different.

original: 'on te sun 'byin pa yin na yang lhag pa'i ltag chong tu mi 'gyur na de sun 'byin pa'i nang du yang mi 'du sta /
analyzed: 'on te sun 'byin pa yin na yang lhag pa'i ltag chong tu mi 'gyur na de sun 'byin pa'i nang du yang mi 'du sta /
translated: But if it is a refutation, it is not a special refutation, and it is not included among refutations.

original: 'di ltar nyes pa nye bar mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes pa nye bar mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not state a fault.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: bdag med ces bya ba sgra'i don rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni mi 'gog par de la skur pa mi 'debs kyi /
analyzed: bdag med ces bya ba sgra'i don rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni mi 'gog par de la skur pa mi 'debs kyi /
translated: The object of the conception of the meaning of the term ‚Äúselflessness‚Äù is not refuted, and it is not denied.

original: 'on kyang bdag khas len pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag khas len pa nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: But it is also not the case that the self is accepted.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i phyir don du bdag med do zhes 'gog pa'i phyir med ces bya ba'i smra ba dang mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de'i phyir don du bdag med do zhes 'gog pa'i phyir med ces bya ba'i smra ba dang mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, since it is negated by saying ‚Äúthere is no self in terms of its own characteristic,‚Äù it is not inconsistent with the statement ‚Äúit does not exist.‚Äù

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i bdag sgra'i don ci'i phyir mi 'gog ce na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i bdag sgra'i don ci'i phyir mi 'gog ce na /
translated: Why does he not negate the self that appears to conceptual thought?

original: de ni bsgrub par mi 'dod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don las phyi rol tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ni bsgrub par mi 'dod pa'i phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i don las phyi rol tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyogs kyi mtshan nyid kyis bstan zin to //
translated: Since it is not being proven, it is not the probandum, and since it is not the probandum, it is not the property of the subject, as has already been explained.

original: de mi 'dod pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de mi 'dod pa yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not being proven?

original: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag ni phyi'i kho na la gtad nas bkag pa dang / bsgrub pa'i tha snyad dag byed de don byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u 'di nyid du bstan zin to //
analyzed: rtog pa dang ldan pa dag ni phyi'i kho na la gtad nas bkag pa dang / bsgrub pa'i tha snyad dag byed de don byed pa dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes le'u 'di nyid du bstan zin to //
translated: It has already been explained in this chapter that those who have conceptual thought engage in the conventions of negation and proof only in terms of external things, because they are related to the performance of function.

original: de'i blo la snang ba yod mod kyi de btang snyoms su byas nas /
analyzed: de'i blo la snang ba yod mod kyi de btang snyoms su byas nas /
translated: Although it does appear to the mind, it is ignored.

original: des don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des don byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not perform a function.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni ma ning gi gzugs la rtogs pa mi byed do zhes so //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i skyes bu ni ma ning gi gzugs la rtogs pa mi byed do zhes so //
translated: A man who has a desire does not have a concept of the form of a eunuch.

original: gal te gang yang rung ba'i shan tsam gyis zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa'i @294b gnas su rjes su brjod pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam gyis ltag chod smra ba dag gi khongs su 'du na'o //
analyzed: gal te gang yang rung ba'i shan tsam gyis zhes bya ba sun 'byin pa'i @294b gnas su rjes su brjod pa la sogs pa cung zad tsam gyis ltag chod smra ba dag gi khongs su 'du na'o //
translated: If one is included in the class of those who speak nonsense merely by the fact of his speaking nonsense, even a little, such as repeating after someone else,

original: mi mtshungs pa ste 'du bar mi 'dod pa ltag chod kyang cung zad 'dra ba'i phyir phan tshun 'du bar 'gyur la de lta na ni dbye ba ngas par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mi mtshungs pa ste 'du bar mi 'dod pa ltag chod kyang cung zad 'dra ba'i phyir phan tshun 'du bar 'gyur la de lta na ni dbye ba ngas par 'grub bo //
translated: then there would be mutual inclusion, because even nonsense, which is not accepted as being included, is similar in some small way. And in that case, the distinction would be established.

original: de lta bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid sun 'phyi nang ltar snang ba na ltag chod do zhes so //
analyzed: de lta bas na spyi'i mtshan nyid sun 'phyi nang ltar snang ba na ltag chod do zhes so //
translated: Therefore, when a general characteristic is refuted, it is nonsense to say that it is nonsense.

original: khyad par nang gi bye brag dag ni khongs su mi 'du ba'i phyir /
analyzed: khyad par nang gi bye brag dag ni khongs su mi 'du ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the particular distinctions are not included.

original: de log pa'i rtog pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de log pa'i rtog pa sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the variety of false concepts.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid de yang sun 'byin pa ltag chod do zhes snga ma ltar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid de yang sun 'byin pa ltag chod do zhes snga ma ltar brjod par bya'o //
translated: And that general characteristic should be said to be nonsense, as before.

original: gal te ltag chod kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ci'i phyir rgyas par mi bstan zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ltag chod kyi spyi'i mtshan nyid kyang ci'i phyir rgyas par mi bstan zhe na /
translated: Why does he not also extensively teach the general definition of a reductio?

original: sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa sngar rgyas par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa nyid kyis lan ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang bde blag tu rtogs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgrub pa dang sun 'byin pa sngar rgyas par bstan pa'i mtshan nyid shes pa nyid kyis lan ltar snang ba'i mtshan nyid kyang bde blag tu rtogs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because one can easily understand the definition of a pseudo-reductio by understanding the definitions of proof and refutation that were previously taught extensively.

original: tshang bang la sogs pa yul yin pa la der brjod par zhugs pa la ni sun 'byin pa yin te /
analyzed: tshang bang la sogs pa yul yin pa la der brjod par zhugs pa la ni sun 'byin pa yin te /
translated: If one is engaged in the expression of a reductio, then it is a refutation,

original: rang gi yul la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi yul la zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it engages its object.

original: gal te skyon med pa'am yod kyang brjod pa ma yin pa ltag chod kyi yul ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gal te skyon med pa'am yod kyang brjod pa ma yin pa ltag chod kyi yul ma yin pa ste /
translated: If it is without fault or if it has fault but is not expressed, then it is not the object of a reductio,

original: de la sun 'byin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sun 'byin pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a refutation does not engage it.

original: de ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sun 'byin pa ltar snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is a pseudo-refutation.

original: de ltar yul la ma zhugs pa des ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i rtogs pa'i gegs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar yul la ma zhugs pa des ni rgol ba'i 'dod pa'i rtogs pa'i gegs mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not engage its object, it does not block the opponent's understanding of what he wishes to understand.

original: sun 'byin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sun 'byin pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not a refutation,üîΩbecause it does not engage its object.

original: de'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i gags byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro ;üîΩ/ don 'di rigs phyir mdo ni yod pa'i lugs gzigs pa'i lung ni rnam par ma spangs pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa'i gags byed pas stong pa'i phyir ro ; / don 'di rigs phyir mdo ni yod pa'i lugs gzigs pa'i lung ni rnam par ma spangs pa zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: because it is empty of the obstruction to the realization of its reality.

original: bdag gi slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs ma spangs par te lung dang mthun par gzhung 'dir bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i lugs ma spangs par te lung dang mthun par gzhung 'dir bshad do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: The scriptures of the master who sees the way things are are not abandoned, i.e., the scriptures of my master, Dignaga, are not abandoned, and in this treatise I explain them in accordance with the scriptures.

original: de ltar na slob dpon gyi lung nyid bdag gis blangs kyi slob dpon gyi rnam par bshad pa byed pa dag la ni ltos pa med de /üîΩde dag mi rigs par smra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar na slob dpon gyi lung nyid bdag gis blangs kyi slob dpon gyi rnam par bshad pa byed pa dag la ni ltos pa med de / de dag mi rigs par smra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, I have taken the scriptures of the master himself, but I do not rely on the commentaries of the masters, because they speak irrationally.

original: de'i phyir mdo ni don yod lugs zhes bya ba gzhan dag gis bshad pa'i 'grel pa dag ni mdo ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir mdo ni don yod lugs zhes bya ba gzhan dag gis bshad pa'i 'grel pa dag ni mdo ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the scriptures are the way things are, and the commentaries of others are not the scriptures.

original: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi lung kho na blangs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir slob dpon gyi lung kho na blangs te /
translated: Therefore, I take only the scriptures of the master,

original: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs pa dang ldan pa'i don ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach the meaning in a rational way.

original: don yod ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi mdo don yod pa ste /
analyzed: don yod ces bya ba ni slob dpon gyi mdo don yod pa ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúpurpose‚Äù means the purpose of the treatise.

original: 'bras bu med pa cung zad kyang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa cung zad kyang med ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that there is not even the slightest result that is not included in the treatise.

original: lugs ni de'i rigs pa'i gzhung lugs so //
analyzed: lugs ni de'i rigs pa'i gzhung lugs so //
translated: ‚Äú System‚Äù means the system of reasoning of the treatise.üîΩ‚Äú View‚Äù means the view of the treatise.

original: gzigs pa ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bdag gis rtogs par bya phyir zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzigs pa ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos bdag gis rtogs par bya phyir zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äú In order for me to understand‚Äù means in order for the master DignƒÅga to understand.

original: bdag nyid dang @295a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang @295a * //
translated: ‚Äú For myself‚Äù means for his own sake.

original: 'jig rten gzhan dag gis so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gzhan dag gis so //
translated: ‚Äú And for the world‚Äù means for the sake of others.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i'o //üîΩdri med blo yis te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni mdo'i'o // dri med blo yis te /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù refers to the purpose of the treatise.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i'o //
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i'o //
translated: ‚Äú With a stainless intellect‚Äù refers to the master DignƒÅga.

original: de ltar na dri med blo yi mdo dgongs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na dri med blo yi mdo dgongs pa zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, ‚Äúthe treatise with a stainless intellect‚Äù is the intended meaning of the title.

original: nges par 'di nyid yin te zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dir kho 'os bshad pa ltar ro //
analyzed: nges par 'di nyid yin te zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dir kho 'os bshad pa ltar ro //
translated: ‚Äú This is certain‚Äù is the meaning of the title.

original: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa dag gis bshad pa ltar nim yin te ;
analyzed: de ltar na rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa dag gis bshad pa ltar nim yin te ;
translated: Thus, the treatise is not as it is explained by our own and other schools.

original: de dag ni rigs par smra la /
analyzed: de dag ni rigs par smra la /
translated: They are not reasonable.

original: mdo'i don ni rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de yang slob dpon blo dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mdo'i don ni rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de yang slob dpon blo dri ma med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The meaning of the sutra is that the bodhisattva is endowed with the lineage and that he is endowed with stainless mind.

original: gzhan dag gis bshad pa ltar yin na ni mdo yang rigs pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis bshad pa ltar yin na ni mdo yang rigs pa dang ldan par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were as others explain it, the sutra would not be endowed with reason.

original: blo dri ma med par mi 'gyur te mi rigs pa'i don rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo dri ma med par mi 'gyur te mi rigs pa'i don rjod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the mind would not be stainless, because it would express a meaning that is not reasonable.

original: gal te khyed kho nas rigs pa rtogs par ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyed kho nas rigs pa rtogs par ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask, How is it that you alone understand the reason?

original: ma bsgoms blo can skye bos rtogs ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma bsgoms blo can skye bos rtogs ma yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is not understood by people whose minds are untrained.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa gang dag ma byangs  pa'i blo can dag gis slob dpon dri ma med pa'i blo mnga' ba'i dgongs pa rtogs par mi nus kyi /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi sde pa gang dag ma byangs  pa'i blo can dag gis slob dpon dri ma med pa'i blo mnga' ba'i dgongs pa rtogs par mi nus kyi /
translated: It is not understood by those of our and other schools whose minds are untrained, that is, by those who do not have the stainless mind of the master Nagarjuna.üîΩBut it is understood by those who are born again and again, who are born with trained minds.

original: gang dag skye ba nas skye ba rnams su sbyangs pa'i skye bos rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar bdag nyid ni skye ba dang / skye ba rnams su blo bsgoms pa dang ldan par ston to //
analyzed: gang dag skye ba nas skye ba rnams su sbyangs pa'i skye bos rtogs pa yin no zhes bya bar bdag nyid ni skye ba dang / skye ba rnams su blo bsgoms pa dang ldan par ston to //
translated: Thus he shows that he himself is endowed with a mind trained in life after life.

original: de ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i rab tu byed pa rnams kyi don gyi tshul dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i rab tu byed pa rnams kyi don gyi tshul dag phyin ci ma log par rtogs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the Prakara·πáa of the master DignƒÅga is understood without error.

original: slob dpon gyi don rab tu byed pa nyid yin gyi bshad pa byed ba dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
analyzed: slob dpon gyi don rab tu byed pa nyid yin gyi bshad pa byed ba dag las ni ma yin no zhes bya bar ston to //
translated: The meaning of the master is the Prakara·πáa itself, not the commentaries.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyis shin tu yun ring por goms pa ched che bar byas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyis shin tu yun ring por goms pa ched che bar byas pa'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Moreover, it is said that this is through the power of having cultivated it for a very long time, having made it very important.

original: rtog ge ngan pa'i stobs kyis rnam dag rigs pa'i bad ma 'di /
analyzed: rtog ge ngan pa'i stobs kyis rnam dag rigs pa'i bad ma 'di /
translated: This lotus of pure reasoning,üîΩopened by the sunbeams of explanation,

original: kha 'byed tshig bshad nyi zer dag gis rab tu gsal byas las //
analyzed: kha 'byed tshig bshad nyi zer dag gis rab tu gsal byas las //

original: ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar bdag gis thob des 'jig rten kun //
analyzed: ston ka'i zla ba ltar dkar bdag gis thob des 'jig rten kun //
translated: By this, may I attain the light of the world,

original: snang byed ye shes dpal bzang bdag nyid thob pas dga' bar shog / tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las /
analyzed: snang byed ye shes dpal bzang bdag nyid thob pas dga' bar shog / tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las /

analyzed: gzhan gyi don rjes su dpag pa'i le'u ste gsum pa'o /
